    3846             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3847             : /*                                                                           */
    3848             : /*  poolzero()   Set all of a pool's fields to zero.                         */
    3849             : /*                                                                           */
    3850             : /*  This procedure should never be called on a pool that has any memory      */
    3851             : /*  allocated to it, as that memory would leak.                              */
    3852             : /*                                                                           */
    3853             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3854             : 
    3855             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    3856             : void poolzero(struct memorypool *pool)
    3857             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3858           0 : void poolzero(pool)
    3859             : struct memorypool *pool;
    3860             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3861             : 
    3862             : {
    3863           0 :   pool->firstblock = (VOID **) NULL;
    3864           0 :   pool->nowblock = (VOID **) NULL;
    3865           0 :   pool->nextitem = (VOID *) NULL;
    3866           0 :   pool->deaditemstack = (VOID *) NULL;
    3867           0 :   pool->pathblock = (VOID **) NULL;
    3868           0 :   pool->pathitem = (VOID *) NULL;
    3869           0 :   pool->alignbytes = 0;
    3870           0 :   pool->itembytes = 0;
    3871           0 :   pool->itemsperblock = 0;
    3872           0 :   pool->itemsfirstblock = 0;
    3873           0 :   pool->items = 0;
    3874           0 :   pool->maxitems = 0;
    3875           0 :   pool->unallocateditems = 0;
    3876           0 :   pool->pathitemsleft = 0;
    3877           0 : }
    3878             : 
    3879             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3880             : /*                                                                           */
    3881             : /*  poolrestart()   Deallocate all items in a pool.                          */
    3882             : /*                                                                           */
    3883             : /*  The pool is returned to its starting state, except that no memory is     */
    3884             : /*  freed to the operating system.  Rather, the previously allocated blocks  */
    3885             : /*  are ready to be reused.                                                  */
    3886             : /*                                                                           */
    3887             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3888             : 
    3889             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    3890             : void poolrestart(struct memorypool *pool)
    3891             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3892           0 : void poolrestart(pool)
    3893             : struct memorypool *pool;
    3894             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3895             : 
    3896             : {
    3897             :   size_t alignptr;
    3898             : 
    3899           0 :   pool->items = 0;
    3900           0 :   pool->maxitems = 0;
    3901             : 
    3902             :   /* Set the currently active block. */
    3903           0 :   pool->nowblock = pool->firstblock;
    3904             :   /* Find the first item in the pool.  Increment by the size of (VOID *). */
    3905           0 :   alignptr = (size_t) (pool->nowblock + 1);
    3906             :   /* Align the item on an `alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    3907           0 :   pool->nextitem = (VOID *)
    3908           0 :     (alignptr + (size_t) pool->alignbytes -
    3909           0 :      (alignptr % (size_t) pool->alignbytes));
    3910             :   /* There are lots of unallocated items left in this block. */
    3911           0 :   pool->unallocateditems = pool->itemsfirstblock;
    3912             :   /* The stack of deallocated items is empty. */
    3913           0 :   pool->deaditemstack = (VOID *) NULL;
    3914           0 : }
    3915             : 
    3916             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3917             : /*                                                                           */
    3918             : /*  poolinit()   Initialize a pool of memory for allocation of items.        */
    3919             : /*                                                                           */
    3920             : /*  This routine initializes the machinery for allocating items.  A `pool'   */
    3921             : /*  is created whose records have size at least `bytecount'.  Items will be  */
    3922             : /*  allocated in `itemcount'-item blocks.  Each item is assumed to be a      */
    3923             : /*  collection of words, and either pointers or floating-point values are    */
    3924             : /*  assumed to be the "primary" word type.  (The "primary" word type is used */
    3925             : /*  to determine alignment of items.)  If `alignment' isn't zero, all items  */
    3926             : /*  will be `alignment'-byte aligned in memory.  `alignment' must be either  */
    3927             : /*  a multiple or a factor of the primary word size; powers of two are safe. */
    3928             : /*  `alignment' is normally used to create a few unused bits at the bottom   */
    3929             : /*  of each item's pointer, in which information may be stored.              */
    3930             : /*                                                                           */
    3931             : /*  Don't change this routine unless you understand it.                      */
    3932             : /*                                                                           */
    3933             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3934             : 
    3935             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    3936             : void poolinit(struct memorypool *pool, int bytecount, int itemcount,
    3937             :               int firstitemcount, int alignment)
    3938             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3939           0 : void poolinit(pool, bytecount, itemcount, firstitemcount, alignment)
    3940             : struct memorypool *pool;
    3941             : int bytecount;
    3942             : int itemcount;
    3943             : int firstitemcount;
    3944             : int alignment;
    3945             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3946             : 
    3947             : {
    3948             :   /* Find the proper alignment, which must be at least as large as:   */
    3949             :   /*   - The parameter `alignment'.                                   */
    3950             :   /*   - sizeof(VOID *), so the stack of dead items can be maintained */
    3951             :   /*       without unaligned accesses.                                */
    3952           0 :   if (alignment > sizeof(VOID *)) {
    3953           0 :     pool->alignbytes = alignment;
    3954             :   } else {
    3955           0 :     pool->alignbytes = sizeof(VOID *);
    3956             :   }
    3957           0 :   pool->itembytes = ((bytecount - 1) / pool->alignbytes + 1) *
    3958           0 :                     pool->alignbytes;
    3959           0 :   pool->itemsperblock = itemcount;
    3960           0 :   if (firstitemcount == 0) {
    3961           0 :     pool->itemsfirstblock = itemcount;
    3962             :   } else {
    3963           0 :     pool->itemsfirstblock = firstitemcount;
    3964             :   }
    3965             : 
    3966             :   /* Allocate a block of items.  Space for `itemsfirstblock' items and one  */
    3967             :   /*   pointer (to point to the next block) are allocated, as well as space */
    3968             :   /*   to ensure alignment of the items.                                    */
    3969           0 :   pool->firstblock = (VOID **)
    3970           0 :     trimalloc(pool->itemsfirstblock * pool->itembytes + (int) sizeof(VOID *) +
    3971           0 :               pool->alignbytes);
    3972             :   /* Set the next block pointer to NULL. */
    3973           0 :   *(pool->firstblock) = (VOID *) NULL;
    3974           0 :   poolrestart(pool);
    3975           0 : }
    3976             : 
    3977             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3978             : /*                                                                           */
    3979             : /*  pooldeinit()   Free to the operating system all memory taken by a pool.  */
    3980             : /*                                                                           */
    3981             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3982             : 
    3983             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    3984             : void pooldeinit(struct memorypool *pool)
    3985             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3986           0 : void pooldeinit(pool)
    3987             : struct memorypool *pool;
    3988             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    3989             : 
    3990             : {
    3991           0 :   while (pool->firstblock != (VOID **) NULL) {
    3992           0 :     pool->nowblock = (VOID **) *(pool->firstblock);
    3993           0 :     trifree((VOID *) pool->firstblock);
    3994           0 :     pool->firstblock = pool->nowblock;
    3995             :   }
    3996           0 : }
    3997             : 
    3998             : /*****************************************************************************/
    3999             : /*                                                                           */
    4000             : /*  poolalloc()   Allocate space for an item.                                */
    4001             : /*                                                                           */
    4002             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4003             : 
    4004             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4005             : VOID *poolalloc(struct memorypool *pool)
    4006             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4007           0 : VOID *poolalloc(pool)
    4008             : struct memorypool *pool;
    4009             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4010             : 
    4011             : {
    4012             :   VOID *newitem;
    4013             :   VOID **newblock;
    4014             :   size_t alignptr;
    4015             : 
    4016             :   /* First check the linked list of dead items.  If the list is not   */
    4017             :   /*   empty, allocate an item from the list rather than a fresh one. */
    4018           0 :   if (pool->deaditemstack != (VOID *) NULL) {
    4019           0 :     newitem = pool->deaditemstack;               /* Take first item in list. */
    4020           0 :     pool->deaditemstack = * (VOID **) pool->deaditemstack;
    4021             :   } else {
    4022             :     /* Check if there are any free items left in the current block. */
    4023           0 :     if (pool->unallocateditems == 0) {
    4024             :       /* Check if another block must be allocated. */
    4025           0 :       if (*(pool->nowblock) == (VOID *) NULL) {
    4026             :         /* Allocate a new block of items, pointed to by the previous block. */
    4027           0 :         newblock = (VOID **) trimalloc(pool->itemsperblock * pool->itembytes +
    4028             :                                        (int) sizeof(VOID *) +
    4029           0 :                                        pool->alignbytes);
    4030           0 :         *(pool->nowblock) = (VOID *) newblock;
    4031             :         /* The next block pointer is NULL. */
    4032           0 :         *newblock = (VOID *) NULL;
    4033             :       }
    4034             : 
    4035             :       /* Move to the new block. */
    4036           0 :       pool->nowblock = (VOID **) *(pool->nowblock);
    4037             :       /* Find the first item in the block.    */
    4038             :       /*   Increment by the size of (VOID *). */
    4039           0 :       alignptr = (size_t) (pool->nowblock + 1);
    4040             :       /* Align the item on an `alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    4041           0 :       pool->nextitem = (VOID *)
    4042           0 :         (alignptr + (size_t) pool->alignbytes -
    4043           0 :          (alignptr % (size_t) pool->alignbytes));
    4044             :       /* There are lots of unallocated items left in this block. */
    4045           0 :       pool->unallocateditems = pool->itemsperblock;
    4046             :     }
    4047             : 
    4048             :     /* Allocate a new item. */
    4049           0 :     newitem = pool->nextitem;
    4050             :     /* Advance `nextitem' pointer to next free item in block. */
    4051           0 :     pool->nextitem = (VOID *) ((char *) pool->nextitem + pool->itembytes);
    4052           0 :     pool->unallocateditems--;
    4053           0 :     pool->maxitems++;
    4054             :   }
    4055           0 :   pool->items++;
    4056           0 :   return newitem;
    4057             : }
    4058             : 
    4059             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4060             : /*                                                                           */
    4061             : /*  pooldealloc()   Deallocate space for an item.                            */
    4062             : /*                                                                           */
    4063             : /*  The deallocated space is stored in a queue for later reuse.              */
    4064             : /*                                                                           */
    4065             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4066             : 
    4067             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4068             : void pooldealloc(struct memorypool *pool, VOID *dyingitem)
    4069             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4070           0 : void pooldealloc(pool, dyingitem)
    4071             : struct memorypool *pool;
    4072             : VOID *dyingitem;
    4073             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4074             : 
    4075             : {
    4076             :   /* Push freshly killed item onto stack. */
    4077           0 :   *((VOID **) dyingitem) = pool->deaditemstack;
    4078           0 :   pool->deaditemstack = dyingitem;
    4079           0 :   pool->items--;
    4080           0 : }
    4081             : 
    4082             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4083             : /*                                                                           */
    4084             : /*  traversalinit()   Prepare to traverse the entire list of items.          */
    4085             : /*                                                                           */
    4086             : /*  This routine is used in conjunction with traverse().                     */
    4087             : /*                                                                           */
    4088             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4089             : 
    4090             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4091             : void traversalinit(struct memorypool *pool)
    4092             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4093           0 : void traversalinit(pool)
    4094             : struct memorypool *pool;
    4095             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4096             : 
    4097             : {
    4098             :   size_t alignptr;
    4099             : 
    4100             :   /* Begin the traversal in the first block. */
    4101           0 :   pool->pathblock = pool->firstblock;
    4102             :   /* Find the first item in the block.  Increment by the size of (VOID *). */
    4103           0 :   alignptr = (size_t) (pool->pathblock + 1);
    4104             :   /* Align with item on an `alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    4105           0 :   pool->pathitem = (VOID *)
    4106           0 :     (alignptr + (size_t) pool->alignbytes -
    4107           0 :      (alignptr % (size_t) pool->alignbytes));
    4108             :   /* Set the number of items left in the current block. */
    4109           0 :   pool->pathitemsleft = pool->itemsfirstblock;
    4110           0 : }
    4111             : 
    4112             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4113             : /*                                                                           */
    4114             : /*  traverse()   Find the next item in the list.                             */
    4115             : /*                                                                           */
    4116             : /*  This routine is used in conjunction with traversalinit().  Be forewarned */
    4117             : /*  that this routine successively returns all items in the list, including  */
    4118             : /*  deallocated ones on the deaditemqueue.  It's up to you to figure out     */
    4119             : /*  which ones are actually dead.  Why?  I don't want to allocate extra      */
    4120             : /*  space just to demarcate dead items.  It can usually be done more         */
    4121             : /*  space-efficiently by a routine that knows something about the structure  */
    4122             : /*  of the item.                                                             */
    4123             : /*                                                                           */
    4124             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4125             : 
    4126             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4127             : VOID *traverse(struct memorypool *pool)
    4128             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4129           0 : VOID *traverse(pool)
    4130             : struct memorypool *pool;
    4131             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4132             : 
    4133             : {
    4134             :   VOID *newitem;
    4135             :   size_t alignptr;
    4136             : 
    4137             :   /* Stop upon exhausting the list of items. */
    4138           0 :   if (pool->pathitem == pool->nextitem) {
    4139           0 :     return (VOID *) NULL;
    4140             :   }
    4141             : 
    4142             :   /* Check whether any untraversed items remain in the current block. */
    4143           0 :   if (pool->pathitemsleft == 0) {
    4144             :     /* Find the next block. */
    4145           0 :     pool->pathblock = (VOID **) *(pool->pathblock);
    4146             :     /* Find the first item in the block.  Increment by the size of (VOID *). */
    4147           0 :     alignptr = (size_t) (pool->pathblock + 1);
    4148             :     /* Align with item on an `alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    4149           0 :     pool->pathitem = (VOID *)
    4150           0 :       (alignptr + (size_t) pool->alignbytes -
    4151           0 :        (alignptr % (size_t) pool->alignbytes));
    4152             :     /* Set the number of items left in the current block. */
    4153           0 :     pool->pathitemsleft = pool->itemsperblock;
    4154             :   }
    4155             : 
    4156           0 :   newitem = pool->pathitem;
    4157             :   /* Find the next item in the block. */
    4158           0 :   pool->pathitem = (VOID *) ((char *) pool->pathitem + pool->itembytes);
    4159           0 :   pool->pathitemsleft--;
    4160           0 :   return newitem;
    4161             : }
    4162             : 
    4163             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4164             : /*                                                                           */
    4165             : /*  dummyinit()   Initialize the triangle that fills "outer space" and the   */
    4166             : /*                omnipresent subsegment.                                    */
    4167             : /*                                                                           */
    4168             : /*  The triangle that fills "outer space," called `dummytri', is pointed to  */
    4169             : /*  by every triangle and subsegment on a boundary (be it outer or inner) of */
    4170             : /*  the triangulation.  Also, `dummytri' points to one of the triangles on   */
    4171             : /*  the convex hull (until the holes and concavities are carved), making it  */
    4172             : /*  possible to find a starting triangle for point location.                 */
    4173             : /*                                                                           */
    4174             : /*  The omnipresent subsegment, `dummysub', is pointed to by every triangle  */
    4175             : /*  or subsegment that doesn't have a full complement of real subsegments    */
    4176             : /*  to point to.                                                             */
    4177             : /*                                                                           */
    4178             : /*  `dummytri' and `dummysub' are generally required to fulfill only a few   */
    4179             : /*  invariants:  their vertices must remain NULL and `dummytri' must always  */
    4180             : /*  be bonded (at offset zero) to some triangle on the convex hull of the    */
    4181             : /*  mesh, via a boundary edge.  Otherwise, the connections of `dummytri' and */
    4182             : /*  `dummysub' may change willy-nilly.  This makes it possible to avoid      */
    4183             : /*  writing a good deal of special-case code (in the edge flip, for example) */
    4184             : /*  for dealing with the boundary of the mesh, places where no subsegment is */
    4185             : /*  present, and so forth.  Other entities are frequently bonded to          */
    4186             : /*  `dummytri' and `dummysub' as if they were real mesh entities, with no    */
    4187             : /*  harm done.                                                               */
    4188             : /*                                                                           */
    4189             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4190             : 
    4191             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4192             : void dummyinit(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, int trianglebytes,
    4193             :                int subsegbytes)
    4194             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4195           0 : void dummyinit(m, b, trianglebytes, subsegbytes)
    4196             : struct mesh *m;
    4197             : struct behavior *b;
    4198             : int trianglebytes;
    4199             : int subsegbytes;
    4200             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4201             : 
    4202             : {
    4203             :   size_t alignptr;
    4204             : 
    4205             :   /* Set up `dummytri', the `triangle' that occupies "outer space." */
    4206           0 :   m->dummytribase = (triangle *) trimalloc(trianglebytes +
    4207           0 :                                            m->triangles.alignbytes);
    4208             :   /* Align `dummytri' on a `triangles.alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    4209           0 :   alignptr = (size_t) m->dummytribase;
    4210           0 :   m->dummytri = (triangle *)
    4211           0 :     (alignptr + (size_t) m->triangles.alignbytes -
    4212           0 :      (alignptr % (size_t) m->triangles.alignbytes));
    4213             :   /* Initialize the three adjoining triangles to be "outer space."  These  */
    4214             :   /*   will eventually be changed by various bonding operations, but their */
    4215             :   /*   values don't really matter, as ptrdiff_t  as they can legally be          */
    4216             :   /*   dereferenced.                                                       */
    4217           0 :   m->dummytri[0] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4218           0 :   m->dummytri[1] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4219           0 :   m->dummytri[2] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4220             :   /* Three NULL vertices. */
    4221           0 :   m->dummytri[3] = (triangle) NULL;
    4222           0 :   m->dummytri[4] = (triangle) NULL;
    4223           0 :   m->dummytri[5] = (triangle) NULL;
    4224             : 
    4225           0 :   if (b->usesegments) {
    4226             :     /* Set up `dummysub', the omnipresent subsegment pointed to by any */
    4227             :     /*   triangle side or subsegment end that isn't attached to a real */
    4228             :     /*   subsegment.                                                   */
    4229           0 :     m->dummysubbase = (subseg *) trimalloc(subsegbytes +
    4230           0 :                                            m->subsegs.alignbytes);
    4231             :     /* Align `dummysub' on a `subsegs.alignbytes'-byte boundary. */
    4232           0 :     alignptr = (size_t) m->dummysubbase;
    4233           0 :     m->dummysub = (subseg *)
    4234           0 :       (alignptr + (size_t) m->subsegs.alignbytes -
    4235           0 :        (alignptr % (size_t) m->subsegs.alignbytes));
    4236             :     /* Initialize the two adjoining subsegments to be the omnipresent      */
    4237             :     /*   subsegment.  These will eventually be changed by various bonding  */
    4238             :     /*   operations, but their values don't really matter, as ptrdiff_t  as they */
    4239             :     /*   can legally be dereferenced.                                      */
    4240           0 :     m->dummysub[0] = (subseg) m->dummysub;
    4241           0 :     m->dummysub[1] = (subseg) m->dummysub;
    4242             :     /* Four NULL vertices. */
    4243           0 :     m->dummysub[2] = (subseg) NULL;
    4244           0 :     m->dummysub[3] = (subseg) NULL;
    4245           0 :     m->dummysub[4] = (subseg) NULL;
    4246           0 :     m->dummysub[5] = (subseg) NULL;
    4247             :     /* Initialize the two adjoining triangles to be "outer space." */
    4248           0 :     m->dummysub[6] = (subseg) m->dummytri;
    4249           0 :     m->dummysub[7] = (subseg) m->dummytri;
    4250             :     /* Set the boundary marker to zero. */
    4251           0 :     * (int *) (m->dummysub + 8) = 0;
    4252             : 
    4253             :     /* Initialize the three adjoining subsegments of `dummytri' to be */
    4254             :     /*   the omnipresent subsegment.                                  */
    4255           0 :     m->dummytri[6] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4256           0 :     m->dummytri[7] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4257           0 :     m->dummytri[8] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4258             :   }
    4259           0 : }
    4260             : 
    4261             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4262             : /*                                                                           */
    4263             : /*  initializevertexpool()   Calculate the size of the vertex data structure */
    4264             : /*                           and initialize its memory pool.                 */
    4265             : /*                                                                           */
    4266             : /*  This routine also computes the `vertexmarkindex' and `vertex2triindex'   */
    4267             : /*  indices used to find values within each vertex.                          */
    4268             : /*                                                                           */
    4269             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4270             : 
    4271             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4272             : void initializevertexpool(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    4273             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4274           0 : void initializevertexpool(m, b)
    4275             : struct mesh *m;
    4276             : struct behavior *b;
    4277             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4278             : 
    4279             : {
    4280             :   int vertexsize;
    4281             : 
    4282             :   /* The index within each vertex at which the boundary marker is found,    */
    4283             :   /*   followed by the vertex type.  Ensure the vertex marker is aligned to */
    4284             :   /*   a sizeof(int)-byte address.                                          */
    4285           0 :   m->vertexmarkindex = ((m->mesh_dim + m->nextras) * sizeof(REAL) +
    4286           0 :                         sizeof(int) - 1) /
    4287             :                        sizeof(int);
    4288           0 :   vertexsize = (m->vertexmarkindex + 2) * sizeof(int);
    4289           0 :   if (b->poly) {
    4290             :     /* The index within each vertex at which a triangle pointer is found.  */
    4291             :     /*   Ensure the pointer is aligned to a sizeof(triangle)-byte address. */
    4292           0 :     m->vertex2triindex = (vertexsize + sizeof(triangle) - 1) /
    4293             :                          sizeof(triangle);
    4294           0 :     vertexsize = (m->vertex2triindex + 1) * sizeof(triangle);
    4295             :   }
    4296             : 
    4297             :   /* Initialize the pool of vertices. */
    4298           0 :   poolinit(&m->vertices, vertexsize, VERTEXPERBLOCK,
    4299           0 :            m->invertices > VERTEXPERBLOCK ? m->invertices : VERTEXPERBLOCK,
    4300             :            sizeof(REAL));
    4301           0 : }
    4302             : 
    4303             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4304             : /*                                                                           */
    4305             : /*  initializetrisubpools()   Calculate the sizes of the triangle and        */
    4306             : /*                            subsegment data structures and initialize      */
    4307             : /*                            their memory pools.                            */
    4308             : /*                                                                           */
    4309             : /*  This routine also computes the `highorderindex', `elemattribindex', and  */
    4310             : /*  `areaboundindex' indices used to find values within each triangle.       */
    4311             : /*                                                                           */
    4312             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4313             : 
    4314             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4315             : void initializetrisubpools(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    4316             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4317           0 : void initializetrisubpools(m, b)
    4318             : struct mesh *m;
    4319             : struct behavior *b;
    4320             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4321             : 
    4322             : {
    4323             :   int trisize;
    4324             : 
    4325             :   /* The index within each triangle at which the extra nodes (above three)  */
    4326             :   /*   associated with high order elements are found.  There are three      */
    4327             :   /*   pointers to other triangles, three pointers to corners, and possibly */
    4328             :   /*   three pointers to subsegments before the extra nodes.                */
    4329           0 :   m->highorderindex = 6 + (b->usesegments * 3);
    4330             :   /* The number of bytes occupied by a triangle. */
    4331           0 :   trisize = ((b->order + 1) * (b->order + 2) / 2 + (m->highorderindex - 3)) *
    4332             :             sizeof(triangle);
    4333             :   /* The index within each triangle at which its attributes are found, */
    4334             :   /*   where the index is measured in REALs.                           */
    4335           0 :   m->elemattribindex = (trisize + sizeof(REAL) - 1) / sizeof(REAL);
    4336             :   /* The index within each triangle at which the maximum area constraint  */
    4337             :   /*   is found, where the index is measured in REALs.  Note that if the  */
    4338             :   /*   `regionattrib' flag is set, an additional attribute will be added. */
    4339           0 :   m->areaboundindex = m->elemattribindex + m->eextras + b->regionattrib;
    4340             :   /* If triangle attributes or an area bound are needed, increase the number */
    4341             :   /*   of bytes occupied by a triangle.                                      */
    4342           0 :   if (b->vararea) {
    4343           0 :     trisize = (m->areaboundindex + 1) * sizeof(REAL);
    4344           0 :   } else if (m->eextras + b->regionattrib > 0) {
    4345           0 :     trisize = m->areaboundindex * sizeof(REAL);
    4346             :   }
    4347             :   /* If a Voronoi diagram or triangle neighbor graph is requested, make    */
    4348             :   /*   sure there's room to store an integer index in each triangle.  This */
    4349             :   /*   integer index can occupy the same space as the subsegment pointers  */
    4350             :   /*   or attributes or area constraint or extra nodes.                    */
    4351           0 :   if ((b->voronoi || b->neighbors) &&
    4352           0 :       (trisize < 6 * sizeof(triangle) + sizeof(int))) {
    4353           0 :     trisize = 6 * sizeof(triangle) + sizeof(int);
    4354             :   }
    4355             : 
    4356             :   /* Having determined the memory size of a triangle, initialize the pool. */
    4357           0 :   poolinit(&m->triangles, trisize, TRIPERBLOCK,
    4358           0 :            (2 * m->invertices - 2) > TRIPERBLOCK ? (2 * m->invertices - 2) :
    4359             :            TRIPERBLOCK, 4);
    4360             : 
    4361           0 :   if (b->usesegments) {
    4362             :     /* Initialize the pool of subsegments.  Take into account all eight */
    4363             :     /*   pointers and one boundary marker.                              */
    4364           0 :     poolinit(&m->subsegs, 8 * sizeof(triangle) + sizeof(int),
    4365             :              SUBSEGPERBLOCK, SUBSEGPERBLOCK, 4);
    4366             : 
    4367             :     /* Initialize the "outer space" triangle and omnipresent subsegment. */
    4368           0 :     dummyinit(m, b, m->triangles.itembytes, m->subsegs.itembytes);
    4369             :   } else {
    4370             :     /* Initialize the "outer space" triangle. */
    4371           0 :     dummyinit(m, b, m->triangles.itembytes, 0);
    4372             :   }
    4373           0 : }
    4374             : 
    4375             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4376             : /*                                                                           */
    4377             : /*  triangledealloc()   Deallocate space for a triangle, marking it dead.    */
    4378             : /*                                                                           */
    4379             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4380             : 
    4381             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4382             : void triangledealloc(struct mesh *m, triangle *dyingtriangle)
    4383             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4384           0 : void triangledealloc(m, dyingtriangle)
    4385             : struct mesh *m;
    4386             : triangle *dyingtriangle;
    4387             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4388             : 
    4389             : {
    4390             :   /* Mark the triangle as dead.  This makes it possible to detect dead */
    4391             :   /*   triangles when traversing the list of all triangles.            */
    4392           0 :   killtri(dyingtriangle);
    4393           0 :   pooldealloc(&m->triangles, (VOID *) dyingtriangle);
    4394           0 : }
    4395             : 
    4396             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4397             : /*                                                                           */
    4398             : /*  triangletraverse()   Traverse the triangles, skipping dead ones.         */
    4399             : /*                                                                           */
    4400             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4401             : 
    4402             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4403             : triangle *triangletraverse(struct mesh *m)
    4404             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4405           0 : triangle *triangletraverse(m)
    4406             : struct mesh *m;
    4407             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4408             : 
    4409             : {
    4410             :   triangle *newtriangle;
    4411             :

    4413           0 :     newtriangle = (triangle *) traverse(&m->triangles);
    4414           0 :     if (newtriangle == (triangle *) NULL) {
    4415           0 :       return (triangle *) NULL;
    4416             :     }
    4417           0 :   } while (deadtri(newtriangle));                         /* Skip dead ones. */
    4418           0 :   return newtriangle;
    4419             : }
    4420             : 
    4421             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4422             : /*                                                                           */
    4423             : /*  subsegdealloc()   Deallocate space for a subsegment, marking it dead.    */
    4424             : /*                                                                           */
    4425             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4426             :

    4434             : 
    4435             : {
    4436             :   /* Mark the subsegment as dead.  This makes it possible to detect dead */
    4437             :   /*   subsegments when traversing the list of all subsegments.          */
    4438           0 :   killsubseg(dyingsubseg);
    4439           0 :   pooldealloc(&m->subsegs, (VOID *) dyingsubseg);
    4440           0 : }
    4441             : 
    4442             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4443             : /*                                                                           */
    4444             : /*  subsegtraverse()   Traverse the subsegments, skipping dead ones.         */
    4445             : /*                                                                           */
    4446             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4447             :

    4449             : subseg *subsegtraverse(struct mesh *m)

    4453             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */

    4455             : {
    4456             :   subseg *newsubseg;
    4457             :

    4459           0 :     newsubseg = (subseg *) traverse(&m->subsegs);

    4461           0 :       return (subseg *) NULL;
    4462             :     }
    4463           0 :   } while (deadsubseg(newsubseg));                        /* Skip dead ones. */

    4466             : 
    4467             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4468             : /*                                                                           */

    4470             : /*                                                                           */
    4471             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4472             :

    4483             :   /*   vertices when traversing the list of all vertices.            */
    4484           0 :   setvertextype(dyingvertex, DEADVERTEX);
    4485           0 :   pooldealloc(&m->vertices, (VOID *) dyingvertex);
    4486           0 : }
    4487             : 
    4488             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4489             : /*                                                                           */
    4490             : /*  vertextraverse()   Traverse the vertices, skipping dead ones.            */
    4491             : /*                                                                           */
    4492             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4493             : 
    4494             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4495             : vertex vertextraverse(struct mesh *m)
    4496             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4497           0 : vertex vertextraverse(m)
