    4499             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4500             : 
    4501             : {
    4502             :   vertex newvertex;
    4503             : 
    4504             :   do {
    4505           0 :     newvertex = (vertex) traverse(&m->vertices);
    4506           0 :     if (newvertex == (vertex) NULL) {
    4507           0 :       return (vertex) NULL;
    4508             :     }
    4509           0 :   } while (vertextype(newvertex) == DEADVERTEX);          /* Skip dead ones. */
    4510           0 :   return newvertex;
    4511             : }
    4512             : 
    4513             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4514             : /*                                                                           */
    4515             : /*  badsubsegdealloc()   Deallocate space for a bad subsegment, marking it   */
    4516             : /*                       dead.                                               */
    4517             : /*                                                                           */
    4518             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4519             : 
    4520             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    4521             : 
    4522             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4523             : void badsubsegdealloc(struct mesh *m, struct badsubseg *dyingseg)
    4524             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4525           0 : void badsubsegdealloc(m, dyingseg)
    4526             : struct mesh *m;
    4527             : struct badsubseg *dyingseg;
    4528             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4529             : 
    4530             : {
    4531             :   /* Set subsegment's origin to NULL.  This makes it possible to detect dead */
    4532             :   /*   badsubsegs when traversing the list of all badsubsegs             .   */
    4533           0 :   dyingseg->subsegorg = (vertex) NULL;
    4534           0 :   pooldealloc(&m->badsubsegs, (VOID *) dyingseg);
    4535           0 : }
    4536             : 
    4537             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    4538             : 
    4539             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4540             : /*                                                                           */
    4541             : /*  badsubsegtraverse()   Traverse the bad subsegments, skipping dead ones.  */
    4542             : /*                                                                           */
    4543             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4544             : 
    4545             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    4546             : 
    4547             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4548             : struct badsubseg *badsubsegtraverse(struct mesh *m)
    4549             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4550           0 : struct badsubseg *badsubsegtraverse(m)
    4551             : struct mesh *m;
    4552             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4553             : 
    4554             : {
    4555             :   struct badsubseg *newseg;
    4556             : 
    4557             :   do {
    4558           0 :     newseg = (struct badsubseg *) traverse(&m->badsubsegs);
    4559           0 :     if (newseg == (struct badsubseg *) NULL) {
    4560           0 :       return (struct badsubseg *) NULL;
    4561             :     }
    4562           0 :   } while (newseg->subsegorg == (vertex) NULL);           /* Skip dead ones. */
    4563           0 :   return newseg;
    4564             : }
    4565             : 
    4566             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    4567             : 
    4568             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4569             : /*                                                                           */
    4570             : /*  getvertex()   Get a specific vertex, by number, from the list.           */
    4571             : /*                                                                           */
    4572             : /*  The first vertex is number 'firstnumber'.                                */
    4573             : /*                                                                           */
    4574             : /*  Note that this takes O(n) time (with a small constant, if VERTEXPERBLOCK */
    4575             : /*  is large).  I don't care to take the trouble to make it work in constant */
    4576             : /*  time.                                                                    */
    4577             : /*                                                                           */
    4578             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4579             : 
    4580             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4581             : vertex getvertex(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, int number)
    4582             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4583           0 : vertex getvertex(m, b, number)
    4584             : struct mesh *m;
    4585             : struct behavior *b;
    4586             : int number;
    4587             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4588             : 
    4589             : {
    4590             :   VOID **getblock;
    4591             :   char *foundvertex;
    4592             :   size_t alignptr;
    4593             :   int current;
    4594             : 
    4595           0 :   getblock = m->vertices.firstblock;
    4596           0 :   current = b->firstnumber;
    4597             : 
    4598             :   /* Find the right block. */
    4599           0 :   if (current + m->vertices.itemsfirstblock <= number) {
    4600           0 :     getblock = (VOID **) *getblock;
    4601           0 :     current += m->vertices.itemsfirstblock;
    4602           0 :     while (current + m->vertices.itemsperblock <= number) {
    4603           0 :       getblock = (VOID **) *getblock;
    4604           0 :       current += m->vertices.itemsperblock;
    4605             :     }
    4606             :   }
    4607             : 
    4608             :   /* Now find the right vertex. */
    4609           0 :   alignptr = (size_t) (getblock + 1);
    4610           0 :   foundvertex = (char *) (alignptr + (size_t) m->vertices.alignbytes -
    4611           0 :                           (alignptr % (size_t) m->vertices.alignbytes));
    4612           0 :   return (vertex) (foundvertex + m->vertices.itembytes * (number - current));
    4613             : }
    4614             : 
    4615             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4616             : /*                                                                           */
    4617             : /*  triangledeinit()   Free all remaining allocated memory.                  */
    4618             : /*                                                                           */
    4619             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4620             : 
    4621             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4622             : void triangledeinit(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    4623             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4624           0 : void triangledeinit(m, b)
    4625             : struct mesh *m;
    4626             : struct behavior *b;
    4627             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4628             : 
    4629             : {
    4630           0 :   pooldeinit(&m->triangles);
    4631           0 :   trifree((VOID *) m->dummytribase);
    4632           0 :   if (b->usesegments) {
    4633           0 :     pooldeinit(&m->subsegs);
    4634           0 :     trifree((VOID *) m->dummysubbase);
    4635             :   }
    4636           0 :   pooldeinit(&m->vertices);
    4637             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    4638           0 :   if (b->quality) {
    4639           0 :     pooldeinit(&m->badsubsegs);
    4640           0 :     if ((b->minangle > 0.0) || b->vararea || b->fixedarea || b->usertest) {
    4641           0 :       pooldeinit(&m->badtriangles);
    4642           0 :       pooldeinit(&m->flipstackers);
    4643             :     }
    4644             :   }
    4645             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    4646           0 : }
    4647             : 
    4648             : /**                                                                         **/
    4649             : /**                                                                         **/
    4650             : /********* Memory management routines end here                       *********/
    4651             : 
    4652             : /********* Constructors begin here                                   *********/
    4653             : /**                                                                         **/
    4654             : /**                                                                         **/
    4655             : 
    4656             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4657             : /*                                                                           */
    4658             : /*  maketriangle()   Create a new triangle with orientation zero.            */
    4659             : /*                                                                           */
    4660             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4661             : 
    4662             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4663             : void maketriangle(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *newotri)
    4664             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4665           0 : void maketriangle(m, b, newotri)
    4666             : struct mesh *m;
    4667             : struct behavior *b;
    4668             : struct otri *newotri;
    4669             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4670             : 
    4671             : {
    4672             :   int i;
    4673             : 
    4674           0 :   newotri->tri = (triangle *) poolalloc(&m->triangles);
    4675             :   /* Initialize the three adjoining triangles to be "outer space". */
    4676           0 :   newotri->tri[0] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4677           0 :   newotri->tri[1] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4678           0 :   newotri->tri[2] = (triangle) m->dummytri;
    4679             :   /* Three NULL vertices. */
    4680           0 :   newotri->tri[3] = (triangle) NULL;
    4681           0 :   newotri->tri[4] = (triangle) NULL;
    4682           0 :   newotri->tri[5] = (triangle) NULL;
    4683           0 :   if (b->usesegments) {
    4684             :     /* Initialize the three adjoining subsegments to be the omnipresent */
    4685             :     /*   subsegment.                                                    */
    4686           0 :     newotri->tri[6] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4687           0 :     newotri->tri[7] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4688           0 :     newotri->tri[8] = (triangle) m->dummysub;
    4689             :   }
    4690           0 :   for (i = 0; i < m->eextras; i++) {
    4691           0 :     setelemattribute(*newotri, i, 0.0);
    4692             :   }
    4693           0 :   if (b->vararea) {
    4694           0 :     setareabound(*newotri, -1.0);
    4695             :   }
    4696             : 
    4697           0 :   newotri->orient = 0;
    4698           0 : }
    4699             : 
    4700             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4701             : /*                                                                           */
    4702             : /*  makesubseg()   Create a new subsegment with orientation zero.            */
    4703             : /*                                                                           */
    4704             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4705             : 
    4706             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4707             : void makesubseg(struct mesh *m, struct osub *newsubseg)
    4708             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4709           0 : void makesubseg(m, newsubseg)
    4710             : struct mesh *m;
    4711             : struct osub *newsubseg;
    4712             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4713             : 
    4714             : {
    4715           0 :   newsubseg->ss = (subseg *) poolalloc(&m->subsegs);
    4716             :   /* Initialize the two adjoining subsegments to be the omnipresent */
    4717             :   /*   subsegment.                                                  */
    4718           0 :   newsubseg->ss[0] = (subseg) m->dummysub;
    4719           0 :   newsubseg->ss[1] = (subseg) m->dummysub;
    4720             :   /* Four NULL vertices. */
    4721           0 :   newsubseg->ss[2] = (subseg) NULL;
    4722           0 :   newsubseg->ss[3] = (subseg) NULL;
    4723           0 :   newsubseg->ss[4] = (subseg) NULL;
    4724           0 :   newsubseg->ss[5] = (subseg) NULL;
    4725             :   /* Initialize the two adjoining triangles to be "outer space." */
    4726           0 :   newsubseg->ss[6] = (subseg) m->dummytri;
    4727           0 :   newsubseg->ss[7] = (subseg) m->dummytri;
    4728             :   /* Set the boundary marker to zero. */
    4729           0 :   setmark(*newsubseg, 0);
    4730             : 
    4731           0 :   newsubseg->ssorient = 0;
    4732           0 : }
    4733             : 
    4734             : /**                                                                         **/
    4735             : /**                                                                         **/
    4736             : /********* Constructors end here                                     *********/
    4737             : 
    4738             : /********* Geometric primitives begin here                           *********/
    4739             : /**                                                                         **/
    4740             : /**                                                                         **/
    4741             : 
    4742             : /* The adaptive exact arithmetic geometric predicates implemented herein are */
    4743             : /*   described in detail in my paper, "Adaptive Precision Floating-Point     */
    4744             : /*   Arithmetic and Fast Robust Geometric Predicates."  See the header for a */
    4745             : /*   full citation.                                                          */
    4746             : 
    4747             : /* Which of the following two methods of finding the absolute values is      */
    4748             : /*   fastest is compiler-dependent.  A few compilers can inline and optimize */
    4749             : /*   the fabs() call; but most will incur the overhead of a function call,   */
    4750             : /*   which is disastrously slow.  A faster way on IEEE machines might be to  */
    4751             : /*   mask the appropriate bit, but that's difficult to do in C without       */
    4752             : /*   forcing the value to be stored to memory (rather than be kept in the    */
    4753             : /*   register to which the optimizer assigned it).                           */
    4754             : 
    4755             : #define Absolute(a)  ((a) >= 0.0 ? (a) : -(a))
    4756             : /* #define Absolute(a)  fabs(a) */
    4757             : 
    4758             : /* Many of the operations are broken up into two pieces, a main part that    */
    4759             : /*   performs an approximate operation, and a "tail" that computes the       */
    4760             : /*   roundoff error of that operation.                                       */
    4761             : /*                                                                           */
    4762             : /* The operations Fast_Two_Sum(), Fast_Two_Diff(), Two_Sum(), Two_Diff(),    */
    4763             : /*   Split(), and Two_Product() are all implemented as described in the      */
    4764             : /*   reference.  Each of these macros requires certain variables to be       */
    4765             : /*   defined in the calling routine.  The variables `bvirt', `c', `abig',    */
    4766             : /*   `_i', `_j', `_k', `_l', `_m', and `_n' are declared `INEXACT' because   */
    4767             : /*   they store the result of an operation that may incur roundoff error.    */
    4768             : /*   The input parameter `x' (or the highest numbered `x_' parameter) must   */
    4769             : /*   also be declared `INEXACT'.                                             */
    4770             : 
    4771             : #define Fast_Two_Sum_Tail(a, b, x, y) \
    4772             :   bvirt = x - a; \
    4773             :   y = b - bvirt
    4774             : 
    4775             : #define Fast_Two_Sum(a, b, x, y) \
    4776             :   x = (REAL) (a + b); \
    4777             :   Fast_Two_Sum_Tail(a, b, x, y)
    4778             : 
    4779             : #define Two_Sum_Tail(a, b, x, y) \
    4780             :   bvirt = (REAL) (x - a); \
    4781             :   avirt = x - bvirt; \
    4782             :   bround = b - bvirt; \
    4783             :   around = a - avirt; \
    4784             :   y = around + bround
    4785             : 
    4786             : #define Two_Sum(a, b, x, y) \
    4787             :   x = (REAL) (a + b); \
    4788             :   Two_Sum_Tail(a, b, x, y)
    4789             : 
    4790             : #define Two_Diff_Tail(a, b, x, y) \
    4791             :   bvirt = (REAL) (a - x); \
    4792             :   avirt = x + bvirt; \
    4793             :   bround = bvirt - b; \
    4794             :   around = a - avirt; \
    4795             :   y = around + bround
    4796             : 
    4797             : #define Two_Diff(a, b, x, y) \
    4798             :   x = (REAL) (a - b); \
    4799             :   Two_Diff_Tail(a, b, x, y)
    4800             : 
    4801             : #define Split(a, ahi, alo) \
    4802             :   c = (REAL) (splitter * a); \
    4803             :   abig = (REAL) (c - a); \
    4804             :   ahi = c - abig; \
    4805             :   alo = a - ahi
    4806             : 
    4807             : #define Two_Product_Tail(a, b, x, y) \
    4808             :   Split(a, ahi, alo); \
    4809             :   Split(b, bhi, blo); \
    4810             :   err1 = x - (ahi * bhi); \
    4811             :   err2 = err1 - (alo * bhi); \
    4812             :   err3 = err2 - (ahi * blo); \
    4813             :   y = (alo * blo) - err3
    4814             : 
    4815             : #define Two_Product(a, b, x, y) \
    4816             :   x = (REAL) (a * b); \
    4817             :   Two_Product_Tail(a, b, x, y)
    4818             : 
    4819             : /* Two_Product_Presplit() is Two_Product() where one of the inputs has       */
    4820             : /*   already been split.  Avoids redundant splitting.                        */
    4821             : 
    4822             : #define Two_Product_Presplit(a, b, bhi, blo, x, y) \
    4823             :   x = (REAL) (a * b); \
    4824             :   Split(a, ahi, alo); \
    4825             :   err1 = x - (ahi * bhi); \
    4826             :   err2 = err1 - (alo * bhi); \
    4827             :   err3 = err2 - (ahi * blo); \
    4828             :   y = (alo * blo) - err3
    4829             : 
    4830             : /* Square() can be done more quickly than Two_Product().                     */
    4831             : 
    4832             : #define Square_Tail(a, x, y) \
    4833             :   Split(a, ahi, alo); \
    4834             :   err1 = x - (ahi * ahi); \
    4835             :   err3 = err1 - ((ahi + ahi) * alo); \
    4836             :   y = (alo * alo) - err3
    4837             : 
    4838             : #define Square(a, x, y) \
    4839             :   x = (REAL) (a * a); \
    4840             :   Square_Tail(a, x, y)
    4841             : 
    4842             : /* Macros for summing expansions of various fixed lengths.  These are all    */
    4843             : /*   unrolled versions of Expansion_Sum().                                   */
    4844             : 
    4845             : #define Two_One_Sum(a1, a0, b, x2, x1, x0) \
    4846             :   Two_Sum(a0, b , _i, x0); \
    4847             :   Two_Sum(a1, _i, x2, x1)
    4848             : 
    4849             : #define Two_One_Diff(a1, a0, b, x2, x1, x0) \
    4850             :   Two_Diff(a0, b , _i, x0); \
    4851             :   Two_Sum( a1, _i, x2, x1)
    4852             : 
    4853             : #define Two_Two_Sum(a1, a0, b1, b0, x3, x2, x1, x0) \
    4854             :   Two_One_Sum(a1, a0, b0, _j, _0, x0); \
    4855             :   Two_One_Sum(_j, _0, b1, x3, x2, x1)
    4856             : 
    4857             : #define Two_Two_Diff(a1, a0, b1, b0, x3, x2, x1, x0) \
    4858             :   Two_One_Diff(a1, a0, b0, _j, _0, x0); \
    4859             :   Two_One_Diff(_j, _0, b1, x3, x2, x1)
    4860             : 
    4861             : /* Macro for multiplying a two-component expansion by a single component.    */
    4862             : 
    4863             : #define Two_One_Product(a1, a0, b, x3, x2, x1, x0) \
    4864             :   Split(b, bhi, blo); \
    4865             :   Two_Product_Presplit(a0, b, bhi, blo, _i, x0); \
    4866             :   Two_Product_Presplit(a1, b, bhi, blo, _j, _0); \
    4867             :   Two_Sum(_i, _0, _k, x1); \
    4868             :   Fast_Two_Sum(_j, _k, x3, x2)
    4869             : 
    4870             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4871             : /*                                                                           */
    4872             : /*  exactinit()   Initialize the variables used for exact arithmetic.        */
    4873             : /*                                                                           */
    4874             : /*  `epsilon' is the largest power of two such that 1.0 + epsilon = 1.0 in   */
    4875             : /*  floating-point arithmetic.  `epsilon' bounds the relative roundoff       */
    4876             : /*  error.  It is used for floating-point error analysis.                    */
    4877             : /*                                                                           */
    4878             : /*  `splitter' is used to split floating-point numbers into two half-        */
    4879             : /*  length significands for exact multiplication.                            */
    4880             : /*                                                                           */
    4881             : /*  I imagine that a highly optimizing compiler might be too smart for its   */
    4882             : /*  own good, and somehow cause this routine to fail, if it pretends that    */
    4883             : /*  floating-point arithmetic is too much like real arithmetic.              */
    4884             : /*                                                                           */
    4885             : /*  Don't change this routine unless you fully understand it.                */
    4886             : /*                                                                           */
    4887             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4888             : 
    4889           0 : void exactinit()
    4890             : {
    4891             :   REAL half;
    4892             :   REAL check, lastcheck;
    4893             :   int every_other;
    4894             : #ifdef LINUX
    4895             : #ifndef __APPLE__
    4896             :   int cword;
    4897             : #endif /* not APPLE */
    4898             : #endif /* LINUX */
    4899             : 
    4900             : #ifdef CPU86
    4901             : #ifdef SINGLE
    4902             :   _control87(_PC_24, _MCW_PC); /* Set FPU control word for single precision. */
    4903             : #else /* not SINGLE */
    4904             :   _control87(_PC_53, _MCW_PC); /* Set FPU control word for double precision. */
    4905             : #endif /* not SINGLE */
    4906             : #endif /* CPU86 */
    4907             : #ifdef LINUX
    4908             : #ifndef __APPLE__
    4909             : #ifdef SINGLE
    4910             :   /*  cword = 4223; */
    4911             :   cword = 4210;                 /* set FPU control word for single precision */
    4912             : #else /* not SINGLE */
    4913             :   /*  cword = 4735; */
    4914           0 :   cword = 4722;                 /* set FPU control word for double precision */
    4915             : #endif /* not SINGLE */
    4916             : #ifdef _86
    4917             :   _FPU_SETCW(cword);
    4918             : #endif
    4919             : #endif /* not APPLE */
    4920             : #endif /* LINUX */
    4921             : 
    4922           0 :   every_other = 1;
    4923           0 :   half = 0.5;
    4924           0 :   epsilon = 1.0;
    4925           0 :   splitter = 1.0;
    4926           0 :   check = 1.0;
    4927             :   /* Repeatedly divide `epsilon' by two until it is too small to add to      */
    4928             :   /*   one without causing roundoff.  (Also check if the sum is equal to     */
    4929             :   /*   the previous sum, for machines that round up instead of using exact   */
    4930             :   /*   rounding.  Not that these routines will work on such machines.)       */
    4931             :   do {
    4932           0 :     lastcheck = check;
    4933           0 :     epsilon *= half;
    4934           0 :     if (every_other) {
    4935           0 :       splitter *= 2.0;
    4936             :     }
    4937           0 :     every_other = !every_other;
    4938           0 :     check = 1.0 + epsilon;
    4939           0 :   } while ((check != 1.0) && (check != lastcheck));
    4940           0 :   splitter += 1.0;
    4941             :   /* Error bounds for orientation and incircle tests. */
    4942           0 :   resulterrbound = (3.0 + 8.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4943           0 :   ccwerrboundA = (3.0 + 16.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4944           0 :   ccwerrboundB = (2.0 + 12.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4945           0 :   ccwerrboundC = (9.0 + 64.0 * epsilon) * epsilon * epsilon;
    4946           0 :   iccerrboundA = (10.0 + 96.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4947           0 :   iccerrboundB = (4.0 + 48.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4948           0 :   iccerrboundC = (44.0 + 576.0 * epsilon) * epsilon * epsilon;
    4949           0 :   o3derrboundA = (7.0 + 56.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4950           0 :   o3derrboundB = (3.0 + 28.0 * epsilon) * epsilon;
    4951           0 :   o3derrboundC = (26.0 + 288.0 * epsilon) * epsilon * epsilon;
    4952           0 : }
    4953             : 
    4954             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4955             : /*                                                                           */
    4956             : /*  fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim()   Sum two expansions, eliminating zero     */
    4957             : /*                                  components from the output expansion.    */
    4958             : /*                                                                           */
    4959             : /*  Sets h = e + f.  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.             */
    4960             : /*                                                                           */
    4961             : /*  If round-to-even is used (as with IEEE 754), maintains the strongly      */
    4962             : /*  nonoverlapping property.  (That is, if e is strongly nonoverlapping, h   */
    4963             : /*  will be also.)  Does NOT maintain the nonoverlapping or nonadjacent      */
    4964             : /*  properties.                                                              */
    4965             : /*                                                                           */
    4966             : /*****************************************************************************/
    4967             : 
    4968             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    4969             : int fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(int elen, REAL *e, int flen, REAL *f, REAL *h)
    4970             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4971           0 : int fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(elen, e, flen, f, h)  /* h cannot be e or f. */
    4972             : int elen;
    4973             : REAL *e;
    4974             : int flen;
    4975             : REAL *f;
    4976             : REAL *h;
    4977             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    4978             : 
    4979             : {
    4980             :   REAL Q;
    4981             :   INEXACT REAL Qnew;
    4982             :   INEXACT REAL hh;
    4983             :   INEXACT REAL bvirt;
    4984             :   REAL avirt, bround, around;
    4985             :   int eindex, findex, hindex;
    4986             :   REAL enow, fnow;
    4987             : 
    4988           0 :   enow = e[0];
    4989           0 :   fnow = f[0];
    4990           0 :   eindex = findex = 0;
    4991           0 :   if ((fnow > enow) == (fnow > -enow)) {
    4992           0 :     Q = enow;
    4993           0 :     enow = e[++eindex];
    4994             :   } else {
    4995           0 :     Q = fnow;
    4996           0 :     fnow = f[++findex];
    4997             :   }
    4998           0 :   hindex = 0;
    4999           0 :   if ((eindex < elen) && (findex < flen)) {
    5000           0 :     if ((fnow > enow) == (fnow > -enow)) {
    5001           0 :       Fast_Two_Sum(enow, Q, Qnew, hh);
    5002           0 :       enow = e[++eindex];
    5003             :     } else {
    5004           0 :       Fast_Two_Sum(fnow, Q, Qnew, hh);
    5005           0 :       fnow = f[++findex];
    5006             :     }
    5007           0 :     Q = Qnew;
    5008           0 :     if (hh != 0.0) {
    5009           0 :       h[hindex++] = hh;
    5010             :     }
    5011           0 :     while ((eindex < elen) && (findex < flen)) {
    5012           0 :       if ((fnow > enow) == (fnow > -enow)) {
    5013           0 :         Two_Sum(Q, enow, Qnew, hh);
    5014           0 :         enow = e[++eindex];
    5015             :       } else {
    5016           0 :         Two_Sum(Q, fnow, Qnew, hh);
    5017           0 :         fnow = f[++findex];
    5018             :       }
    5019           0 :       Q = Qnew;
    5020           0 :       if (hh != 0.0) {
    5021           0 :         h[hindex++] = hh;
    5022             :       }
    5023             :     }
    5024             :   }
    5025           0 :   while (eindex < elen) {
    5026           0 :     Two_Sum(Q, enow, Qnew, hh);
    5027           0 :     enow = e[++eindex];
    5028           0 :     Q = Qnew;
    5029           0 :     if (hh != 0.0) {
    5030           0 :       h[hindex++] = hh;
    5031             :     }
    5032             :   }
    5033           0 :   while (findex < flen) {
    5034           0 :     Two_Sum(Q, fnow, Qnew, hh);
    5035           0 :     fnow = f[++findex];
    5036           0 :     Q = Qnew;
    5037           0 :     if (hh != 0.0) {
    5038           0 :       h[hindex++] = hh;
    5039             :     }
    5040             :   }
    5041           0 :   if ((Q != 0.0) || (hindex == 0)) {
    5042           0 :     h[hindex++] = Q;
    5043             :   }
    5044           0 :   return hindex;
    5045             : }
    5046             : 
    5047             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5048             : /*                                                                           */
    5049             : /*  scale_expansion_zeroelim()   Multiply an expansion by a scalar,          */
    5050             : /*                               eliminating zero components from the        */
    5051             : /*                               output expansion.                           */
    5052             : /*                                                                           */
    5053             : /*  Sets h = be.  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.                */
    5054             : /*                                                                           */
    5055             : /*  Maintains the nonoverlapping property.  If round-to-even is used (as     */
    5056             : /*  with IEEE 754), maintains the strongly nonoverlapping and nonadjacent    */
    5057             : /*  properties as well.  (That is, if e has one of these properties, so      */
    5058             : /*  will h.)                                                                 */
    5059             : /*                                                                           */
    5060             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5061             : 
    5062             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5063             : int scale_expansion_zeroelim(int elen, REAL *e, REAL b, REAL *h)
    5064             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5065           0 : int scale_expansion_zeroelim(elen, e, b, h)   /* e and h cannot be the same. */
    5066             : int elen;
    5067             : REAL *e;
    5068             : REAL b;
    5069             : REAL *h;
    5070             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5071             : 
    5072             : {
    5073             :   INEXACT REAL Q, sum;
    5074             :   REAL hh;
    5075             :   INEXACT REAL product1;
    5076             :   REAL product0;
    5077             :   int eindex, hindex;
    5078             :   REAL enow;
    5079             :   INEXACT REAL bvirt;
    5080             :   REAL avirt, bround, around;
    5081             :   INEXACT REAL c;
    5082             :   INEXACT REAL abig;
    5083             :   REAL ahi, alo, bhi, blo;
    5084             :   REAL err1, err2, err3;
    5085             : 
    5086           0 :   Split(b, bhi, blo);
    5087           0 :   Two_Product_Presplit(e[0], b, bhi, blo, Q, hh);
    5088           0 :   hindex = 0;
    5089           0 :   if (hh != 0) {
    5090           0 :     h[hindex++] = hh;
    5091             :   }
    5092           0 :   for (eindex = 1; eindex < elen; eindex++) {
    5093           0 :     enow = e[eindex];
    5094           0 :     Two_Product_Presplit(enow, b, bhi, blo, product1, product0);
    5095           0 :     Two_Sum(Q, product0, sum, hh);
    5096           0 :     if (hh != 0) {
    5097           0 :       h[hindex++] = hh;
    5098             :     }
    5099           0 :     Fast_Two_Sum(product1, sum, Q, hh);
    5100           0 :     if (hh != 0) {
    5101           0 :       h[hindex++] = hh;
    5102             :     }
    5103             :   }
    5104           0 :   if ((Q != 0.0) || (hindex == 0)) {
    5105           0 :     h[hindex++] = Q;
    5106             :   }
    5107           0 :   return hindex;
    5108             : }
    5109             : 
    5110             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5111             : /*                                                                           */
    5112             : /*  estimate()   Produce a one-word estimate of an expansion's value.        */
    5113             : /*                                                                           */
    5114             : /*  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.                              */
    5115             : /*                                                                           */
    5116             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5117             : 
    5118             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5119             : REAL estimate(int elen, REAL *e)
    5120             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5121           0 : REAL estimate(elen, e)
    5122             : int elen;
    5123             : REAL *e;
    5124             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5125             : 
    5126             : {
    5127             :   REAL Q;
    5128             :   int eindex;
    5129             : 
    5130           0 :   Q = e[0];
    5131           0 :   for (eindex = 1; eindex < elen; eindex++) {
    5132           0 :     Q += e[eindex];
    5133             :   }
    5134           0 :   return Q;
    5135             : }
    5136             : 
    5137             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5138             : /*                                                                           */
    5139             : /*  counterclockwise()   Return a positive value if the points pa, pb, and   */
    5140             : /*                       pc occur in counterclockwise order; a negative      */
    5141             : /*                       value if they occur in clockwise order; and zero    */
    5142             : /*                       if they are collinear.  The result is also a rough  */
    5143             : /*                       approximation of twice the signed area of the       */
    5144             : /*                       triangle defined by the three points.               */
    5145             : /*                                                                           */
    5146             : /*  Uses exact arithmetic if necessary to ensure a correct answer.  The      */
    5147             : /*  result returned is the determinant of a matrix.  This determinant is     */
    5148             : /*  computed adaptively, in the sense that exact arithmetic is used only to  */
    5149             : /*  the degree it is needed to ensure that the returned value has the        */
    5150             : /*  correct sign.  Hence, this function is usually quite fast, but will run  */
    5151             : /*  more slowly when the input points are collinear or nearly so.            */
    5152             : /*                                                                           */
    5153             : /*  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.                              */
    5154             : /*                                                                           */
    5155             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5156             : 
    5157             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5158             : REAL counterclockwiseadapt(vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, REAL detsum)
    5159             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5160           0 : REAL counterclockwiseadapt(pa, pb, pc, detsum)
    5161             : vertex pa;
    5162             : vertex pb;
    5163             : vertex pc;
    5164             : REAL detsum;
    5165             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5166             : 
    5167             : {
    5168             :   INEXACT REAL acx, acy, bcx, bcy;
    5169             :   REAL acxtail, acytail, bcxtail, bcytail;
    5170             :   INEXACT REAL detleft, detright;
    5171             :   REAL detlefttail, detrighttail;
    5172             :   REAL det, errbound;
    5173             :   REAL B[4], C1[8], C2[12], D[16];
    5174             :   INEXACT REAL B3;
    5175             :   int C1length, C2length, Dlength;
    5176             :   REAL u[4];
    5177             :   INEXACT REAL u3;
    5178             :   INEXACT REAL s1, t1;
    5179             :   REAL s0, t0;
    5180             : 
    5181             :   INEXACT REAL bvirt;
    5182             :   REAL avirt, bround, around;
    5183             :   INEXACT REAL c;
    5184             :   INEXACT REAL abig;
    5185             :   REAL ahi, alo, bhi, blo;
    5186             :   REAL err1, err2, err3;
    5187             :   INEXACT REAL _i, _j;
    5188             :   REAL _0;
    5189             : 
    5190           0 :   acx = (REAL) (pa[0] - pc[0]);
    5191           0 :   bcx = (REAL) (pb[0] - pc[0]);
    5192           0 :   acy = (REAL) (pa[1] - pc[1]);
    5193           0 :   bcy = (REAL) (pb[1] - pc[1]);
    5194             : 
    5195           0 :   Two_Product(acx, bcy, detleft, detlefttail);
    5196           0 :   Two_Product(acy, bcx, detright, detrighttail);
    5197             : 
    5198           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(detleft, detlefttail, detright, detrighttail,
    5199             :                B3, B[2], B[1], B[0]);
    5200           0 :   B[3] = B3;
    5201             : 
    5202           0 :   det = estimate(4, B);
    5203           0 :   errbound = ccwerrboundB * detsum;
    5204           0 :   if ((det >= errbound) || (-det >= errbound)) {
    5205           0 :     return det;
    5206             :   }
    5207             : 
    5208           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pa[0], pc[0], acx, acxtail);
    5209           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pb[0], pc[0], bcx, bcxtail);
    5210           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pa[1], pc[1], acy, acytail);
    5211           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pb[1], pc[1], bcy, bcytail);
    5212             : 
    5213           0 :   if ((acxtail == 0.0) && (acytail == 0.0)
    5214           0 :       && (bcxtail == 0.0) && (bcytail == 0.0)) {
    5215           0 :     return det;
    5216             :   }
    5217             : 
    5218           0 :   errbound = ccwerrboundC * detsum + resulterrbound * Absolute(det);
    5219           0 :   det += (acx * bcytail + bcy * acxtail)
    5220           0 :        - (acy * bcxtail + bcx * acytail);
    5221           0 :   if ((det >= errbound) || (-det >= errbound)) {
    5222           0 :     return det;
    5223             :   }
    5224             : 
    5225           0 :   Two_Product(acxtail, bcy, s1, s0);
    5226           0 :   Two_Product(acytail, bcx, t1, t0);
    5227           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(s1, s0, t1, t0, u3, u[2], u[1], u[0]);
    5228           0 :   u[3] = u3;
    5229           0 :   C1length = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(4, B, 4, u, C1);
    5230             : 
    5231           0 :   Two_Product(acx, bcytail, s1, s0);
    5232           0 :   Two_Product(acy, bcxtail, t1, t0);
    5233           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(s1, s0, t1, t0, u3, u[2], u[1], u[0]);
    5234           0 :   u[3] = u3;
    5235           0 :   C2length = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(C1length, C1, 4, u, C2);
    5236             : 
    5237           0 :   Two_Product(acxtail, bcytail, s1, s0);
    5238           0 :   Two_Product(acytail, bcxtail, t1, t0);
    5239           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(s1, s0, t1, t0, u3, u[2], u[1], u[0]);
    5240           0 :   u[3] = u3;
    5241           0 :   Dlength = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(C2length, C2, 4, u, D);
    5242             : 
    5243           0 :   return(D[Dlength - 1]);
    5244             : }
    5245             : 
    5246             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5247             : REAL counterclockwise(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    5248             :                       vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc)
    5249             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5250           0 : REAL counterclockwise(m, b, pa, pb, pc)
    5251             : struct mesh *m;
    5252             : struct behavior *b;
    5253             : vertex pa;
    5254             : vertex pb;
    5255             : vertex pc;
    5256             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5257             : 
    5258             : {
    5259             :   REAL detleft, detright, det;
    5260             :   REAL detsum, errbound;
    5261             : 
    5262           0 :   m->counterclockcount++;
    5263             : 
    5264           0 :   detleft = (pa[0] - pc[0]) * (pb[1] - pc[1]);
    5265           0 :   detright = (pa[1] - pc[1]) * (pb[0] - pc[0]);
    5266           0 :   det = detleft - detright;
    5267             : 
    5268           0 :   if (b->noexact) {
    5269           0 :     return det;
    5270             :   }
    5271             : 
    5272           0 :   if (detleft > 0.0) {
    5273           0 :     if (detright <= 0.0) {
    5274           0 :       return det;
    5275             :     } else {
    5276           0 :       detsum = detleft + detright;
    5277             :     }
    5278           0 :   } else if (detleft < 0.0) {
    5279           0 :     if (detright >= 0.0) {
    5280           0 :       return det;
    5281             :     } else {
    5282           0 :       detsum = -detleft - detright;
    5283             :     }
    5284             :   } else {
    5285           0 :     return det;
    5286             :   }
    5287             : 
    5288           0 :   errbound = ccwerrboundA * detsum;
    5289           0 :   if ((det >= errbound) || (-det >= errbound)) {
    5290           0 :     return det;
    5291             :   }
    5292             : 
    5293           0 :   return counterclockwiseadapt(pa, pb, pc, detsum);
    5294             : }
    5295             : 
    5296             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5297             : /*                                                                           */
    5298             : /*  incircle()   Return a positive value if the point pd lies inside the     */
    5299             : /*               circle passing through pa, pb, and pc; a negative value if  */
    5300             : /*               it lies outside; and zero if the four points are cocircular.*/
    5301             : /*               The points pa, pb, and pc must be in counterclockwise       */
    5302             : /*               order, or the sign of the result will be reversed.          */
    5303             : /*                                                                           */
    5304             : /*  Uses exact arithmetic if necessary to ensure a correct answer.  The      */
    5305             : /*  result returned is the determinant of a matrix.  This determinant is     */
    5306             : /*  computed adaptively, in the sense that exact arithmetic is used only to  */
    5307             : /*  the degree it is needed to ensure that the returned value has the        */
    5308             : /*  correct sign.  Hence, this function is usually quite fast, but will run  */
    5309             : /*  more slowly when the input points are cocircular or nearly so.           */
    5310             : /*                                                                           */
    5311             : /*  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.                              */
    5312             : /*                                                                           */
    5313             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5314             : 
    5315             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5316             : REAL incircleadapt(vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, vertex pd, REAL permanent)
    5317             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5318           0 : REAL incircleadapt(pa, pb, pc, pd, permanent)
    5319             : vertex pa;
    5320             : vertex pb;
    5321             : vertex pc;
    5322             : vertex pd;
    5323             : REAL permanent;
    5324             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5325             : 
    5326             : {
    5327             :   INEXACT REAL adx, bdx, cdx, ady, bdy, cdy;
    5328             :   REAL det, errbound;
    5329             : 
    5330             :   INEXACT REAL bdxcdy1, cdxbdy1, cdxady1, adxcdy1, adxbdy1, bdxady1;
    5331             :   REAL bdxcdy0, cdxbdy0, cdxady0, adxcdy0, adxbdy0, bdxady0;
    5332             :   REAL bc[4], ca[4], ab[4];
    5333             :   INEXACT REAL bc3, ca3, ab3;
    5334             :   REAL axbc[8], axxbc[16], aybc[8], ayybc[16], adet[32];
    5335             :   int axbclen, axxbclen, aybclen, ayybclen, alen;
    5336             :   REAL bxca[8], bxxca[16], byca[8], byyca[16], bdet[32];
    5337             :   int bxcalen, bxxcalen, bycalen, byycalen, blen;
    5338             :   REAL cxab[8], cxxab[16], cyab[8], cyyab[16], cdet[32];
    5339             :   int cxablen, cxxablen, cyablen, cyyablen, clen;
    5340             :   REAL abdet[64];
    5341             :   int ablen;
    5342             :   REAL fin1[1152], fin2[1152];
    5343             :   REAL *finnow, *finother, *finswap;
    5344             :   int finlength;
    5345             : 
    5346             :   REAL adxtail, bdxtail, cdxtail, adytail, bdytail, cdytail;
    5347             :   INEXACT REAL adxadx1, adyady1, bdxbdx1, bdybdy1, cdxcdx1, cdycdy1;
    5348             :   REAL adxadx0, adyady0, bdxbdx0, bdybdy0, cdxcdx0, cdycdy0;
    5349             :   REAL aa[4], bb[4], cc[4];
    5350             :   INEXACT REAL aa3, bb3, cc3;
    5351             :   INEXACT REAL ti1, tj1;
    5352             :   REAL ti0, tj0;
    5353             :   REAL u[4], v[4];
    5354             :   INEXACT REAL u3, v3;
    5355             :   REAL temp8[8], temp16a[16], temp16b[16], temp16c[16];
    5356             :   REAL temp32a[32], temp32b[32], temp48[48], temp64[64];
    5357             :   int temp8len, temp16alen, temp16blen, temp16clen;
    5358             :   int temp32alen, temp32blen, temp48len, temp64len;
    5359             :   REAL axtbb[8], axtcc[8], aytbb[8], aytcc[8];
    5360             :   int axtbblen, axtcclen, aytbblen, aytcclen;
    5361             :   REAL bxtaa[8], bxtcc[8], bytaa[8], bytcc[8];
    5362             :   int bxtaalen, bxtcclen, bytaalen, bytcclen;
    5363             :   REAL cxtaa[8], cxtbb[8], cytaa[8], cytbb[8];
    5364             :   int cxtaalen, cxtbblen, cytaalen, cytbblen;
    5365             :   REAL axtbc[8], aytbc[8], bxtca[8], bytca[8], cxtab[8], cytab[8];
    5366             :   int axtbclen, aytbclen, bxtcalen, bytcalen, cxtablen, cytablen;
    5367             :   REAL axtbct[16], aytbct[16], bxtcat[16], bytcat[16], cxtabt[16], cytabt[16];
    5368             :   int axtbctlen, aytbctlen, bxtcatlen, bytcatlen, cxtabtlen, cytabtlen;
    5369             :   REAL axtbctt[8], aytbctt[8], bxtcatt[8];
    5370             :   REAL bytcatt[8], cxtabtt[8], cytabtt[8];
    5371             :   int axtbcttlen, aytbcttlen, bxtcattlen, bytcattlen, cxtabttlen, cytabttlen;
    5372             :   REAL abt[8], bct[8], cat[8];
    5373             :   int abtlen, bctlen, catlen;
    5374             :   REAL abtt[4], bctt[4], catt[4];
    5375             :   int abttlen, bcttlen, cattlen;
    5376             :   INEXACT REAL abtt3, bctt3, catt3;
    5377             :   REAL negate;
    5378             : 
    5379             :   INEXACT REAL bvirt;
    5380             :   REAL avirt, bround, around;
    5381             :   INEXACT REAL c;
    5382             :   INEXACT REAL abig;
    5383             :   REAL ahi, alo, bhi, blo;
    5384             :   REAL err1, err2, err3;
    5385             :   INEXACT REAL _i, _j;
    5386             :   REAL _0;
    5387             : 
    5388           0 :   adx = (REAL) (pa[0] - pd[0]);
    5389           0 :   bdx = (REAL) (pb[0] - pd[0]);
    5390           0 :   cdx = (REAL) (pc[0] - pd[0]);
    5391           0 :   ady = (REAL) (pa[1] - pd[1]);
    5392           0 :   bdy = (REAL) (pb[1] - pd[1]);
    5393           0 :   cdy = (REAL) (pc[1] - pd[1]);
    5394             : 
    5395           0 :   Two_Product(bdx, cdy, bdxcdy1, bdxcdy0);
    5396           0 :   Two_Product(cdx, bdy, cdxbdy1, cdxbdy0);
    5397           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(bdxcdy1, bdxcdy0, cdxbdy1, cdxbdy0, bc3, bc[2], bc[1], bc[0]);
    5398           0 :   bc[3] = bc3;
    5399           0 :   axbclen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(4, bc, adx, axbc);
    5400           0 :   axxbclen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(axbclen, axbc, adx, axxbc);
    5401           0 :   aybclen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(4, bc, ady, aybc);
    5402           0 :   ayybclen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(aybclen, aybc, ady, ayybc);
    5403           0 :   alen = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(axxbclen, axxbc, ayybclen, ayybc, adet);
    5404             :

    5731             :                                               temp48, finother);

    5875             :                                             temp32a);

    5890             : 
    5891           0 :   return finnow[finlength - 1];
    5892             : }
    5893             : 
    5894             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5895             : REAL incircle(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    5896             :               vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, vertex pd)
    5897             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5898           0 : REAL incircle(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd)
    5899             : struct mesh *m;
    5900             : struct behavior *b;
    5901             : vertex pa;
    5902             : vertex pb;
    5903             : vertex pc;
    5904             : vertex pd;
    5905             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5906             : 
    5907             : {
    5908             :   REAL adx, bdx, cdx, ady, bdy, cdy;
    5909             :   REAL bdxcdy, cdxbdy, cdxady, adxcdy, adxbdy, bdxady;
    5910             :   REAL alift, blift, clift;
    5911             :   REAL det;
    5912             :   REAL permanent, errbound;
    5913             : 
    5914           0 :   m->incirclecount++;
    5915             : 
    5916           0 :   adx = pa[0] - pd[0];
    5917           0 :   bdx = pb[0] - pd[0];
    5918           0 :   cdx = pc[0] - pd[0];
    5919           0 :   ady = pa[1] - pd[1];
    5920           0 :   bdy = pb[1] - pd[1];
    5921           0 :   cdy = pc[1] - pd[1];
    5922             : 
    5923           0 :   bdxcdy = bdx * cdy;
    5924           0 :   cdxbdy = cdx * bdy;
    5925           0 :   alift = adx * adx + ady * ady;
    5926             : 
    5927           0 :   cdxady = cdx * ady;
    5928           0 :   adxcdy = adx * cdy;
    5929           0 :   blift = bdx * bdx + bdy * bdy;
    5930             : 
    5931           0 :   adxbdy = adx * bdy;
    5932           0 :   bdxady = bdx * ady;
    5933           0 :   clift = cdx * cdx + cdy * cdy;
    5934             : 
    5935           0 :   det = alift * (bdxcdy - cdxbdy)
    5936           0 :       + blift * (cdxady - adxcdy)
    5937           0 :       + clift * (adxbdy - bdxady);
    5938             : 
    5939           0 :   if (b->noexact) {
    5940           0 :     return det;
    5941             :   }
    5942             : 
    5943           0 :   permanent = (Absolute(bdxcdy) + Absolute(cdxbdy)) * alift
    5944           0 :             + (Absolute(cdxady) + Absolute(adxcdy)) * blift
    5945           0 :             + (Absolute(adxbdy) + Absolute(bdxady)) * clift;
    5946           0 :   errbound = iccerrboundA * permanent;
    5947           0 :   if ((det > errbound) || (-det > errbound)) {
    5948           0 :     return det;
    5949             :   }
    5950             : 
    5951           0 :   return incircleadapt(pa, pb, pc, pd, permanent);
    5952             : }
    5953             : 
    5954             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5955             : /*                                                                           */
    5956             : /*  orient3d()   Return a positive value if the point pd lies below the      */
    5957             : /*               plane passing through pa, pb, and pc; "below" is defined so */
    5958             : /*               that pa, pb, and pc appear in counterclockwise order when   */
    5959             : /*               viewed from above the plane.  Returns a negative value if   */
    5960             : /*               pd lies above the plane.  Returns zero if the points are    */
    5961             : /*               coplanar.  The result is also a rough approximation of six  */
    5962             : /*               times the signed volume of the tetrahedron defined by the   */
    5963             : /*               four points.                                                */
    5964             : /*                                                                           */
    5965             : /*  Uses exact arithmetic if necessary to ensure a correct answer.  The      */
    5966             : /*  result returned is the determinant of a matrix.  This determinant is     */
    5967             : /*  computed adaptively, in the sense that exact arithmetic is used only to  */
    5968             : /*  the degree it is needed to ensure that the returned value has the        */
    5969             : /*  correct sign.  Hence, this function is usually quite fast, but will run  */
    5970             : /*  more slowly when the input points are coplanar or nearly so.             */
    5971             : /*                                                                           */
    5972             : /*  See my Robust Predicates paper for details.                              */
    5973             : /*                                                                           */
    5974             : /*****************************************************************************/
    5975             : 
    5976             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    5977             : REAL orient3dadapt(vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, vertex pd,
    5978             :                    REAL aheight, REAL bheight, REAL cheight, REAL dheight,
    5979             :                    REAL permanent)
    5980             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5981           0 : REAL orient3dadapt(pa, pb, pc, pd,
    5982             :                    aheight, bheight, cheight, dheight, permanent)
    5983             : vertex pa;
    5984             : vertex pb;
    5985             : vertex pc;
    5986             : vertex pd;
    5987             : REAL aheight;
    5988             : REAL bheight;
    5989             : REAL cheight;
    5990             : REAL dheight;
    5991             : REAL permanent;
    5992             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    5993             : 
    5994             : {
    5995             :   INEXACT REAL adx, bdx, cdx, ady, bdy, cdy, adheight, bdheight, cdheight;
    5996             :   REAL det, errbound;
    5997             : 
    5998             :   INEXACT REAL bdxcdy1, cdxbdy1, cdxady1, adxcdy1, adxbdy1, bdxady1;
    5999             :   REAL bdxcdy0, cdxbdy0, cdxady0, adxcdy0, adxbdy0, bdxady0;
    6000             :   REAL bc[4], ca[4], ab[4];
    6001             :   INEXACT REAL bc3, ca3, ab3;
    6002             :   REAL adet[8], bdet[8], cdet[8];
    6003             :   int alen, blen, clen;
    6004             :   REAL abdet[16];
    6005             :   int ablen;
    6006             :   REAL *finnow, *finother, *finswap;
    6007             :   REAL fin1[192], fin2[192];
    6008             :   int finlength;
    6009             : 
    6010             :   REAL adxtail, bdxtail, cdxtail;
    6011             :   REAL adytail, bdytail, cdytail;
    6012             :   REAL adheighttail, bdheighttail, cdheighttail;
    6013             :   INEXACT REAL at_blarge, at_clarge;
    6014             :   INEXACT REAL bt_clarge, bt_alarge;
    6015             :   INEXACT REAL ct_alarge, ct_blarge;
    6016             :   REAL at_b[4], at_c[4], bt_c[4], bt_a[4], ct_a[4], ct_b[4];
    6017             :   int at_blen, at_clen, bt_clen, bt_alen, ct_alen, ct_blen;
    6018             :   INEXACT REAL bdxt_cdy1, cdxt_bdy1, cdxt_ady1;
    6019             :   INEXACT REAL adxt_cdy1, adxt_bdy1, bdxt_ady1;
    6020             :   REAL bdxt_cdy0, cdxt_bdy0, cdxt_ady0;
    6021             :   REAL adxt_cdy0, adxt_bdy0, bdxt_ady0;
    6022             :   INEXACT REAL bdyt_cdx1, cdyt_bdx1, cdyt_adx1;
    6023             :   INEXACT REAL adyt_cdx1, adyt_bdx1, bdyt_adx1;
    6024             :   REAL bdyt_cdx0, cdyt_bdx0, cdyt_adx0;
    6025             :   REAL adyt_cdx0, adyt_bdx0, bdyt_adx0;
    6026             :   REAL bct[8], cat[8], abt[8];
    6027             :   int bctlen, catlen, abtlen;
    6028             :   INEXACT REAL bdxt_cdyt1, cdxt_bdyt1, cdxt_adyt1;
    6029             :   INEXACT REAL adxt_cdyt1, adxt_bdyt1, bdxt_adyt1;
    6030             :   REAL bdxt_cdyt0, cdxt_bdyt0, cdxt_adyt0;
    6031             :   REAL adxt_cdyt0, adxt_bdyt0, bdxt_adyt0;
    6032             :   REAL u[4], v[12], w[16];
    6033             :   INEXACT REAL u3;
    6034             :   int vlength, wlength;
    6035             :   REAL negate;
    6036             : 
    6037             :   INEXACT REAL bvirt;
    6038             :   REAL avirt, bround, around;
    6039             :   INEXACT REAL c;
    6040             :   INEXACT REAL abig;
    6041             :   REAL ahi, alo, bhi, blo;
    6042             :   REAL err1, err2, err3;
    6043             :   INEXACT REAL _i, _j, _k;
    6044             :   REAL _0;
    6045             : 
    6046           0 :   adx = (REAL) (pa[0] - pd[0]);
    6047           0 :   bdx = (REAL) (pb[0] - pd[0]);
    6048           0 :   cdx = (REAL) (pc[0] - pd[0]);
    6049           0 :   ady = (REAL) (pa[1] - pd[1]);
    6050           0 :   bdy = (REAL) (pb[1] - pd[1]);
    6051           0 :   cdy = (REAL) (pc[1] - pd[1]);
    6052           0 :   adheight = (REAL) (aheight - dheight);
    6053           0 :   bdheight = (REAL) (bheight - dheight);
    6054           0 :   cdheight = (REAL) (cheight - dheight);
    6055             : 
    6056           0 :   Two_Product(bdx, cdy, bdxcdy1, bdxcdy0);
    6057           0 :   Two_Product(cdx, bdy, cdxbdy1, cdxbdy0);
    6058           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(bdxcdy1, bdxcdy0, cdxbdy1, cdxbdy0, bc3, bc[2], bc[1], bc[0]);
    6059           0 :   bc[3] = bc3;
    6060           0 :   alen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(4, bc, adheight, adet);
    6061             : 
    6062           0 :   Two_Product(cdx, ady, cdxady1, cdxady0);
    6063           0 :   Two_Product(adx, cdy, adxcdy1, adxcdy0);
    6064           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(cdxady1, cdxady0, adxcdy1, adxcdy0, ca3, ca[2], ca[1], ca[0]);
    6065           0 :   ca[3] = ca3;
    6066           0 :   blen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(4, ca, bdheight, bdet);
    6067             : 
    6068           0 :   Two_Product(adx, bdy, adxbdy1, adxbdy0);
    6069           0 :   Two_Product(bdx, ady, bdxady1, bdxady0);
    6070           0 :   Two_Two_Diff(adxbdy1, adxbdy0, bdxady1, bdxady0, ab3, ab[2], ab[1], ab[0]);
    6071           0 :   ab[3] = ab3;
    6072           0 :   clen = scale_expansion_zeroelim(4, ab, cdheight, cdet);
    6073             : 
    6074           0 :   ablen = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(alen, adet, blen, bdet, abdet);
    6075           0 :   finlength = fast_expansion_sum_zeroelim(ablen, abdet, clen, cdet, fin1);
    6076             : 
    6077           0 :   det = estimate(finlength, fin1);
    6078           0 :   errbound = o3derrboundB * permanent;
    6079           0 :   if ((det >= errbound) || (-det >= errbound)) {
    6080           0 :     return det;
    6081             :   }
    6082             : 
    6083           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pa[0], pd[0], adx, adxtail);
    6084           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pb[0], pd[0], bdx, bdxtail);
    6085           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pc[0], pd[0], cdx, cdxtail);
    6086           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pa[1], pd[1], ady, adytail);
    6087           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pb[1], pd[1], bdy, bdytail);
    6088           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(pc[1], pd[1], cdy, cdytail);
    6089           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(aheight, dheight, adheight, adheighttail);
    6090           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(bheight, dheight, bdheight, bdheighttail);
    6091           0 :   Two_Diff_Tail(cheight, dheight, cdheight, cdheighttail);
    6092             : 
    6093           0 :   if ((adxtail == 0.0) && (bdxtail == 0.0) && (cdxtail == 0.0) &&
    6094           0 :       (adytail == 0.0) && (bdytail == 0.0) && (cdytail == 0.0) &&
    6095           0 :       (adheighttail == 0.0) &&
    6096           0 :       (bdheighttail == 0.0) &&
    6097             :       (cdheighttail == 0.0)) {
    6098           0 :     return det;
    6099             :   }

    6101           0 :   errbound = o3derrboundC * permanent + resulterrbound * Absolute(det);

    6103           0 :                       (bdy * cdxtail + cdx * bdytail)) +
    6104           0 :           adheighttail * (bdx * cdy - bdy * cdx)) +
    6105           0 :          (bdheight * ((cdx * adytail + ady * cdxtail) -
    6106           0 :                       (cdy * adxtail + adx * cdytail)) +
    6107           0 :           bdheighttail * (cdx * ady - cdy * adx)) +
    6108           0 :          (cdheight * ((adx * bdytail + bdy * adxtail) -
    6109           0 :                       (ady * bdxtail + bdx * adytail)) +
    6110           0 :           cdheighttail * (adx * bdy - ady * bdx));
    6111           0 :   if ((det >= errbound) || (-det >= errbound)) {
    6112           0 :     return det;
    6113             :   }

    6399             : }
    6400             : 
    6401             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6402             : REAL orient3d(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    6403             :               vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, vertex pd,
    6404             :               REAL aheight, REAL bheight, REAL cheight, REAL dheight)
    6405             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6406           0 : REAL orient3d(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd, aheight, bheight, cheight, dheight)
    6407             : struct mesh *m;
    6408             : struct behavior *b;
    6409             : vertex pa;
    6410             : vertex pb;
    6411             : vertex pc;
    6412             : vertex pd;
    6413             : REAL aheight;
    6414             : REAL bheight;
    6415             : REAL cheight;
    6416             : REAL dheight;
    6417             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6418             : 
    6419             : {
    6420             :   REAL adx, bdx, cdx, ady, bdy, cdy, adheight, bdheight, cdheight;
    6421             :   REAL bdxcdy, cdxbdy, cdxady, adxcdy, adxbdy, bdxady;
    6422             :   REAL det;
    6423             :   REAL permanent, errbound;
    6424             : 
    6425           0 :   m->orient3dcount++;
    6426             : 
    6427           0 :   adx = pa[0] - pd[0];
    6428           0 :   bdx = pb[0] - pd[0];
    6429           0 :   cdx = pc[0] - pd[0];
    6430           0 :   ady = pa[1] - pd[1];
    6431           0 :   bdy = pb[1] - pd[1];
    6432           0 :   cdy = pc[1] - pd[1];
    6433           0 :   adheight = aheight - dheight;
    6434           0 :   bdheight = bheight - dheight;
    6435           0 :   cdheight = cheight - dheight;
    6436             : 
    6437           0 :   bdxcdy = bdx * cdy;
    6438           0 :   cdxbdy = cdx * bdy;
    6439             : 
    6440           0 :   cdxady = cdx * ady;
    6441           0 :   adxcdy = adx * cdy;
    6442             : 
    6443           0 :   adxbdy = adx * bdy;
    6444           0 :   bdxady = bdx * ady;
    6445             : 
    6446           0 :   det = adheight * (bdxcdy - cdxbdy)
    6447           0 :       + bdheight * (cdxady - adxcdy)
    6448           0 :       + cdheight * (adxbdy - bdxady);
    6449             : 
    6450           0 :   if (b->noexact) {
    6451           0 :     return det;
    6452             :   }
    6453             : 
    6454           0 :   permanent = (Absolute(bdxcdy) + Absolute(cdxbdy)) * Absolute(adheight)
    6455           0 :             + (Absolute(cdxady) + Absolute(adxcdy)) * Absolute(bdheight)
    6456           0 :             + (Absolute(adxbdy) + Absolute(bdxady)) * Absolute(cdheight);
    6457           0 :   errbound = o3derrboundA * permanent;
    6458           0 :   if ((det > errbound) || (-det > errbound)) {
    6459           0 :     return det;
    6460             :   }
    6461             : 
    6462           0 :   return orient3dadapt(pa, pb, pc, pd, aheight, bheight, cheight, dheight,
    6463             :                        permanent);
    6464             : }
    6465             : 
    6466             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6467             : /*                                                                           */
    6468             : /*  nonregular()   Return a positive value if the point pd is incompatible   */
    6469             : /*                 with the circle or plane passing through pa, pb, and pc   */
    6470             : /*                 (meaning that pd is inside the circle or below the        */
    6471             : /*                 plane); a negative value if it is compatible; and zero if */
    6472             : /*                 the four points are cocircular/coplanar.  The points pa,  */
    6473             : /*                 pb, and pc must be in counterclockwise order, or the sign */
    6474             : /*                 of the result will be reversed.                           */
    6475             : /*                                                                           */
    6476             : /*  If the -w switch is used, the points are lifted onto the parabolic       */
    6477             : /*  lifting map, then they are dropped according to their weights, then the  */
    6478             : /*  3D orientation test is applied.  If the -W switch is used, the points'   */
    6479             : /*  heights are already provided, so the 3D orientation test is applied      */
    6480             : /*  directly.  If neither switch is used, the incircle test is applied.      */
    6481             : /*                                                                           */
    6482             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6483             : 
    6484             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6485             : REAL nonregular(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    6486             :                 vertex pa, vertex pb, vertex pc, vertex pd)
    6487             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6488           0 : REAL nonregular(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd)
    6489             : struct mesh *m;
    6490             : struct behavior *b;
    6491             : vertex pa;
    6492             : vertex pb;
    6493             : vertex pc;
    6494             : vertex pd;
    6495             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6496             : 
    6497             : {
    6498           0 :   if (b->weighted == 0) {
    6499           0 :     return incircle(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd);
    6500           0 :   } else if (b->weighted == 1) {
    6501           0 :     return orient3d(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd,
    6502           0 :                     pa[0] * pa[0] + pa[1] * pa[1] - pa[2],
    6503           0 :                     pb[0] * pb[0] + pb[1] * pb[1] - pb[2],
    6504           0 :                     pc[0] * pc[0] + pc[1] * pc[1] - pc[2],
    6505           0 :                     pd[0] * pd[0] + pd[1] * pd[1] - pd[2]);
    6506             :   } else {
    6507           0 :     return orient3d(m, b, pa, pb, pc, pd, pa[2], pb[2], pc[2], pd[2]);
    6508             :   }
    6509             : }
    6510             : 
    6511             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6512             : /*                                                                           */
    6513             : /*  findcircumcenter()   Find the circumcenter of a triangle.                */
    6514             : /*                                                                           */
    6515             : /*  The result is returned both in terms of x-y coordinates and xi-eta       */
    6516             : /*  (barycentric) coordinates.  The xi-eta coordinate system is defined in   */
    6517             : /*  terms of the triangle:  the origin of the triangle is the origin of the  */
    6518             : /*  coordinate system; the destination of the triangle is one unit along the */
    6519             : /*  xi axis; and the apex of the triangle is one unit along the eta axis.    */
    6520             : /*  This procedure also returns the square of the length of the triangle's   */
    6521             : /*  shortest edge.                                                           */
    6522             : /*                                                                           */
    6523             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6524             : 
    6525             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6526             : void findcircumcenter(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    6527             :                       vertex torg, vertex tdest, vertex tapex,
    6528             :                       vertex circumcenter, REAL *xi, REAL *eta, int offcenter)
    6529             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6530           0 : void findcircumcenter(m, b, torg, tdest, tapex, circumcenter, xi, eta,
    6531             :                       offcenter)
    6532             : struct mesh *m;
    6533             : struct behavior *b;
    6534             : vertex torg;
    6535             : vertex tdest;
    6536             : vertex tapex;
    6537             : vertex circumcenter;
    6538             : REAL *xi;
    6539             : REAL *eta;
    6540             : int offcenter;
    6541             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6542             : 
    6543             : {
    6544             :   REAL xdo, ydo, xao, yao;
    6545             :   REAL dodist, aodist, dadist;
    6546             :   REAL denominator;
    6547             :   REAL dx, dy, dxoff, dyoff;
    6548             : 
    6549           0 :   m->circumcentercount++;
    6550             : 
    6551             :   /* Compute the circumcenter of the triangle. */
    6552           0 :   xdo = tdest[0] - torg[0];
    6553           0 :   ydo = tdest[1] - torg[1];
    6554           0 :   xao = tapex[0] - torg[0];
    6555           0 :   yao = tapex[1] - torg[1];
    6556           0 :   dodist = xdo * xdo + ydo * ydo;
    6557           0 :   aodist = xao * xao + yao * yao;
    6558           0 :   dadist = (tdest[0] - tapex[0]) * (tdest[0] - tapex[0]) +
    6559           0 :            (tdest[1] - tapex[1]) * (tdest[1] - tapex[1]);
    6560           0 :   if (b->noexact) {
    6561           0 :     denominator = 0.5 / (xdo * yao - xao * ydo);
    6562             :   } else {
    6563             :     /* Use the counterclockwise() routine to ensure a positive (and */
    6564             :     /*   reasonably accurate) result, avoiding any possibility of   */
    6565             :     /*   division by zero.                                          */
    6566           0 :     denominator = 0.5 / counterclockwise(m, b, tdest, tapex, torg);
    6567             :     /* Don't count the above as an orientation test. */
    6568           0 :     m->counterclockcount--;
    6569             :   }
    6570           0 :   dx = (yao * dodist - ydo * aodist) * denominator;
    6571           0 :   dy = (xdo * aodist - xao * dodist) * denominator;
    6572             : 
    6573             :   /* Find the (squared) length of the triangle's shortest edge.  This   */
    6574             :   /*   serves as a conservative estimate of the insertion radius of the */
    6575             :   /*   circumcenter's parent.  The estimate is used to ensure that      */
    6576             :   /*   the algorithm terminates even if very small angles appear in     */
    6577             :   /*   the input PSLG.                                                  */
    6578           0 :   if ((dodist < aodist) && (dodist < dadist)) {
    6579           0 :     if (offcenter && (b->offconstant > 0.0)) {
    6580             :       /* Find the position of the off-center, as described by Alper Ungor. */
    6581           0 :       dxoff = 0.5 * xdo - b->offconstant * ydo;
    6582           0 :       dyoff = 0.5 * ydo + b->offconstant * xdo;
    6583             :       /* If the off-center is closer to the origin than the */
    6584             :       /*   circumcenter, use the off-center instead.        */
    6585           0 :       if (dxoff * dxoff + dyoff * dyoff < dx * dx + dy * dy) {
    6586           0 :         dx = dxoff;
    6587           0 :         dy = dyoff;
    6588             :       }
    6589             :     }
    6590           0 :   } else if (aodist < dadist) {
    6591           0 :     if (offcenter && (b->offconstant > 0.0)) {
    6592           0 :       dxoff = 0.5 * xao + b->offconstant * yao;
    6593           0 :       dyoff = 0.5 * yao - b->offconstant * xao;
    6594             :       /* If the off-center is closer to the origin than the */
    6595             :       /*   circumcenter, use the off-center instead.        */
    6596           0 :       if (dxoff * dxoff + dyoff * dyoff < dx * dx + dy * dy) {
    6597           0 :         dx = dxoff;
    6598           0 :         dy = dyoff;
    6599             :       }
    6600             :     }
    6601             :   } else {
    6602           0 :     if (offcenter && (b->offconstant > 0.0)) {
    6603           0 :       dxoff = 0.5 * (tapex[0] - tdest[0]) -
    6604           0 :               b->offconstant * (tapex[1] - tdest[1]);
    6605           0 :       dyoff = 0.5 * (tapex[1] - tdest[1]) +
    6606           0 :               b->offconstant * (tapex[0] - tdest[0]);
    6607             :       /* If the off-center is closer to the destination than the */
    6608             :       /*   circumcenter, use the off-center instead.             */
    6609           0 :       if (dxoff * dxoff + dyoff * dyoff <
    6610           0 :           (dx - xdo) * (dx - xdo) + (dy - ydo) * (dy - ydo)) {
    6611           0 :         dx = xdo + dxoff;
    6612           0 :         dy = ydo + dyoff;
    6613             :       }
    6614             :     }
    6615             :   }
    6616             : 
    6617           0 :   circumcenter[0] = torg[0] + dx;
    6618           0 :   circumcenter[1] = torg[1] + dy;
    6619             : 
    6620             :   /* To interpolate vertex attributes for the new vertex inserted at */
