    6621             :   /*   the circumcenter, define a coordinate system with a xi-axis,  */
    6622             :   /*   directed from the triangle's origin to its destination, and   */
    6623             :   /*   an eta-axis, directed from its origin to its apex.            */
    6624             :   /*   Calculate the xi and eta coordinates of the circumcenter.     */
    6625           0 :   *xi = (yao * dx - xao * dy) * (2.0 * denominator);
    6626           0 :   *eta = (xdo * dy - ydo * dx) * (2.0 * denominator);
    6627           0 : }
    6628             : 
    6629             : /**                                                                         **/
    6630             : /**                                                                         **/
    6631             : /********* Geometric primitives end here                             *********/
    6632             : 
    6633             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6634             : /*                                                                           */
    6635             : /*  triangleinit()   Initialize some variables.                              */
    6636             : /*                                                                           */
    6637             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6638             : 
    6639             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6640             : void triangleinit(struct mesh *m)
    6641             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6642           0 : void triangleinit(m)
    6643             : struct mesh *m;
    6644             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6645             : 
    6646             : {
    6647           0 :   poolzero(&m->vertices);
    6648           0 :   poolzero(&m->triangles);
    6649           0 :   poolzero(&m->subsegs);
    6650           0 :   poolzero(&m->viri);
    6651           0 :   poolzero(&m->badsubsegs);
    6652           0 :   poolzero(&m->badtriangles);
    6653           0 :   poolzero(&m->flipstackers);
    6654           0 :   poolzero(&m->splaynodes);
    6655             : 
    6656           0 :   m->recenttri.tri = (triangle *) NULL; /* No triangle has been visited yet. */
    6657           0 :   m->undeads = 0;                       /* No eliminated input vertices yet. */
    6658           0 :   m->samples = 1;         /* Point location should take at least one sample. */
    6659           0 :   m->checksegments = 0;   /* There are no segments in the triangulation yet. */
    6660           0 :   m->checkquality = 0;     /* The quality triangulation stage has not begun. */
    6661           0 :   m->incirclecount = m->counterclockcount = m->orient3dcount = 0;
    6662           0 :   m->hyperbolacount = m->circletopcount = m->circumcentercount = 0;
    6663           0 :   randomseed = 1;
    6664             : 
    6665           0 :   exactinit();                     /* Initialize exact arithmetic constants. */
    6666           0 : }
    6667             : 
    6668             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6669             : /*                                                                           */
    6670             : /*  randomnation()   Generate a random number between 0 and `choices' - 1.   */
    6671             : /*                                                                           */
    6672             : /*  This is a simple linear congruential random number generator.  Hence, it */
    6673             : /*  is a bad random number generator, but good enough for most randomized    */
    6674             : /*  geometric algorithms.                                                    */
    6675             : /*                                                                           */
    6676             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6677             : 
    6678             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6679             : size_t randomnation(unsigned int choices)
    6680             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6681           0 : size_t randomnation(choices)
    6682             : unsigned int choices;
    6683             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6684             : 
    6685             : {
    6686           0 :   randomseed = (randomseed * 1366l + 150889l) % 714025l;
    6687           0 :   return randomseed / (714025l / choices + 1);
    6688             : }
    6689             : 
    6690             : /********* Mesh quality testing routines begin here                  *********/
    6691             : /**                                                                         **/
    6692             : /**                                                                         **/
    6693             : 
    6694             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6695             : /*                                                                           */
    6696             : /*  checkmesh()   Test the mesh for topological consistency.                 */
    6697             : /*                                                                           */
    6698             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6699             : 
    6700             : #ifndef REDUCED
    6701             : 
    6702             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6703             : void checkmesh(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    6704             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6705           0 : void checkmesh(m, b)
    6706             : struct mesh *m;
    6707             : struct behavior *b;
    6708             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6709             : 
    6710             : {
    6711             :   struct otri triangleloop;
    6712             :   struct otri oppotri, oppooppotri;
    6713             :   vertex triorg, tridest, triapex;
    6714             :   vertex oppoorg, oppodest;
    6715             :   int horrors;
    6716             :   int saveexact;
    6717             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    6718             : 
    6719             :   /* Temporarily turn on exact arithmetic if it's off. */
    6720           0 :   saveexact = b->noexact;
    6721           0 :   b->noexact = 0;
    6722           0 :   if (!b->quiet) {
    6723           0 :     printf("  Checking consistency of mesh...\n");
    6724             :   }
    6725           0 :   horrors = 0;
    6726             :   /* Run through the list of triangles, checking each one. */
    6727           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
    6728           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    6729           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
    6730             :     /* Check all three edges of the triangle. */
    6731           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
    6732           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
    6733           0 :       org(triangleloop, triorg);
    6734           0 :       dest(triangleloop, tridest);
    6735           0 :       if (triangleloop.orient == 0) {       /* Only test for inversion once. */
    6736             :         /* Test if the triangle is flat or inverted. */
    6737           0 :         apex(triangleloop, triapex);
    6738           0 :         if (counterclockwise(m, b, triorg, tridest, triapex) <= 0.0) {
    6739           0 :           printf("  !! !! Inverted ");
    6740           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &triangleloop);
    6741           0 :           horrors++;
    6742             :         }
    6743             :       }
    6744             :       /* Find the neighboring triangle on this edge. */
    6745           0 :       sym(triangleloop, oppotri);
    6746           0 :       if (oppotri.tri != m->dummytri) {
    6747             :         /* Check that the triangle's neighbor knows it's a neighbor. */
    6748           0 :         sym(oppotri, oppooppotri);
    6749           0 :         if ((triangleloop.tri != oppooppotri.tri)
    6750           0 :             || (triangleloop.orient != oppooppotri.orient)) {
    6751           0 :           printf("  !! !! Asymmetric triangle-triangle bond:\n");
    6752           0 :           if (triangleloop.tri == oppooppotri.tri) {
    6753           0 :             printf("   (Right triangle, wrong orientation)\n");
    6754             :           }
    6755           0 :           printf("    First ");
    6756           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &triangleloop);
    6757           0 :           printf("    Second (nonreciprocating) ");
    6758           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &oppotri);
    6759           0 :           horrors++;
    6760             :         }
    6761             :         /* Check that both triangles agree on the identities */
    6762             :         /*   of their shared vertices.                       */
    6763           0 :         org(oppotri, oppoorg);
    6764           0 :         dest(oppotri, oppodest);
    6765           0 :         if ((triorg != oppodest) || (tridest != oppoorg)) {
    6766           0 :           printf("  !! !! Mismatched edge coordinates between two triangles:\n"
    6767             :                  );
    6768           0 :           printf("    First mismatched ");
    6769           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &triangleloop);
    6770           0 :           printf("    Second mismatched ");
    6771           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &oppotri);
    6772           0 :           horrors++;
    6773             :         }
    6774             :       }
    6775             :     }
    6776           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    6777             :   }
    6778           0 :   if (horrors == 0) {
    6779           0 :     if (!b->quiet) {
    6780           0 :       printf("  In my studied opinion, the mesh appears to be consistent.\n");
    6781             :     }
    6782           0 :   } else if (horrors == 1) {
    6783           0 :     printf("  !! !! !! !! Precisely one festering wound discovered.\n");
    6784             :   } else {
    6785           0 :     printf("  !! !! !! !! %d abominations witnessed.\n", horrors);
    6786             :   }
    6787             :   /* Restore the status of exact arithmetic. */
    6788           0 :   b->noexact = saveexact;
    6789           0 : }
    6790             : 
    6791             : #endif /* not REDUCED */
    6792             : 
    6793             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6794             : /*                                                                           */
    6795             : /*  checkdelaunay()   Ensure that the mesh is (constrained) Delaunay.        */
    6796             : /*                                                                           */
    6797             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6798             : 
    6799             : #ifndef REDUCED
    6800             : 
    6801             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6802             : void checkdelaunay(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    6803             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6804           0 : void checkdelaunay(m, b)
    6805             : struct mesh *m;
    6806             : struct behavior *b;
    6807             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6808             : 
    6809             : {
    6810             :   struct otri triangleloop;
    6811             :   struct otri oppotri;
    6812             :   struct osub opposubseg;
    6813             :   vertex triorg, tridest, triapex;
    6814             :   vertex oppoapex;
    6815             :   int shouldbedelaunay;
    6816             :   int horrors;
    6817             :   int saveexact;
    6818             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    6819             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    6820             : 
    6821             :   /* Temporarily turn on exact arithmetic if it's off. */
    6822           0 :   saveexact = b->noexact;
    6823           0 :   b->noexact = 0;
    6824           0 :   if (!b->quiet) {
    6825           0 :     printf("  Checking Delaunay property of mesh...\n");
    6826             :   }
    6827           0 :   horrors = 0;
    6828             :   /* Run through the list of triangles, checking each one. */
    6829           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
    6830           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    6831           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
    6832             :     /* Check all three edges of the triangle. */
    6833           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
    6834           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
    6835           0 :       org(triangleloop, triorg);
    6836           0 :       dest(triangleloop, tridest);
    6837           0 :       apex(triangleloop, triapex);
    6838           0 :       sym(triangleloop, oppotri);
    6839           0 :       apex(oppotri, oppoapex);
    6840             :       /* Only test that the edge is locally Delaunay if there is an   */
    6841             :       /*   adjoining triangle whose pointer is larger (to ensure that */
    6842             :       /*   each pair isn't tested twice).                             */
    6843           0 :       shouldbedelaunay = (oppotri.tri != m->dummytri) &&
    6844           0 :             !deadtri(oppotri.tri) && (triangleloop.tri < oppotri.tri) &&
    6845           0 :             (triorg != m->infvertex1) && (triorg != m->infvertex2) &&
    6846           0 :             (triorg != m->infvertex3) &&
    6847           0 :             (tridest != m->infvertex1) && (tridest != m->infvertex2) &&
    6848           0 :             (tridest != m->infvertex3) &&
    6849           0 :             (triapex != m->infvertex1) && (triapex != m->infvertex2) &&
    6850           0 :             (triapex != m->infvertex3) &&
    6851           0 :             (oppoapex != m->infvertex1) && (oppoapex != m->infvertex2) &&
    6852           0 :             (oppoapex != m->infvertex3);
    6853           0 :       if (m->checksegments && shouldbedelaunay) {
    6854             :         /* If a subsegment separates the triangles, then the edge is */
    6855             :         /*   constrained, so no local Delaunay test should be done.  */
    6856           0 :         tspivot(triangleloop, opposubseg);
    6857           0 :         if (opposubseg.ss != m->dummysub){
    6858           0 :           shouldbedelaunay = 0;
    6859             :         }
    6860             :       }
    6861           0 :       if (shouldbedelaunay) {
    6862           0 :         if (nonregular(m, b, triorg, tridest, triapex, oppoapex) > 0.0) {
    6863           0 :           if (!b->weighted) {
    6864           0 :             printf("  !! !! Non-Delaunay pair of triangles:\n");
    6865           0 :             printf("    First non-Delaunay ");
    6866           0 :             printtriangle(m, b, &triangleloop);
    6867           0 :             printf("    Second non-Delaunay ");
    6868             :           } else {
    6869           0 :             printf("  !! !! Non-regular pair of triangles:\n");
    6870           0 :             printf("    First non-regular ");
    6871           0 :             printtriangle(m, b, &triangleloop);
    6872           0 :             printf("    Second non-regular ");
    6873             :           }
    6874           0 :           printtriangle(m, b, &oppotri);
    6875           0 :           horrors++;
    6876             :         }
    6877             :       }
    6878             :     }
    6879           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    6880             :   }
    6881           0 :   if (horrors == 0) {
    6882           0 :     if (!b->quiet) {
    6883           0 :       printf(
    6884             :   "  By virtue of my perceptive intelligence, I declare the mesh Delaunay.\n");
    6885             :     }
    6886           0 :   } else if (horrors == 1) {
    6887           0 :     printf(
    6888             :          "  !! !! !! !! Precisely one terrifying transgression identified.\n");
    6889             :   } else {
    6890           0 :     printf("  !! !! !! !! %d obscenities viewed with horror.\n", horrors);
    6891             :   }
    6892             :   /* Restore the status of exact arithmetic. */
    6893           0 :   b->noexact = saveexact;
    6894           0 : }
    6895             : 
    6896             : #endif /* not REDUCED */
    6897             : 
    6898             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6899             : /*                                                                           */
    6900             : /*  enqueuebadtriang()   Add a bad triangle data structure to the end of a   */
    6901             : /*                       queue.                                              */
    6902             : /*                                                                           */
    6903             : /*  The queue is actually a set of 4096 queues.  I use multiple queues to    */
    6904             : /*  give priority to smaller angles.  I originally implemented a heap, but   */
    6905             : /*  the queues are faster by a larger margin than I'd suspected.             */
    6906             : /*                                                                           */
    6907             : /*****************************************************************************/
    6908             : 
    6909             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    6910             : 
    6911             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    6912             : void enqueuebadtriang(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    6913             :                       struct badtriang *badtri)
    6914             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6915           0 : void enqueuebadtriang(m, b, badtri)
    6916             : struct mesh *m;
    6917             : struct behavior *b;
    6918             : struct badtriang *badtri;
    6919             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    6920             : 
    6921             : {
    6922             :   REAL length, multiplier;
    6923             :   int exponent, expincrement;
    6924             :   int queuenumber;
    6925             :   int posexponent;
    6926             :   int i;
    6927             : 
    6928           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    6929           0 :     printf("  Queueing bad triangle:\n");
    6930           0 :     printf("    (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
    6931           0 :            badtri->triangorg[0], badtri->triangorg[1],
    6932           0 :            badtri->triangdest[0], badtri->triangdest[1],
    6933           0 :            badtri->triangapex[0], badtri->triangapex[1]);
    6934             :   }
    6935             : 
    6936             :   /* Determine the appropriate queue to put the bad triangle into.    */
    6937             :   /*   Recall that the key is the square of its shortest edge length. */
    6938           0 :   if (badtri->key >= 1.0) {
    6939           0 :     length = badtri->key;
    6940           0 :     posexponent = 1;
    6941             :   } else {
    6942             :     /* `badtri->key' is 2.0 to a negative exponent, so we'll record that */
    6943             :     /*   fact and use the reciprocal of `badtri->key', which is > 1.0.   */
    6944           0 :     length = 1.0 / badtri->key;
    6945           0 :     posexponent = 0;
    6946             :   }
    6947             :   /* `length' is approximately 2.0 to what exponent?  The following code */
    6948             :   /*   determines the answer in time logarithmic in the exponent.        */
    6949           0 :   exponent = 0;
    6950           0 :   while (length > 2.0) {
    6951             :     /* Find an approximation by repeated squaring of two. */
    6952           0 :     expincrement = 1;
    6953           0 :     multiplier = 0.5;
    6954           0 :     while (length * multiplier * multiplier > 1.0) {
    6955           0 :       expincrement *= 2;
    6956           0 :       multiplier *= multiplier;
    6957             :     }
    6958             :     /* Reduce the value of `length', then iterate if necessary. */
    6959           0 :     exponent += expincrement;
    6960           0 :     length *= multiplier;
    6961             :   }
    6962             :   /* `length' is approximately squareroot(2.0) to what exponent? */
    6963           0 :   exponent = 2.0 * exponent + (length > SQUAREROOTTWO);
    6964             :   /* `exponent' is now in the range 0...2047 for IEEE double precision.   */
    6965             :   /*   Choose a queue in the range 0...4095.  The shortest edges have the */
    6966             :   /*   highest priority (queue 4095).                                     */
    6967           0 :   if (posexponent) {
    6968           0 :     queuenumber = 2047 - exponent;
    6969             :   } else {
    6970           0 :     queuenumber = 2048 + exponent;
    6971             :   }
    6972             : 
    6973             :   /* Are we inserting into an empty queue? */
    6974           0 :   if (m->queuefront[queuenumber] == (struct badtriang *) NULL) {
    6975             :     /* Yes, we are inserting into an empty queue.     */
    6976             :     /*   Will this become the highest-priority queue? */
    6977           0 :     if (queuenumber > m->firstnonemptyq) {
    6978             :       /* Yes, this is the highest-priority queue. */
    6979           0 :       m->nextnonemptyq[queuenumber] = m->firstnonemptyq;
    6980           0 :       m->firstnonemptyq = queuenumber;
    6981             :     } else {
    6982             :       /* No, this is not the highest-priority queue. */
    6983             :       /*   Find the queue with next higher priority. */
    6984           0 :       i = queuenumber + 1;
    6985           0 :       while (m->queuefront[i] == (struct badtriang *) NULL) {
    6986           0 :         i++;
    6987             :       }
    6988             :       /* Mark the newly nonempty queue as following a higher-priority queue. */
    6989           0 :       m->nextnonemptyq[queuenumber] = m->nextnonemptyq[i];
    6990           0 :       m->nextnonemptyq[i] = queuenumber;
    6991             :     }
    6992             :     /* Put the bad triangle at the beginning of the (empty) queue. */
    6993           0 :     m->queuefront[queuenumber] = badtri;
    6994             :   } else {
    6995             :     /* Add the bad triangle to the end of an already nonempty queue. */
    6996           0 :     m->queuetail[queuenumber]->nexttriang = badtri;
    6997             :   }
    6998             :   /* Maintain a pointer to the last triangle of the queue. */
    6999           0 :   m->queuetail[queuenumber] = badtri;
    7000             :   /* Newly enqueued bad triangle has no successor in the queue. */
    7001           0 :   badtri->nexttriang = (struct badtriang *) NULL;
    7002           0 : }
    7003             : 
    7004             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    7005             : 
    7006             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7007             : /*                                                                           */
    7008             : /*  enqueuebadtri()   Add a bad triangle to the end of a queue.              */
    7009             : /*                                                                           */
    7010             : /*  Allocates a badtriang data structure for the triangle, then passes it to */
    7011             : /*  enqueuebadtriang().                                                      */
    7012             : /*                                                                           */
    7013             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7014             : 
    7015             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    7016             : 
    7017             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7018             : void enqueuebadtri(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *enqtri,
    7019             :                    REAL minedge, vertex enqapex, vertex enqorg, vertex enqdest)
    7020             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7021           0 : void enqueuebadtri(m, b, enqtri, minedge, enqapex, enqorg, enqdest)
    7022             : struct mesh *m;
    7023             : struct behavior *b;
    7024             : struct otri *enqtri;
    7025             : REAL minedge;
    7026             : vertex enqapex;
    7027             : vertex enqorg;
    7028             : vertex enqdest;
    7029             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7030             : 
    7031             : {
    7032             :   struct badtriang *newbad;
    7033             : 
    7034             :   /* Allocate space for the bad triangle. */
    7035           0 :   newbad = (struct badtriang *) poolalloc(&m->badtriangles);
    7036           0 :   newbad->poortri = encode(*enqtri);
    7037           0 :   newbad->key = minedge;
    7038           0 :   newbad->triangapex = enqapex;
    7039           0 :   newbad->triangorg = enqorg;
    7040           0 :   newbad->triangdest = enqdest;
    7041           0 :   enqueuebadtriang(m, b, newbad);
    7042           0 : }
    7043             : 
    7044             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    7045             : 
    7046             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7047             : /*                                                                           */
    7048             : /*  dequeuebadtriang()   Remove a triangle from the front of the queue.      */
    7049             : /*                                                                           */
    7050             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7051             : 
    7052             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    7053             : 
    7054             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7055             : struct badtriang *dequeuebadtriang(struct mesh *m)
    7056             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7057           0 : struct badtriang *dequeuebadtriang(m)
    7058             : struct mesh *m;
    7059             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7060             : 
    7061             : {
    7062             :   struct badtriang *result;
    7063             : 
    7064             :   /* If no queues are nonempty, return NULL. */
    7065           0 :   if (m->firstnonemptyq < 0) {
    7066           0 :     return (struct badtriang *) NULL;
    7067             :   }
    7068             :   /* Find the first triangle of the highest-priority queue. */
    7069           0 :   result = m->queuefront[m->firstnonemptyq];
    7070             :   /* Remove the triangle from the queue. */
    7071           0 :   m->queuefront[m->firstnonemptyq] = result->nexttriang;
    7072             :   /* If this queue is now empty, note the new highest-priority */
    7073             :   /*   nonempty queue.                                         */
    7074           0 :   if (result == m->queuetail[m->firstnonemptyq]) {
    7075           0 :     m->firstnonemptyq = m->nextnonemptyq[m->firstnonemptyq];
    7076             :   }
    7077           0 :   return result;
    7078             : }
    7079             : 
    7080             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    7081             : 
    7082             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7083             : /*                                                                           */
    7084             : /*  checkseg4encroach()   Check a subsegment to see if it is encroached; add */
    7085             : /*                        it to the list if it is.                           */
    7086             : /*                                                                           */
    7087             : /*  A subsegment is encroached if there is a vertex in its diametral lens.   */
    7088             : /*  For Ruppert's algorithm (-D switch), the "diametral lens" is the         */
    7089             : /*  diametral circle.  For Chew's algorithm (default), the diametral lens is */
    7090             : /*  just big enough to enclose two isosceles triangles whose bases are the   */
    7091             : /*  subsegment.  Each of the two isosceles triangles has two angles equal    */
    7092             : /*  to `b->minangle'.                                                        */
    7093             : /*                                                                           */
    7094             : /*  Chew's algorithm does not require diametral lenses at all--but they save */
    7095             : /*  time.  Any vertex inside a subsegment's diametral lens implies that the  */
    7096             : /*  triangle adjoining the subsegment will be too skinny, so it's only a     */
    7097             : /*  matter of time before the encroaching vertex is deleted by Chew's        */
    7098             : /*  algorithm.  It's faster to simply not insert the doomed vertex in the    */
    7099             : /*  first place, which is why I use diametral lenses with Chew's algorithm.  */
    7100             : /*                                                                           */
    7101             : /*  Returns a nonzero value if the subsegment is encroached.                 */
    7102             : /*                                                                           */
    7103             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7104             : 
    7105             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    7106             : 
    7107             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7108             : int checkseg4encroach(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    7109             :                       struct osub *testsubseg)
    7110             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7111           0 : int checkseg4encroach(m, b, testsubseg)
    7112             : struct mesh *m;
    7113             : struct behavior *b;
    7114             : struct osub *testsubseg;
    7115             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7116             : 
    7117             : {
    7118             :   struct otri neighbortri;
    7119             :   struct osub testsym;
    7120             :   struct badsubseg *encroachedseg;
    7121             :   REAL dotproduct;
    7122             :   int encroached;
    7123             :   int sides;
    7124             :   vertex eorg, edest, eapex;
    7125             :   triangle ptr;                     /* Temporary variable used by stpivot(). */
    7126             : 
    7127           0 :   encroached = 0;
    7128           0 :   sides = 0;
    7129             : 
    7130           0 :   sorg(*testsubseg, eorg);
    7131           0 :   sdest(*testsubseg, edest);
    7132             :   /* Check one neighbor of the subsegment. */
    7133           0 :   stpivot(*testsubseg, neighbortri);
    7134             :   /* Does the neighbor exist, or is this a boundary edge? */
    7135           0 :   if (neighbortri.tri != m->dummytri) {
    7136           0 :     sides++;
    7137             :     /* Find a vertex opposite this subsegment. */
    7138           0 :     apex(neighbortri, eapex);
    7139             :     /* Check whether the apex is in the diametral lens of the subsegment */
    7140             :     /*   (the diametral circle if `conformdel' is set).  A dot product   */
    7141             :     /*   of two sides of the triangle is used to check whether the angle */
    7142             :     /*   at the apex is greater than (180 - 2 `minangle') degrees (for   */
    7143             :     /*   lenses; 90 degrees for diametral circles).                      */
    7144           0 :     dotproduct = (eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7145           0 :                  (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1]);
    7146           0 :     if (dotproduct < 0.0) {
    7147           0 :       if (b->conformdel ||
    7148           0 :           (dotproduct * dotproduct >=
    7149           0 :            (2.0 * b->goodangle - 1.0) * (2.0 * b->goodangle - 1.0) *
    7150           0 :            ((eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (eorg[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7151           0 :             (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (eorg[1] - eapex[1])) *
    7152           0 :            ((edest[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7153           0 :             (edest[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1])))) {
    7154           0 :         encroached = 1;
    7155             :       }
    7156             :     }
    7157             :   }
    7158             :   /* Check the other neighbor of the subsegment. */
    7159           0 :   ssym(*testsubseg, testsym);
    7160           0 :   stpivot(testsym, neighbortri);
    7161             :   /* Does the neighbor exist, or is this a boundary edge? */
    7162           0 :   if (neighbortri.tri != m->dummytri) {
    7163           0 :     sides++;
    7164             :     /* Find the other vertex opposite this subsegment. */
    7165           0 :     apex(neighbortri, eapex);
    7166             :     /* Check whether the apex is in the diametral lens of the subsegment */
    7167             :     /*   (or the diametral circle, if `conformdel' is set).              */
    7168           0 :     dotproduct = (eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7169           0 :                  (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1]);
    7170           0 :     if (dotproduct < 0.0) {
    7171           0 :       if (b->conformdel ||
    7172           0 :           (dotproduct * dotproduct >=
    7173           0 :            (2.0 * b->goodangle - 1.0) * (2.0 * b->goodangle - 1.0) *
    7174           0 :            ((eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (eorg[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7175           0 :             (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (eorg[1] - eapex[1])) *
    7176           0 :            ((edest[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
    7177           0 :             (edest[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1])))) {
    7178           0 :         encroached += 2;
    7179             :       }
    7180             :     }
    7181             :   }
    7182             : 
    7183           0 :   if (encroached && (!b->nobisect || ((b->nobisect == 1) && (sides == 2)))) {
    7184           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7185           0 :       printf(
    7186             :         "  Queueing encroached subsegment (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7187           0 :         eorg[0], eorg[1], edest[0], edest[1]);
    7188             :     }
    7189             :     /* Add the subsegment to the list of encroached subsegments. */
    7190             :     /*   Be sure to get the orientation right.                   */
    7191           0 :     encroachedseg = (struct badsubseg *) poolalloc(&m->badsubsegs);
    7192           0 :     if (encroached == 1) {
    7193           0 :       encroachedseg->encsubseg = sencode(*testsubseg);
    7194           0 :       encroachedseg->subsegorg = eorg;
    7195           0 :       encroachedseg->subsegdest = edest;
    7196             :     } else {
    7197           0 :       encroachedseg->encsubseg = sencode(testsym);
    7198           0 :       encroachedseg->subsegorg = edest;
    7199           0 :       encroachedseg->subsegdest = eorg;
    7200             :     }
    7201             :   }
    7202             : 
    7203           0 :   return encroached;
    7204             : }
    7205             : 
    7206             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    7207             : 
    7208             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7209             : /*                                                                           */
    7210             : /*  testtriangle()   Test a triangle for quality and size.                   */
    7211             : /*                                                                           */
    7212             : /*  Tests a triangle to see if it satisfies the minimum angle condition and  */
    7213             : /*  the maximum area condition.  Triangles that aren't up to spec are added  */
    7214             : /*  to the bad triangle queue.                                               */
    7215             : /*                                                                           */
    7216             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7217             : 
    7218             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    7219             : 
    7220             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7221             : void testtriangle(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *testtri)
    7222             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7223           0 : void testtriangle(m, b, testtri)
    7224             : struct mesh *m;
    7225             : struct behavior *b;
    7226             : struct otri *testtri;
    7227             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7228             : 
    7229             : {
    7230             :   struct otri tri1, tri2;
    7231             :   struct osub testsub;
    7232             :   vertex torg, tdest, tapex;
    7233             :   vertex base1, base2;
    7234             :   vertex org1, dest1, org2, dest2;
    7235             :   vertex joinvertex;
    7236             :   REAL dxod, dyod, dxda, dyda, dxao, dyao;
    7237             :   REAL dxod2, dyod2, dxda2, dyda2, dxao2, dyao2;
    7238             :   REAL apexlen, orglen, destlen, minedge;
    7239             :   REAL angle;
    7240             :   REAL area;
    7241             :   REAL dist1, dist2;
    7242             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    7243             :   triangle ptr;           /* Temporary variable used by oprev() and dnext(). */
    7244             : 
    7245           0 :   org(*testtri, torg);
    7246           0 :   dest(*testtri, tdest);
    7247           0 :   apex(*testtri, tapex);
    7248           0 :   dxod = torg[0] - tdest[0];
    7249           0 :   dyod = torg[1] - tdest[1];
    7250           0 :   dxda = tdest[0] - tapex[0];
    7251           0 :   dyda = tdest[1] - tapex[1];
    7252           0 :   dxao = tapex[0] - torg[0];
    7253           0 :   dyao = tapex[1] - torg[1];
    7254           0 :   dxod2 = dxod * dxod;
    7255           0 :   dyod2 = dyod * dyod;
    7256           0 :   dxda2 = dxda * dxda;
    7257           0 :   dyda2 = dyda * dyda;
    7258           0 :   dxao2 = dxao * dxao;
    7259           0 :   dyao2 = dyao * dyao;
    7260             :   /* Find the lengths of the triangle's three edges. */
    7261           0 :   apexlen = dxod2 + dyod2;
    7262           0 :   orglen = dxda2 + dyda2;
    7263           0 :   destlen = dxao2 + dyao2;
    7264             : 
    7265           0 :   if ((apexlen < orglen) && (apexlen < destlen)) {
    7266             :     /* The edge opposite the apex is shortest. */
    7267           0 :     minedge = apexlen;
    7268             :     /* Find the square of the cosine of the angle at the apex. */
    7269           0 :     angle = dxda * dxao + dyda * dyao;
    7270           0 :     angle = angle * angle / (orglen * destlen);
    7271           0 :     base1 = torg;
    7272           0 :     base2 = tdest;
    7273           0 :     otricopy(*testtri, tri1);
    7274           0 :   } else if (orglen < destlen) {
    7275             :     /* The edge opposite the origin is shortest. */
    7276           0 :     minedge = orglen;
    7277             :     /* Find the square of the cosine of the angle at the origin. */
    7278           0 :     angle = dxod * dxao + dyod * dyao;
    7279           0 :     angle = angle * angle / (apexlen * destlen);
    7280           0 :     base1 = tdest;
    7281           0 :     base2 = tapex;
    7282           0 :     lnext(*testtri, tri1);
    7283             :   } else {
    7284             :     /* The edge opposite the destination is shortest. */
    7285           0 :     minedge = destlen;
    7286             :     /* Find the square of the cosine of the angle at the destination. */
    7287           0 :     angle = dxod * dxda + dyod * dyda;
    7288           0 :     angle = angle * angle / (apexlen * orglen);
    7289           0 :     base1 = tapex;
    7290           0 :     base2 = torg;
    7291           0 :     lprev(*testtri, tri1);
    7292             :   }
    7293             : 
    7294           0 :   if (b->vararea || b->fixedarea || b->usertest) {
    7295             :     /* Check whether the area is larger than permitted. */
    7296           0 :     area = 0.5 * (dxod * dyda - dyod * dxda);
    7297           0 :     if (b->fixedarea && (area > b->maxarea)) {
    7298             :       /* Add this triangle to the list of bad triangles. */
    7299           0 :       enqueuebadtri(m, b, testtri, minedge, tapex, torg, tdest);
    7300           0 :       return;
    7301             :     }
    7302             : 
    7303             :     /* Nonpositive area constraints are treated as unconstrained. */
    7304           0 :     if ((b->vararea) && (area > areabound(*testtri)) &&
    7305           0 :         (areabound(*testtri) > 0.0)) {
    7306             :       /* Add this triangle to the list of bad triangles. */
    7307           0 :       enqueuebadtri(m, b, testtri, minedge, tapex, torg, tdest);
    7308           0 :       return;
    7309             :     }
    7310             : 
    7311           0 :     if (b->usertest) {
    7312             :       /* Check whether the user thinks this triangle is too large. */
    7313           0 :       if (triunsuitable(torg, tdest, tapex, area)) {
    7314           0 :         enqueuebadtri(m, b, testtri, minedge, tapex, torg, tdest);
    7315           0 :         return;
    7316             :       }
    7317             :     }
    7318             :   }
    7319             : 
    7320             :   /* Check whether the angle is smaller than permitted. */
    7321           0 :   if (angle > b->goodangle) {
    7322             :     /* Use the rules of Miller, Pav, and Walkington to decide that certain */
    7323             :     /*   triangles should not be split, even if they have bad angles.      */
    7324             :     /*   A skinny triangle is not split if its shortest edge subtends a    */
    7325             :     /*   small input angle, and both endpoints of the edge lie on a        */
    7326             :     /*   concentric circular shell.  For convenience, I make a small       */
    7327             :     /*   adjustment to that rule:  I check if the endpoints of the edge    */
    7328             :     /*   both lie in segment interiors, equidistant from the apex where    */
    7329             :     /*   the two segments meet.                                            */
    7330             :     /* First, check if both points lie in segment interiors.               */
    7331           0 :     if ((vertextype(base1) == SEGMENTVERTEX) &&
    7332           0 :         (vertextype(base2) == SEGMENTVERTEX)) {
    7333             :       /* Check if both points lie in a common segment.  If they do, the */
    7334             :       /*   skinny triangle is enqueued to be split as usual.            */
    7335           0 :       tspivot(tri1, testsub);
    7336           0 :       if (testsub.ss == m->dummysub) {
    7337             :         /* No common segment.  Find a subsegment that contains `torg'. */
    7338           0 :         otricopy(tri1, tri2);
    7339             :         do {
    7340           0 :           oprevself(tri1);
    7341           0 :           tspivot(tri1, testsub);
    7342           0 :         } while (testsub.ss == m->dummysub);
    7343             :         /* Find the endpoints of the containing segment. */
    7344           0 :         segorg(testsub, org1);
    7345           0 :         segdest(testsub, dest1);
    7346             :         /* Find a subsegment that contains `tdest'. */
    7347             :         do {
    7348           0 :           dnextself(tri2);
    7349           0 :           tspivot(tri2, testsub);
    7350           0 :         } while (testsub.ss == m->dummysub);
    7351             :         /* Find the endpoints of the containing segment. */
    7352           0 :         segorg(testsub, org2);
    7353           0 :         segdest(testsub, dest2);
    7354             :         /* Check if the two containing segments have an endpoint in common. */
    7355           0 :         joinvertex = (vertex) NULL;
    7356           0 :         if ((dest1[0] == org2[0]) && (dest1[1] == org2[1])) {
    7357           0 :           joinvertex = dest1;
    7358           0 :         } else if ((org1[0] == dest2[0]) && (org1[1] == dest2[1])) {
    7359           0 :           joinvertex = org1;
    7360             :         }
    7361           0 :         if (joinvertex != (vertex) NULL) {
    7362             :           /* Compute the distance from the common endpoint (of the two  */
    7363             :           /*   segments) to each of the endpoints of the shortest edge. */
    7364           0 :           dist1 = ((base1[0] - joinvertex[0]) * (base1[0] - joinvertex[0]) +
    7365           0 :                    (base1[1] - joinvertex[1]) * (base1[1] - joinvertex[1]));
    7366           0 :           dist2 = ((base2[0] - joinvertex[0]) * (base2[0] - joinvertex[0]) +
    7367           0 :                    (base2[1] - joinvertex[1]) * (base2[1] - joinvertex[1]));
    7368             :           /* If the two distances are equal, don't split the triangle. */
    7369           0 :           if ((dist1 < 1.001 * dist2) && (dist1 > 0.999 * dist2)) {
    7370             :             /* Return now to avoid enqueueing the bad triangle. */
    7371           0 :             return;
    7372             :           }
    7373             :         }
    7374             :       }
    7375             :     }
    7376             : 
    7377             :     /* Add this triangle to the list of bad triangles. */
    7378           0 :     enqueuebadtri(m, b, testtri, minedge, tapex, torg, tdest);
    7379             :   }
    7380             : }
    7381             : 
    7382             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    7383             : 
    7384             : /**                                                                         **/
    7385             : /**                                                                         **/
    7386             : /********* Mesh quality testing routines end here                    *********/
    7387             : 
    7388             : /********* Point location routines begin here                        *********/
    7389             : /**                                                                         **/
    7390             : /**                                                                         **/
    7391             : 
    7392             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7393             : /*                                                                           */
    7394             : /*  makevertexmap()   Construct a mapping from vertices to triangles to      */
    7395             : /*                    improve the speed of point location for segment        */
    7396             : /*                    insertion.                                             */
    7397             : /*                                                                           */
    7398             : /*  Traverses all the triangles, and provides each corner of each triangle   */
    7399             : /*  with a pointer to that triangle.  Of course, pointers will be            */
    7400             : /*  overwritten by other pointers because (almost) each vertex is a corner   */
    7401             : /*  of several triangles, but in the end every vertex will point to some     */
    7402             : /*  triangle that contains it.                                               */
    7403             : /*                                                                           */
    7404             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7405             : 
    7406             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7407             : void makevertexmap(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    7408             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7409           0 : void makevertexmap(m, b)
    7410             : struct mesh *m;
    7411             : struct behavior *b;
    7412             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7413             : 
    7414             : {
    7415             :   struct otri triangleloop;
    7416             :   vertex triorg;
    7417             : 
    7418           0 :   if (b->verbose) {
    7419           0 :     printf("    Constructing mapping from vertices to triangles.\n");
    7420             :   }
    7421           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
    7422           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    7423           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
    7424             :     /* Check all three vertices of the triangle. */
    7425           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
    7426           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
    7427           0 :       org(triangleloop, triorg);
    7428           0 :       setvertex2tri(triorg, encode(triangleloop));
    7429             :     }
    7430           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
    7431             :   }
    7432           0 : }
    7433             : 
    7434             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7435             : /*                                                                           */
    7436             : /*  preciselocate()   Find a triangle or edge containing a given point.      */
    7437             : /*                                                                           */
    7438             : /*  Begins its search from `searchtri'.  It is important that `searchtri'    */
    7439             : /*  be a handle with the property that `searchpoint' is strictly to the left */
    7440             : /*  of the edge denoted by `searchtri', or is collinear with that edge and   */
    7441             : /*  does not intersect that edge.  (In particular, `searchpoint' should not  */
    7442             : /*  be the origin or destination of that edge.)                              */
    7443             : /*                                                                           */
    7444             : /*  These conditions are imposed because preciselocate() is normally used in */
    7445             : /*  one of two situations:                                                   */
    7446             : /*                                                                           */
    7447             : /*  (1)  To try to find the location to insert a new point.  Normally, we    */
    7448             : /*       know an edge that the point is strictly to the left of.  In the     */
    7449             : /*       incremental Delaunay algorithm, that edge is a bounding box edge.   */
    7450             : /*       In Ruppert's Delaunay refinement algorithm for quality meshing,     */
    7451             : /*       that edge is the shortest edge of the triangle whose circumcenter   */
    7452             : /*       is being inserted.                                                  */
    7453             : /*                                                                           */
    7454             : /*  (2)  To try to find an existing point.  In this case, any edge on the    */
    7455             : /*       convex hull is a good starting edge.  You must screen out the       */
    7456             : /*       possibility that the vertex sought is an endpoint of the starting   */
    7457             : /*       edge before you call preciselocate().                               */
    7458             : /*                                                                           */
    7459             : /*  On completion, `searchtri' is a triangle that contains `searchpoint'.    */
    7460             : /*                                                                           */
    7461             : /*  This implementation differs from that given by Guibas and Stolfi.  It    */
    7462             : /*  walks from triangle to triangle, crossing an edge only if `searchpoint'  */
    7463             : /*  is on the other side of the line containing that edge.  After entering   */
    7464             : /*  a triangle, there are two edges by which one can leave that triangle.    */
    7465             : /*  If both edges are valid (`searchpoint' is on the other side of both      */
    7466             : /*  edges), one of the two is chosen by drawing a line perpendicular to      */
    7467             : /*  the entry edge (whose endpoints are `forg' and `fdest') passing through  */
    7468             : /*  `fapex'.  Depending on which side of this perpendicular `searchpoint'    */
    7469             : /*  falls on, an exit edge is chosen.                                        */
    7470             : /*                                                                           */
    7471             : /*  This implementation is empirically faster than the Guibas and Stolfi     */
    7472             : /*  point location routine (which I originally used), which tends to spiral  */
    7473             : /*  in toward its target.                                                    */
    7474             : /*                                                                           */
    7475             : /*  Returns ONVERTEX if the point lies on an existing vertex.  `searchtri'   */
    7476             : /*  is a handle whose origin is the existing vertex.                         */
    7477             : /*                                                                           */
    7478             : /*  Returns ONEDGE if the point lies on a mesh edge.  `searchtri' is a       */
    7479             : /*  handle whose primary edge is the edge on which the point lies.           */
    7480             : /*                                                                           */
    7481             : /*  Returns INTRIANGLE if the point lies strictly within a triangle.         */
    7482             : /*  `searchtri' is a handle on the triangle that contains the point.         */
    7483             : /*                                                                           */
    7484             : /*  Returns OUTSIDE if the point lies outside the mesh.  `searchtri' is a    */
    7485             : /*  handle whose primary edge the point is to the right of.  This might      */
    7486             : /*  occur when the circumcenter of a triangle falls just slightly outside    */
    7487             : /*  the mesh due to floating-point roundoff error.  It also occurs when      */
    7488             : /*  seeking a hole or region point that a foolish user has placed outside    */
    7489             : /*  the mesh.                                                                */
    7490             : /*                                                                           */
    7491             : /*  If `stopatsubsegment' is nonzero, the search will stop if it tries to    */
    7492             : /*  walk through a subsegment, and will return OUTSIDE.                      */
    7493             : /*                                                                           */
    7494             : /*  WARNING:  This routine is designed for convex triangulations, and will   */
    7495             : /*  not generally work after the holes and concavities have been carved.     */
    7496             : /*  However, it can still be used to find the circumcenter of a triangle, as */
    7497             : /*  ptrdiff_t  as the search is begun from the triangle in question.               */
    7498             : /*                                                                           */
    7499             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7500             : 
    7501             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7502             : enum locateresult preciselocate(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    7503             :                                 vertex searchpoint, struct otri *searchtri,
    7504             :                                 int stopatsubsegment)
    7505             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7506           0 : enum locateresult preciselocate(m, b, searchpoint, searchtri, stopatsubsegment)
    7507             : struct mesh *m;
    7508             : struct behavior *b;
    7509             : vertex searchpoint;
    7510             : struct otri *searchtri;
    7511             : int stopatsubsegment;
    7512             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7513             : 
    7514             : {
    7515             :   struct otri backtracktri;
    7516             :   struct osub checkedge;
    7517             :   vertex forg, fdest, fapex;
    7518             :   REAL orgorient, destorient;
    7519             :   int moveleft;
    7520             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    7521             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    7522             : 
    7523           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7524           0 :     printf("  Searching for point (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7525           0 :            searchpoint[0], searchpoint[1]);
    7526             :   }
    7527             :   /* Where are we? */
    7528           0 :   org(*searchtri, forg);
    7529           0 :   dest(*searchtri, fdest);
    7530           0 :   apex(*searchtri, fapex);
    7531             :   while (1) {
    7532           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7533           0 :       printf("    At (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
    7534           0 :              forg[0], forg[1], fdest[0], fdest[1], fapex[0], fapex[1]);
    7535             :     }
    7536             :     /* Check whether the apex is the point we seek. */
    7537           0 :     if ((fapex[0] == searchpoint[0]) && (fapex[1] == searchpoint[1])) {
    7538           0 :       lprevself(*searchtri);
    7539           0 :       return ONVERTEX;
    7540             :     }
    7541             :     /* Does the point lie on the other side of the line defined by the */
    7542             :     /*   triangle edge opposite the triangle's destination?            */
    7543           0 :     destorient = counterclockwise(m, b, forg, fapex, searchpoint);
    7544             :     /* Does the point lie on the other side of the line defined by the */
    7545             :     /*   triangle edge opposite the triangle's origin?                 */
    7546           0 :     orgorient = counterclockwise(m, b, fapex, fdest, searchpoint);
    7547           0 :     if (destorient > 0.0) {
    7548           0 :       if (orgorient > 0.0) {
    7549             :         /* Move left if the inner product of (fapex - searchpoint) and  */
    7550             :         /*   (fdest - forg) is positive.  This is equivalent to drawing */
    7551             :         /*   a line perpendicular to the line (forg, fdest) and passing */
    7552             :         /*   through `fapex', and determining which side of this line   */
    7553             :         /*   `searchpoint' falls on.                                    */
    7554           0 :         moveleft = (fapex[0] - searchpoint[0]) * (fdest[0] - forg[0]) +
    7555           0 :                    (fapex[1] - searchpoint[1]) * (fdest[1] - forg[1]) > 0.0;
    7556             :       } else {
    7557           0 :         moveleft = 1;
    7558             :       }
    7559             :     } else {
    7560           0 :       if (orgorient > 0.0) {
    7561           0 :         moveleft = 0;
    7562             :       } else {
    7563             :         /* The point we seek must be on the boundary of or inside this */
    7564             :         /*   triangle.                                                 */
    7565           0 :         if (destorient == 0.0) {
    7566           0 :           lprevself(*searchtri);
    7567           0 :           return ONEDGE;
    7568             :         }
    7569           0 :         if (orgorient == 0.0) {
    7570           0 :           lnextself(*searchtri);
    7571           0 :           return ONEDGE;
    7572             :         }
    7573           0 :         return INTRIANGLE;
    7574             :       }
    7575             :     }
    7576             : 
    7577             :     /* Move to another triangle.  Leave a trace `backtracktri' in case */
    7578             :     /*   floating-point roundoff or some such bogey causes us to walk  */
    7579             :     /*   off a boundary of the triangulation.                          */
    7580           0 :     if (moveleft) {
    7581           0 :       lprev(*searchtri, backtracktri);
    7582           0 :       fdest = fapex;
    7583             :     } else {
    7584           0 :       lnext(*searchtri, backtracktri);
    7585           0 :       forg = fapex;
    7586             :     }
    7587           0 :     sym(backtracktri, *searchtri);
    7588             : 
    7589           0 :     if (m->checksegments && stopatsubsegment) {
    7590             :       /* Check for walking through a subsegment. */
    7591           0 :       tspivot(backtracktri, checkedge);
    7592           0 :       if (checkedge.ss != m->dummysub) {
    7593             :         /* Go back to the last triangle. */
    7594           0 :         otricopy(backtracktri, *searchtri);
    7595           0 :         return OUTSIDE;
    7596             :       }
    7597             :     }
    7598             :     /* Check for walking right out of the triangulation. */
    7599           0 :     if (searchtri->tri == m->dummytri) {
    7600             :       /* Go back to the last triangle. */
    7601           0 :       otricopy(backtracktri, *searchtri);
    7602           0 :       return OUTSIDE;
    7603             :     }
    7604             : 
    7605           0 :     apex(*searchtri, fapex);
    7606             :   }
    7607             : }
    7608             : 
    7609             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7610             : /*                                                                           */
    7611             : /*  locate()   Find a triangle or edge containing a given point.             */
    7612             : /*                                                                           */
    7613             : /*  Searching begins from one of:  the input `searchtri', a recently         */
    7614             : /*  encountered triangle `recenttri', or from a triangle chosen from a       */
    7615             : /*  random sample.  The choice is made by determining which triangle's       */
    7616             : /*  origin is closest to the point we are searching for.  Normally,          */
    7617             : /*  `searchtri' should be a handle on the convex hull of the triangulation.  */
    7618             : /*                                                                           */
    7619             : /*  Details on the random sampling method can be found in the Mucke, Saias,  */
    7620             : /*  and Zhu paper cited in the header of this code.                          */
    7621             : /*                                                                           */
    7622             : /*  On completion, `searchtri' is a triangle that contains `searchpoint'.    */
    7623             : /*                                                                           */
    7624             : /*  Returns ONVERTEX if the point lies on an existing vertex.  `searchtri'   */
    7625             : /*  is a handle whose origin is the existing vertex.                         */
    7626             : /*                                                                           */
    7627             : /*  Returns ONEDGE if the point lies on a mesh edge.  `searchtri' is a       */
    7628             : /*  handle whose primary edge is the edge on which the point lies.           */
    7629             : /*                                                                           */
    7630             : /*  Returns INTRIANGLE if the point lies strictly within a triangle.         */
    7631             : /*  `searchtri' is a handle on the triangle that contains the point.         */
    7632             : /*                                                                           */
    7633             : /*  Returns OUTSIDE if the point lies outside the mesh.  `searchtri' is a    */
    7634             : /*  handle whose primary edge the point is to the right of.  This might      */
    7635             : /*  occur when the circumcenter of a triangle falls just slightly outside    */
    7636             : /*  the mesh due to floating-point roundoff error.  It also occurs when      */
    7637             : /*  seeking a hole or region point that a foolish user has placed outside    */
    7638             : /*  the mesh.                                                                */
    7639             : /*                                                                           */
    7640             : /*  WARNING:  This routine is designed for convex triangulations, and will   */
    7641             : /*  not generally work after the holes and concavities have been carved.     */
    7642             : /*                                                                           */
    7643             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7644             : 
    7645             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7646             : enum locateresult locate(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    7647             :                          vertex searchpoint, struct otri *searchtri)
    7648             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7649           0 : enum locateresult locate(m, b, searchpoint, searchtri)
    7650             : struct mesh *m;
    7651             : struct behavior *b;
    7652             : vertex searchpoint;
    7653             : struct otri *searchtri;
    7654             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7655             : 
    7656             : {
    7657             :   VOID **sampleblock;
    7658             :   char *firsttri;
    7659             :   struct otri sampletri;
    7660             :   vertex torg, tdest;
    7661             :   size_t alignptr;
    7662             :   REAL searchdist, dist;
    7663             :   REAL ahead;
    7664             :   ptrdiff_t  samplesperblock, totalsamplesleft, samplesleft;
    7665             :   ptrdiff_t  population, totalpopulation;
    7666             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    7667             : 
    7668           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7669           0 :     printf("  Randomly sampling for a triangle near point (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7670           0 :            searchpoint[0], searchpoint[1]);
    7671             :   }
    7672             :   /* Record the distance from the suggested starting triangle to the */
    7673             :   /*   point we seek.                                                */
    7674           0 :   org(*searchtri, torg);
    7675           0 :   searchdist = (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) * (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) +
    7676           0 :                (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]) * (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]);
    7677           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7678           0 :     printf("    Boundary triangle has origin (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7679           0 :            torg[0], torg[1]);
    7680             :   }
    7681             : 
    7682             :   /* If a recently encountered triangle has been recorded and has not been */
    7683             :   /*   deallocated, test it as a good starting point.                      */
    7684           0 :   if (m->recenttri.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
    7685           0 :     if (!deadtri(m->recenttri.tri)) {
    7686           0 :       org(m->recenttri, torg);
    7687           0 :       if ((torg[0] == searchpoint[0]) && (torg[1] == searchpoint[1])) {
    7688           0 :         otricopy(m->recenttri, *searchtri);
    7689           0 :         return ONVERTEX;
    7690             :       }
    7691           0 :       dist = (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) * (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) +
    7692           0 :              (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]) * (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]);
    7693           0 :       if (dist < searchdist) {
    7694           0 :         otricopy(m->recenttri, *searchtri);
    7695           0 :         searchdist = dist;
    7696           0 :         if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7697           0 :           printf("    Choosing recent triangle with origin (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7698           0 :                  torg[0], torg[1]);
    7699             :         }
    7700             :       }
    7701             :     }
    7702             :   }
    7703             : 
    7704             :   /* The number of random samples taken is proportional to the cube root of */
    7705             :   /*   the number of triangles in the mesh.  The next bit of code assumes   */
    7706             :   /*   that the number of triangles increases monotonically (or at least    */
    7707             :   /*   doesn't decrease enough to matter).                                  */
    7708           0 :   while (SAMPLEFACTOR * m->samples * m->samples * m->samples <
    7709           0 :          m->triangles.items) {
    7710           0 :     m->samples++;
    7711             :   }
    7712             : 
    7713             :   /* We'll draw ceiling(samples * TRIPERBLOCK / maxitems) random samples  */
    7714             :   /*   from each block of triangles (except the first)--until we meet the */
    7715             :   /*   sample quota.  The ceiling means that blocks at the end might be   */
    7716             :   /*   neglected, but I don't care.                                       */
    7717           0 :   samplesperblock = (m->samples * TRIPERBLOCK - 1) / m->triangles.maxitems + 1;
    7718             :   /* We'll draw ceiling(samples * itemsfirstblock / maxitems) random samples */
    7719             :   /*   from the first block of triangles.                                    */
    7720           0 :   samplesleft = (m->samples * m->triangles.itemsfirstblock - 1) /
    7721           0 :                 m->triangles.maxitems + 1;
    7722           0 :   totalsamplesleft = m->samples;
    7723           0 :   population = m->triangles.itemsfirstblock;
    7724           0 :   totalpopulation = m->triangles.maxitems;
    7725           0 :   sampleblock = m->triangles.firstblock;
    7726           0 :   sampletri.orient = 0;
    7727           0 :   while (totalsamplesleft > 0) {
    7728             :     /* If we're in the last block, `population' needs to be corrected. */
    7729           0 :     if (population > totalpopulation) {
    7730           0 :       population = totalpopulation;
    7731             :     }
    7732             :     /* Find a pointer to the first triangle in the block. */
    7733           0 :     alignptr = (size_t) (sampleblock + 1);
    7734           0 :     firsttri = (char *) (alignptr +
    7735           0 :                          (size_t) m->triangles.alignbytes -
    7736           0 :                          (alignptr %
    7737           0 :                           (size_t) m->triangles.alignbytes));
    7738             : 
    7739             :     /* Choose `samplesleft' randomly sampled triangles in this block. */
    7740             :     do {
    7741           0 :       sampletri.tri = (triangle *) (firsttri +
    7742           0 :                                     (randomnation((unsigned int) population) *
    7743           0 :                                      m->triangles.itembytes));
    7744           0 :       if (!deadtri(sampletri.tri)) {
    7745           0 :         org(sampletri, torg);
    7746           0 :         dist = (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) * (searchpoint[0] - torg[0]) +
    7747           0 :                (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]) * (searchpoint[1] - torg[1]);
    7748           0 :         if (dist < searchdist) {
    7749           0 :           otricopy(sampletri, *searchtri);
    7750           0 :           searchdist = dist;
    7751           0 :           if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7752           0 :             printf("    Choosing triangle with origin (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
    7753           0 :                    torg[0], torg[1]);
    7754             :           }
    7755             :         }
    7756             :       }
    7757             : 
    7758           0 :       samplesleft--;
    7759           0 :       totalsamplesleft--;
    7760           0 :     } while ((samplesleft > 0) && (totalsamplesleft > 0));
    7761             : 
    7762           0 :     if (totalsamplesleft > 0) {
    7763           0 :       sampleblock = (VOID **) *sampleblock;
    7764           0 :       samplesleft = samplesperblock;
    7765           0 :       totalpopulation -= population;
    7766           0 :       population = TRIPERBLOCK;
    7767             :     }
    7768             :   }
    7769             : 
    7770             :   /* Where are we? */
    7771           0 :   org(*searchtri, torg);
    7772           0 :   dest(*searchtri, tdest);
    7773             :   /* Check the starting triangle's vertices. */
    7774           0 :   if ((torg[0] == searchpoint[0]) && (torg[1] == searchpoint[1])) {
    7775           0 :     return ONVERTEX;
    7776             :   }
    7777           0 :   if ((tdest[0] == searchpoint[0]) && (tdest[1] == searchpoint[1])) {
    7778           0 :     lnextself(*searchtri);
    7779           0 :     return ONVERTEX;
    7780             :   }
    7781             :   /* Orient `searchtri' to fit the preconditions of calling preciselocate(). */
    7782           0 :   ahead = counterclockwise(m, b, torg, tdest, searchpoint);
    7783           0 :   if (ahead < 0.0) {
    7784             :     /* Turn around so that `searchpoint' is to the left of the */
    7785             :     /*   edge specified by `searchtri'.                        */
    7786           0 :     symself(*searchtri);
    7787           0 :   } else if (ahead == 0.0) {
    7788             :     /* Check if `searchpoint' is between `torg' and `tdest'. */
    7789           0 :     if (((torg[0] < searchpoint[0]) == (searchpoint[0] < tdest[0])) &&
    7790           0 :         ((torg[1] < searchpoint[1]) == (searchpoint[1] < tdest[1]))) {
    7791           0 :       return ONEDGE;
    7792             :     }
    7793             :   }
    7794           0 :   return preciselocate(m, b, searchpoint, searchtri, 0);
    7795             : }
    7796             : 
    7797             : /**                                                                         **/
    7798             : /**                                                                         **/
    7799             : /********* Point location routines end here                          *********/
    7800             : 
    7801             : /********* Mesh transformation routines begin here                   *********/
    7802             : /**                                                                         **/
    7803             : /**                                                                         **/
    7804             : 
    7805             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7806             : /*                                                                           */
    7807             : /*  insertsubseg()   Create a new subsegment and insert it between two       */
    7808             : /*                   triangles.                                              */
    7809             : /*                                                                           */
    7810             : /*  The new subsegment is inserted at the edge described by the handle       */
    7811             : /*  `tri'.  Its vertices are properly initialized.  The marker `subsegmark'  */
    7812             : /*  is applied to the subsegment and, if appropriate, its vertices.          */
    7813             : /*                                                                           */
    7814             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7815             : 
    7816             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7817             : void insertsubseg(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *tri,
    7818             :                   int subsegmark)
    7819             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7820           0 : void insertsubseg(m, b, tri, subsegmark)
    7821             : struct mesh *m;
    7822             : struct behavior *b;
    7823             : struct otri *tri;             /* Edge at which to insert the new subsegment. */
    7824             : int subsegmark;                            /* Marker for the new subsegment. */
    7825             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7826             : 
    7827             : {
