    7828             :   struct otri oppotri;
    7829             :   struct osub newsubseg;
    7830             :   vertex triorg, tridest;
    7831             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    7832             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    7833             : 
    7834           0 :   org(*tri, triorg);
    7835           0 :   dest(*tri, tridest);
    7836             :   /* Mark vertices if possible. */
    7837           0 :   if (vertexmark(triorg) == 0) {
    7838           0 :     setvertexmark(triorg, subsegmark);
    7839             :   }
    7840           0 :   if (vertexmark(tridest) == 0) {
    7841           0 :     setvertexmark(tridest, subsegmark);
    7842             :   }
    7843             :   /* Check if there's already a subsegment here. */
    7844           0 :   tspivot(*tri, newsubseg);
    7845           0 :   if (newsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    7846             :     /* Make new subsegment and initialize its vertices. */
    7847           0 :     makesubseg(m, &newsubseg);
    7848           0 :     setsorg(newsubseg, tridest);
    7849           0 :     setsdest(newsubseg, triorg);
    7850           0 :     setsegorg(newsubseg, tridest);
    7851           0 :     setsegdest(newsubseg, triorg);
    7852             :     /* Bond new subsegment to the two triangles it is sandwiched between. */
    7853             :     /*   Note that the facing triangle `oppotri' might be equal to        */
    7854             :     /*   `dummytri' (outer space), but the new subsegment is bonded to it */
    7855             :     /*   all the same.                                                    */
    7856           0 :     tsbond(*tri, newsubseg);
    7857           0 :     sym(*tri, oppotri);
    7858           0 :     ssymself(newsubseg);
    7859           0 :     tsbond(oppotri, newsubseg);
    7860           0 :     setmark(newsubseg, subsegmark);
    7861           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
    7862           0 :       printf("  Inserting new ");
    7863           0 :       printsubseg(m, b, &newsubseg);
    7864             :     }
    7865             :   } else {
    7866           0 :     if (mark(newsubseg) == 0) {
    7867           0 :       setmark(newsubseg, subsegmark);
    7868             :     }
    7869             :   }
    7870           0 : }
    7871             : 
    7872             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7873             : /*                                                                           */
    7874             : /*  Terminology                                                              */
    7875             : /*                                                                           */
    7876             : /*  A "local transformation" replaces a small set of triangles with another  */
    7877             : /*  set of triangles.  This may or may not involve inserting or deleting a   */
    7878             : /*  vertex.                                                                  */
    7879             : /*                                                                           */
    7880             : /*  The term "casing" is used to describe the set of triangles that are      */
    7881             : /*  attached to the triangles being transformed, but are not transformed     */
    7882             : /*  themselves.  Think of the casing as a fixed hollow structure inside      */
    7883             : /*  which all the action happens.  A "casing" is only defined relative to    */
    7884             : /*  a single transformation; each occurrence of a transformation will        */
    7885             : /*  involve a different casing.                                              */
    7886             : /*                                                                           */
    7887             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7888             : 
    7889             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7890             : /*                                                                           */
    7891             : /*  flip()   Transform two triangles to two different triangles by flipping  */
    7892             : /*           an edge counterclockwise within a quadrilateral.                */
    7893             : /*                                                                           */
    7894             : /*  Imagine the original triangles, abc and bad, oriented so that the        */
    7895             : /*  shared edge ab lies in a horizontal plane, with the vertex b on the left */
    7896             : /*  and the vertex a on the right.  The vertex c lies below the edge, and    */
    7897             : /*  the vertex d lies above the edge.  The `flipedge' handle holds the edge  */
    7898             : /*  ab of triangle abc, and is directed left, from vertex a to vertex b.     */
    7899             : /*                                                                           */
    7900             : /*  The triangles abc and bad are deleted and replaced by the triangles cdb  */
    7901             : /*  and dca.  The triangles that represent abc and bad are NOT deallocated;  */
    7902             : /*  they are reused for dca and cdb, respectively.  Hence, any handles that  */
    7903             : /*  may have held the original triangles are still valid, although not       */
    7904             : /*  directed as they were before.                                            */
    7905             : /*                                                                           */
    7906             : /*  Upon completion of this routine, the `flipedge' handle holds the edge    */
    7907             : /*  dc of triangle dca, and is directed down, from vertex d to vertex c.     */
    7908             : /*  (Hence, the two triangles have rotated counterclockwise.)                */
    7909             : /*                                                                           */
    7910             : /*  WARNING:  This transformation is geometrically valid only if the         */
    7911             : /*  quadrilateral adbc is convex.  Furthermore, this transformation is       */
    7912             : /*  valid only if there is not a subsegment between the triangles abc and    */
    7913             : /*  bad.  This routine does not check either of these preconditions, and     */
    7914             : /*  it is the responsibility of the calling routine to ensure that they are  */
    7915             : /*  met.  If they are not, the streets shall be filled with wailing and      */
    7916             : /*  gnashing of teeth.                                                       */
    7917             : /*                                                                           */
    7918             : /*****************************************************************************/
    7919             : 
    7920             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    7921             : void flip(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *flipedge)
    7922             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7923           0 : void flip(m, b, flipedge)
    7924             : struct mesh *m;
    7925             : struct behavior *b;
    7926             : struct otri *flipedge;                    /* Handle for the triangle abc. */
    7927             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    7928             : 
    7929             : {
    7930             :   struct otri botleft, botright;
    7931             :   struct otri topleft, topright;
    7932             :   struct otri top;
    7933             :   struct otri botlcasing, botrcasing;
    7934             :   struct otri toplcasing, toprcasing;
    7935             :   struct osub botlsubseg, botrsubseg;
    7936             :   struct osub toplsubseg, toprsubseg;
    7937             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex, botvertex;
    7938             :   vertex farvertex;
    7939             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    7940             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    7941             : 
    7942             :   /* Identify the vertices of the quadrilateral. */
    7943           0 :   org(*flipedge, rightvertex);
    7944           0 :   dest(*flipedge, leftvertex);
    7945           0 :   apex(*flipedge, botvertex);
    7946           0 :   sym(*flipedge, top);
    7947             : #ifdef SELF_CHECK
    7948             :   if (top.tri == m->dummytri) {
    7949             :     printf("Internal error in flip():  Attempt to flip on boundary.\n");
    7950             :     lnextself(*flipedge);
    7951             :     return;
    7952             :   }
    7953             :   if (m->checksegments) {
    7954             :     tspivot(*flipedge, toplsubseg);
    7955             :     if (toplsubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
    7956             :       printf("Internal error in flip():  Attempt to flip a segment.\n");
    7957             :       lnextself(*flipedge);
    7958             :       return;
    7959             :     }
    7960             :   }
    7961             : #endif /* SELF_CHECK */
    7962           0 :   apex(top, farvertex);
    7963             : 
    7964             :   /* Identify the casing of the quadrilateral. */
    7965           0 :   lprev(top, topleft);
    7966           0 :   sym(topleft, toplcasing);
    7967           0 :   lnext(top, topright);
    7968           0 :   sym(topright, toprcasing);
    7969           0 :   lnext(*flipedge, botleft);
    7970           0 :   sym(botleft, botlcasing);
    7971           0 :   lprev(*flipedge, botright);
    7972           0 :   sym(botright, botrcasing);
    7973             :   /* Rotate the quadrilateral one-quarter turn counterclockwise. */
    7974           0 :   bond(topleft, botlcasing);
    7975           0 :   bond(botleft, botrcasing);
    7976           0 :   bond(botright, toprcasing);
    7977           0 :   bond(topright, toplcasing);
    7978             : 
    7979           0 :   if (m->checksegments) {
    7980             :     /* Check for subsegments and rebond them to the quadrilateral. */
    7981           0 :     tspivot(topleft, toplsubseg);
    7982           0 :     tspivot(botleft, botlsubseg);
    7983           0 :     tspivot(botright, botrsubseg);
    7984           0 :     tspivot(topright, toprsubseg);
    7985           0 :     if (toplsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    7986           0 :       tsdissolve(topright);
    7987             :     } else {
    7988           0 :       tsbond(topright, toplsubseg);
    7989             :     }
    7990           0 :     if (botlsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    7991           0 :       tsdissolve(topleft);
    7992             :     } else {
    7993           0 :       tsbond(topleft, botlsubseg);
    7994             :     }
    7995           0 :     if (botrsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    7996           0 :       tsdissolve(botleft);
    7997             :     } else {
    7998           0 :       tsbond(botleft, botrsubseg);
    7999             :     }
    8000           0 :     if (toprsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8001           0 :       tsdissolve(botright);
    8002             :     } else {
    8003           0 :       tsbond(botright, toprsubseg);
    8004             :     }
    8005             :   }
    8006             : 
    8007             :   /* New vertex assignments for the rotated quadrilateral. */
    8008           0 :   setorg(*flipedge, farvertex);
    8009           0 :   setdest(*flipedge, botvertex);
    8010           0 :   setapex(*flipedge, rightvertex);
    8011           0 :   setorg(top, botvertex);
    8012           0 :   setdest(top, farvertex);
    8013           0 :   setapex(top, leftvertex);
    8014           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    8015           0 :     printf("  Edge flip results in left ");
    8016           0 :     printtriangle(m, b, &top);
    8017           0 :     printf("  and right ");
    8018           0 :     printtriangle(m, b, flipedge);
    8019             :   }
    8020           0 : }
    8021             : 
    8022             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8023             : /*                                                                           */
    8024             : /*  unflip()   Transform two triangles to two different triangles by         */
    8025             : /*             flipping an edge clockwise within a quadrilateral.  Reverses  */
    8026             : /*             the flip() operation so that the data structures representing */
    8027             : /*             the triangles are back where they were before the flip().     */
    8028             : /*                                                                           */
    8029             : /*  Imagine the original triangles, abc and bad, oriented so that the        */
    8030             : /*  shared edge ab lies in a horizontal plane, with the vertex b on the left */
    8031             : /*  and the vertex a on the right.  The vertex c lies below the edge, and    */
    8032             : /*  the vertex d lies above the edge.  The `flipedge' handle holds the edge  */
    8033             : /*  ab of triangle abc, and is directed left, from vertex a to vertex b.     */
    8034             : /*                                                                           */
    8035             : /*  The triangles abc and bad are deleted and replaced by the triangles cdb  */
    8036             : /*  and dca.  The triangles that represent abc and bad are NOT deallocated;  */
    8037             : /*  they are reused for cdb and dca, respectively.  Hence, any handles that  */
    8038             : /*  may have held the original triangles are still valid, although not       */
    8039             : /*  directed as they were before.                                            */
    8040             : /*                                                                           */
    8041             : /*  Upon completion of this routine, the `flipedge' handle holds the edge    */
    8042             : /*  cd of triangle cdb, and is directed up, from vertex c to vertex d.       */
    8043             : /*  (Hence, the two triangles have rotated clockwise.)                       */
    8044             : /*                                                                           */
    8045             : /*  WARNING:  This transformation is geometrically valid only if the         */
    8046             : /*  quadrilateral adbc is convex.  Furthermore, this transformation is       */
    8047             : /*  valid only if there is not a subsegment between the triangles abc and    */
    8048             : /*  bad.  This routine does not check either of these preconditions, and     */
    8049             : /*  it is the responsibility of the calling routine to ensure that they are  */
    8050             : /*  met.  If they are not, the streets shall be filled with wailing and      */
    8051             : /*  gnashing of teeth.                                                       */
    8052             : /*                                                                           */
    8053             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8054             : 
    8055             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    8056             : void unflip(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *flipedge)
    8057             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8058           0 : void unflip(m, b, flipedge)
    8059             : struct mesh *m;
    8060             : struct behavior *b;
    8061             : struct otri *flipedge;                    /* Handle for the triangle abc. */
    8062             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8063             : 
    8064             : {
    8065             :   struct otri botleft, botright;
    8066             :   struct otri topleft, topright;
    8067             :   struct otri top;
    8068             :   struct otri botlcasing, botrcasing;
    8069             :   struct otri toplcasing, toprcasing;
    8070             :   struct osub botlsubseg, botrsubseg;
    8071             :   struct osub toplsubseg, toprsubseg;
    8072             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex, botvertex;
    8073             :   vertex farvertex;
    8074             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    8075             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    8076             : 
    8077             :   /* Identify the vertices of the quadrilateral. */
    8078           0 :   org(*flipedge, rightvertex);
    8079           0 :   dest(*flipedge, leftvertex);
    8080           0 :   apex(*flipedge, botvertex);
    8081           0 :   sym(*flipedge, top);
    8082             : #ifdef SELF_CHECK
    8083             :   if (top.tri == m->dummytri) {
    8084             :     printf("Internal error in unflip():  Attempt to flip on boundary.\n");
    8085             :     lnextself(*flipedge);
    8086             :     return;
    8087             :   }
    8088             :   if (m->checksegments) {
    8089             :     tspivot(*flipedge, toplsubseg);
    8090             :     if (toplsubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
    8091             :       printf("Internal error in unflip():  Attempt to flip a subsegment.\n");
    8092             :       lnextself(*flipedge);
    8093             :       return;
    8094             :     }
    8095             :   }
    8096             : #endif /* SELF_CHECK */
    8097           0 :   apex(top, farvertex);
    8098             : 
    8099             :   /* Identify the casing of the quadrilateral. */
    8100           0 :   lprev(top, topleft);
    8101           0 :   sym(topleft, toplcasing);
    8102           0 :   lnext(top, topright);
    8103           0 :   sym(topright, toprcasing);
    8104           0 :   lnext(*flipedge, botleft);
    8105           0 :   sym(botleft, botlcasing);
    8106           0 :   lprev(*flipedge, botright);
    8107           0 :   sym(botright, botrcasing);
    8108             :   /* Rotate the quadrilateral one-quarter turn clockwise. */
    8109           0 :   bond(topleft, toprcasing);
    8110           0 :   bond(botleft, toplcasing);
    8111           0 :   bond(botright, botlcasing);
    8112           0 :   bond(topright, botrcasing);
    8113             : 
    8114           0 :   if (m->checksegments) {
    8115             :     /* Check for subsegments and rebond them to the quadrilateral. */
    8116           0 :     tspivot(topleft, toplsubseg);
    8117           0 :     tspivot(botleft, botlsubseg);
    8118           0 :     tspivot(botright, botrsubseg);
    8119           0 :     tspivot(topright, toprsubseg);
    8120           0 :     if (toplsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8121           0 :       tsdissolve(botleft);
    8122             :     } else {
    8123           0 :       tsbond(botleft, toplsubseg);
    8124             :     }
    8125           0 :     if (botlsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8126           0 :       tsdissolve(botright);
    8127             :     } else {
    8128           0 :       tsbond(botright, botlsubseg);
    8129             :     }
    8130           0 :     if (botrsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8131           0 :       tsdissolve(topright);
    8132             :     } else {
    8133           0 :       tsbond(topright, botrsubseg);
    8134             :     }
    8135           0 :     if (toprsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8136           0 :       tsdissolve(topleft);
    8137             :     } else {
    8138           0 :       tsbond(topleft, toprsubseg);
    8139             :     }
    8140             :   }
    8141             : 
    8142             :   /* New vertex assignments for the rotated quadrilateral. */
    8143           0 :   setorg(*flipedge, botvertex);
    8144           0 :   setdest(*flipedge, farvertex);
    8145           0 :   setapex(*flipedge, leftvertex);
    8146           0 :   setorg(top, farvertex);
    8147           0 :   setdest(top, botvertex);
    8148           0 :   setapex(top, rightvertex);
    8149           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    8150           0 :     printf("  Edge unflip results in left ");
    8151           0 :     printtriangle(m, b, flipedge);
    8152           0 :     printf("  and right ");
    8153           0 :     printtriangle(m, b, &top);
    8154             :   }
    8155           0 : }
    8156             : 
    8157             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8158             : /*                                                                           */
    8159             : /*  insertvertex()   Insert a vertex into a Delaunay triangulation,          */
    8160             : /*                   performing flips as necessary to maintain the Delaunay  */
    8161             : /*                   property.                                               */
    8162             : /*                                                                           */
    8163             : /*  The point `insertvertex' is located.  If `searchtri.tri' is not NULL,    */
    8164             : /*  the search for the containing triangle begins from `searchtri'.  If      */
    8165             : /*  `searchtri.tri' is NULL, a full point location procedure is called.      */
    8166             : /*  If `insertvertex' is found inside a triangle, the triangle is split into */
    8167             : /*  three; if `insertvertex' lies on an edge, the edge is split in two,      */
    8168             : /*  thereby splitting the two adjacent triangles into four.  Edge flips are  */
    8169             : /*  used to restore the Delaunay property.  If `insertvertex' lies on an     */
    8170             : /*  existing vertex, no action is taken, and the value DUPLICATEVERTEX is    */
    8171             : /*  returned.  On return, `searchtri' is set to a handle whose origin is the */
    8172             : /*  existing vertex.                                                         */
    8173             : /*                                                                           */
    8174             : /*  Normally, the parameter `splitseg' is set to NULL, implying that no      */
    8175             : /*  subsegment should be split.  In this case, if `insertvertex' is found to */
    8176             : /*  lie on a segment, no action is taken, and the value VIOLATINGVERTEX is   */
    8177             : /*  returned.  On return, `searchtri' is set to a handle whose primary edge  */
    8178             : /*  is the violated subsegment.                                              */
    8179             : /*                                                                           */
    8180             : /*  If the calling routine wishes to split a subsegment by inserting a       */
    8181             : /*  vertex in it, the parameter `splitseg' should be that subsegment.  In    */
    8182             : /*  this case, `searchtri' MUST be the triangle handle reached by pivoting   */
    8183             : /*  from that subsegment; no point location is done.                         */
    8184             : /*                                                                           */
    8185             : /*  `segmentflaws' and `triflaws' are flags that indicate whether or not     */
    8186             : /*  there should be checks for the creation of encroached subsegments or bad */
    8187             : /*  quality triangles.  If a newly inserted vertex encroaches upon           */
    8188             : /*  subsegments, these subsegments are added to the list of subsegments to   */
    8189             : /*  be split if `segmentflaws' is set.  If bad triangles are created, these  */
    8190             : /*  are added to the queue if `triflaws' is set.                             */
    8191             : /*                                                                           */
    8192             : /*  If a duplicate vertex or violated segment does not prevent the vertex    */
    8193             : /*  from being inserted, the return value will be ENCROACHINGVERTEX if the   */
    8194             : /*  vertex encroaches upon a subsegment (and checking is enabled), or        */
    8195             : /*  SUCCESSFULVERTEX otherwise.  In either case, `searchtri' is set to a     */
    8196             : /*  handle whose origin is the newly inserted vertex.                        */
    8197             : /*                                                                           */
    8198             : /*  insertvertex() does not use flip() for reasons of speed; some            */
    8199             : /*  information can be reused from edge flip to edge flip, like the          */
    8200             : /*  locations of subsegments.                                                */
    8201             : /*                                                                           */
    8202             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8203             : 
    8204             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    8205             : enum insertvertexresult insertvertex(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    8206             :                                      vertex newvertex, struct otri *searchtri,
    8207             :                                      struct osub *splitseg,
    8208             :                                      int segmentflaws, int triflaws)
    8209             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8210           0 : enum insertvertexresult insertvertex(m, b, newvertex, searchtri, splitseg,
    8211             :                                      segmentflaws, triflaws)
    8212             : struct mesh *m;
    8213             : struct behavior *b;
    8214             : vertex newvertex;
    8215             : struct otri *searchtri;
    8216             : struct osub *splitseg;
    8217             : int segmentflaws;
    8218             : int triflaws;
    8219             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8220             : 
    8221             : {
    8222             :   struct otri horiz;
    8223             :   struct otri top;
    8224             :   struct otri botleft, botright;
    8225             :   struct otri topleft, topright;
    8226             :   struct otri newbotleft, newbotright;
    8227             :   struct otri newtopright;
    8228             :   struct otri botlcasing, botrcasing;
    8229             :   struct otri toplcasing, toprcasing;
    8230             :   struct otri testtri;
    8231             :   struct osub botlsubseg, botrsubseg;
    8232             :   struct osub toplsubseg, toprsubseg;
    8233             :   struct osub brokensubseg;
    8234             :   struct osub checksubseg;
    8235             :   struct osub rightsubseg;
    8236             :   struct osub newsubseg;
    8237             :   struct badsubseg *encroached;
    8238             :   struct flipstacker *newflip;
    8239             :   vertex first;
    8240             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex, botvertex, topvertex, farvertex;
    8241             :   vertex segmentorg, segmentdest;
    8242             :   REAL attrib;
    8243             :   REAL area;
    8244             :   enum insertvertexresult success;
    8245             :   enum locateresult intersect;
    8246             :   int doflip;
    8247             :   int mirrorflag;
    8248             :   int enq;
    8249             :   int i;
    8250             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    8251             :   subseg sptr;         /* Temporary variable used by spivot() and tspivot(). */
    8252             : 
    8253           0 :   if (b->verbose > 1) {
    8254           0 :     printf("  Inserting (%.12g, %.12g).\n", newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
    8255             :   }

    8570           0 :       printtriangle(m, b, &newbotright);

    8572             :   }
    8573             : 
    8574             :   /* The insertion is successful by default, unless an encroached */
    8575             :   /*   subsegment is found.                                       */
    8576           0 :   success = SUCCESSFULVERTEX;
    8577             :   /* Circle around the newly inserted vertex, checking each edge opposite */
    8578             :   /*   it for the Delaunay property.  Non-Delaunay edges are flipped.     */
    8579             :   /*   `horiz' is always the edge being checked.  `first' marks where to  */
    8580             :   /*   stop circling.                                                     */

    8582           0 :   rightvertex = first;
    8583           0 :   dest(horiz, leftvertex);
    8584             :   /* Circle until finished. */
