    8586             :     /* By default, the edge will be flipped. */
    8587           0 :     doflip = 1;
    8588             : 
    8589           0 :     if (m->checksegments) {
    8590             :       /* Check for a subsegment, which cannot be flipped. */
    8591           0 :       tspivot(horiz, checksubseg);
    8592           0 :       if (checksubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
    8593             :         /* The edge is a subsegment and cannot be flipped. */
    8594           0 :         doflip = 0;
    8595             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    8596           0 :         if (segmentflaws) {
    8597             :           /* Does the new vertex encroach upon this subsegment? */
    8598           0 :           if (checkseg4encroach(m, b, &checksubseg)) {
    8599           0 :             success = ENCROACHINGVERTEX;
    8600             :           }
    8601             :         }
    8602             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    8603             :       }
    8604             :     }
    8605             : 
    8606           0 :     if (doflip) {
    8607             :       /* Check if the edge is a boundary edge. */
    8608           0 :       sym(horiz, top);
    8609           0 :       if (top.tri == m->dummytri) {
    8610             :         /* The edge is a boundary edge and cannot be flipped. */
    8611           0 :         doflip = 0;
    8612             :       } else {
    8613             :         /* Find the vertex on the other side of the edge. */
    8614           0 :         apex(top, farvertex);
    8615             :         /* In the incremental Delaunay triangulation algorithm, any of      */
    8616             :         /*   `leftvertex', `rightvertex', and `farvertex' could be vertices */
    8617             :         /*   of the triangular bounding box.  These vertices must be        */
    8618             :         /*   treated as if they are infinitely distant, even though their   */
    8619             :         /*   "coordinates" are not.                                         */
    8620           0 :         if ((leftvertex == m->infvertex1) || (leftvertex == m->infvertex2) ||
    8621           0 :             (leftvertex == m->infvertex3)) {
    8622             :           /* `leftvertex' is infinitely distant.  Check the convexity of  */
    8623             :           /*   the boundary of the triangulation.  'farvertex' might be   */
    8624             :           /*   infinite as well, but trust me, this same condition should */
    8625             :           /*   be applied.                                                */
    8626           0 :           doflip = counterclockwise(m, b, newvertex, rightvertex, farvertex)
    8627           0 :                    > 0.0;
    8628           0 :         } else if ((rightvertex == m->infvertex1) ||
    8629           0 :                    (rightvertex == m->infvertex2) ||
    8630           0 :                    (rightvertex == m->infvertex3)) {
    8631             :           /* `rightvertex' is infinitely distant.  Check the convexity of */
    8632             :           /*   the boundary of the triangulation.  'farvertex' might be   */
    8633             :           /*   infinite as well, but trust me, this same condition should */
    8634             :           /*   be applied.                                                */
    8635           0 :           doflip = counterclockwise(m, b, farvertex, leftvertex, newvertex)
    8636           0 :                    > 0.0;
    8637           0 :         } else if ((farvertex == m->infvertex1) ||
    8638           0 :                    (farvertex == m->infvertex2) ||
    8639           0 :                    (farvertex == m->infvertex3)) {
    8640             :           /* `farvertex' is infinitely distant and cannot be inside */
    8641             :           /*   the circumcircle of the triangle `horiz'.            */
    8642           0 :           doflip = 0;
    8643             :         } else {
    8644             :           /* Test whether the edge is locally Delaunay. */
    8645           0 :           doflip = incircle(m, b, leftvertex, newvertex, rightvertex,
    8646           0 :                             farvertex) > 0.0;
    8647             :         }
    8648           0 :         if (doflip) {
    8649             :           /* We made it!  Flip the edge `horiz' by rotating its containing */
    8650             :           /*   quadrilateral (the two triangles adjacent to `horiz').      */
    8651             :           /* Identify the casing of the quadrilateral. */
    8652           0 :           lprev(top, topleft);
    8653           0 :           sym(topleft, toplcasing);
    8654           0 :           lnext(top, topright);
    8655           0 :           sym(topright, toprcasing);
    8656           0 :           lnext(horiz, botleft);
    8657           0 :           sym(botleft, botlcasing);
    8658           0 :           lprev(horiz, botright);
    8659           0 :           sym(botright, botrcasing);
    8660             :           /* Rotate the quadrilateral one-quarter turn counterclockwise. */
    8661           0 :           bond(topleft, botlcasing);
    8662           0 :           bond(botleft, botrcasing);
    8663           0 :           bond(botright, toprcasing);
    8664           0 :           bond(topright, toplcasing);
    8665           0 :           if (m->checksegments) {
    8666             :             /* Check for subsegments and rebond them to the quadrilateral. */
    8667           0 :             tspivot(topleft, toplsubseg);
    8668           0 :             tspivot(botleft, botlsubseg);
    8669           0 :             tspivot(botright, botrsubseg);
    8670           0 :             tspivot(topright, toprsubseg);
    8671           0 :             if (toplsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8672           0 :               tsdissolve(topright);
    8673             :             } else {
    8674           0 :               tsbond(topright, toplsubseg);
    8675             :             }
    8676           0 :             if (botlsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8677           0 :               tsdissolve(topleft);
    8678             :             } else {
    8679           0 :               tsbond(topleft, botlsubseg);
    8680             :             }
    8681           0 :             if (botrsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8682           0 :               tsdissolve(botleft);
    8683             :             } else {
    8684           0 :               tsbond(botleft, botrsubseg);
    8685             :             }
    8686           0 :             if (toprsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
    8687           0 :               tsdissolve(botright);
    8688             :             } else {
    8689           0 :               tsbond(botright, toprsubseg);
    8690             :             }
    8691             :           }
    8692             :           /* New vertex assignments for the rotated quadrilateral. */
    8693           0 :           setorg(horiz, farvertex);
    8694           0 :           setdest(horiz, newvertex);
    8695           0 :           setapex(horiz, rightvertex);
    8696           0 :           setorg(top, newvertex);
    8697           0 :           setdest(top, farvertex);
    8698           0 :           setapex(top, leftvertex);
    8699           0 :           for (i = 0; i < m->eextras; i++) {
    8700             :             /* Take the average of the two triangles' attributes. */
    8701           0 :             attrib = 0.5 * (elemattribute(top, i) + elemattribute(horiz, i));
    8702           0 :             setelemattribute(top, i, attrib);
    8703           0 :             setelemattribute(horiz, i, attrib);
    8704             :           }
    8705           0 :           if (b->vararea) {
    8706           0 :             if ((areabound(top) <= 0.0) || (areabound(horiz) <= 0.0)) {
    8707           0 :               area = -1.0;
    8708             :             } else {
    8709             :               /* Take the average of the two triangles' area constraints.    */
    8710             :               /*   This prevents small area constraints from migrating a     */
    8711             :               /*   long, ptrdiff_t  way from their original location due to flips. */
    8712           0 :               area = 0.5 * (areabound(top) + areabound(horiz));
    8713             :             }
    8714           0 :             setareabound(top, area);
    8715           0 :             setareabound(horiz, area);
    8716             :           }
    8717             : 
    8718           0 :           if (m->checkquality) {
    8719           0 :             newflip = (struct flipstacker *) poolalloc(&m->flipstackers);
    8720           0 :             newflip->flippedtri = encode(horiz);
    8721           0 :             newflip->prevflip = m->lastflip;
    8722           0 :             m->lastflip = newflip;
    8723             :           }
    8724             : 
    8725             : #ifdef SELF_CHECK
    8726             :           if (newvertex != (vertex) NULL) {
    8727             :             if (counterclockwise(m, b, leftvertex, newvertex, rightvertex) <
    8728             :                 0.0) {
    8729             :               printf("Internal error in insertvertex():\n");
    8730             :               printf("  Clockwise triangle prior to edge flip (bottom).\n");
    8731             :             }
    8732             :             /* The following test has been removed because constrainededge() */
    8733             :             /*   sometimes generates inverted triangles that insertvertex()  */
    8734             :             /*   removes.                                                    */
    8735             : /*
    8736             :             if (counterclockwise(m, b, rightvertex, farvertex, leftvertex) <
    8737             :                 0.0) {
    8738             :               printf("Internal error in insertvertex():\n");
    8739             :               printf("  Clockwise triangle prior to edge flip (top).\n");
    8740             :             }
    8741             : */
    8742             :             if (counterclockwise(m, b, farvertex, leftvertex, newvertex) <
    8743             :                 0.0) {
    8744             :               printf("Internal error in insertvertex():\n");
    8745             :               printf("  Clockwise triangle after edge flip (left).\n");
    8746             :             }
    8747             :             if (counterclockwise(m, b, newvertex, rightvertex, farvertex) <
    8748             :                 0.0) {
    8749             :               printf("Internal error in insertvertex():\n");
    8750             :               printf("  Clockwise triangle after edge flip (right).\n");
    8751             :             }
    8752             :           }
    8753             : #endif /* SELF_CHECK */
    8754           0 :           if (b->verbose > 2) {
    8755           0 :             printf("  Edge flip results in left ");
    8756           0 :             lnextself(topleft);
    8757           0 :             printtriangle(m, b, &topleft);
    8758           0 :             printf("  and right ");
    8759           0 :             printtriangle(m, b, &horiz);
    8760             :           }
    8761             :           /* On the next iterations, consider the two edges that were  */
    8762             :           /*   exposed (this is, are now visible to the newly inserted */
    8763             :           /*   vertex) by the edge flip.                               */
    8764           0 :           lprevself(horiz);
    8765           0 :           leftvertex = farvertex;
    8766             :         }
    8767             :       }
    8768             :     }
    8769           0 :     if (!doflip) {
    8770             :       /* The handle `horiz' is accepted as locally Delaunay. */
    8771             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    8772           0 :       if (triflaws) {
    8773             :         /* Check the triangle `horiz' for quality. */
    8774           0 :         testtriangle(m, b, &horiz);
    8775             :       }
    8776             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    8777             :       /* Look for the next edge around the newly inserted vertex. */
    8778           0 :       lnextself(horiz);
    8779           0 :       sym(horiz, testtri);
    8780             :       /* Check for finishing a complete revolution about the new vertex, or */
    8781             :       /*   falling outside  of the triangulation.  The latter will happen   */
    8782             :       /*   when a vertex is inserted at a boundary.                         */
    8783           0 :       if ((leftvertex == first) || (testtri.tri == m->dummytri)) {
    8784             :         /* We're done.  Return a triangle whose origin is the new vertex. */
    8785           0 :         lnext(horiz, *searchtri);
    8786           0 :         lnext(horiz, m->recenttri);
    8787           0 :         return success;
    8788             :       }
    8789             :       /* Finish finding the next edge around the newly inserted vertex. */
    8790           0 :       lnext(testtri, horiz);
    8791           0 :       rightvertex = leftvertex;
    8792           0 :       dest(horiz, leftvertex);
    8793             :     }
    8794             :   }
    8795             : }
    8796             : 
    8797             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8798             : /*                                                                           */
    8799             : /*  triangulatepolygon()   Find the Delaunay triangulation of a polygon that */
    8800             : /*                         has a certain "nice" shape.  This includes the    */
    8801             : /*                         polygons that result from deletion of a vertex or */
    8802             : /*                         insertion of a segment.                           */
    8803             : /*                                                                           */
    8804             : /*  This is a conceptually difficult routine.  The starting assumption is    */
    8805             : /*  that we have a polygon with n sides.  n - 1 of these sides are currently */
    8806             : /*  represented as edges in the mesh.  One side, called the "base", need not */
    8807             : /*  be.                                                                      */
    8808             : /*                                                                           */
    8809             : /*  Inside the polygon is a structure I call a "fan", consisting of n - 1    */
    8810             : /*  triangles that share a common origin.  For each of these triangles, the  */
    8811             : /*  edge opposite the origin is one of the sides of the polygon.  The        */
    8812             : /*  primary edge of each triangle is the edge directed from the origin to    */
    8813             : /*  the destination; note that this is not the same edge that is a side of   */
    8814             : /*  the polygon.  `firstedge' is the primary edge of the first triangle.     */
    8815             : /*  From there, the triangles follow in counterclockwise order about the     */
    8816             : /*  polygon, until `lastedge', the primary edge of the last triangle.        */
    8817             : /*  `firstedge' and `lastedge' are probably connected to other triangles     */
    8818             : /*  beyond the extremes of the fan, but their identity is not important, as  */
    8819             : /*  ptrdiff_t  as the fan remains connected to them.                               */
    8820             : /*                                                                           */
    8821             : /*  Imagine the polygon oriented so that its base is at the bottom.  This    */
    8822             : /*  puts `firstedge' on the far right, and `lastedge' on the far left.       */
    8823             : /*  The right vertex of the base is the destination of `firstedge', and the  */
    8824             : /*  left vertex of the base is the apex of `lastedge'.                       */
    8825             : /*                                                                           */
    8826             : /*  The challenge now is to find the right sequence of edge flips to         */
    8827             : /*  transform the fan into a Delaunay triangulation of the polygon.  Each    */
    8828             : /*  edge flip effectively removes one triangle from the fan, committing it   */
    8829             : /*  to the polygon.  The resulting polygon has one fewer edge.  If `doflip'  */
    8830             : /*  is set, the final flip will be performed, resulting in a fan of one      */
    8831             : /*  (useless?) triangle.  If `doflip' is not set, the final flip is not      */
    8832             : /*  performed, resulting in a fan of two triangles, and an unfinished        */
    8833             : /*  triangular polygon that is not yet filled out with a single triangle.    */
    8834             : /*  On completion of the routine, `lastedge' is the last remaining triangle, */
    8835             : /*  or the leftmost of the last two.                                         */
    8836             : /*                                                                           */
    8837             : /*  Although the flips are performed in the order described above, the       */
    8838             : /*  decisions about what flips to perform are made in precisely the reverse  */
    8839             : /*  order.  The recursive triangulatepolygon() procedure makes a decision,   */
    8840             : /*  uses up to two recursive calls to triangulate the "subproblems"          */
    8841             : /*  (polygons with fewer edges), and then performs an edge flip.             */
    8842             : /*                                                                           */
    8843             : /*  The "decision" it makes is which vertex of the polygon should be         */
    8844             : /*  connected to the base.  This decision is made by testing every possible  */
    8845             : /*  vertex.  Once the best vertex is found, the two edges that connect this  */
    8846             : /*  vertex to the base become the bases for two smaller polygons.  These     */
    8847             : /*  are triangulated recursively.  Unfortunately, this approach can take     */
    8848             : /*  O(n^2) time not only in the worst case, but in many common cases.  It's  */
    8849             : /*  rarely a big deal for vertex deletion, where n is rarely larger than     */
    8850             : /*  ten, but it could be a big deal for segment insertion, especially if     */
    8851             : /*  there's a lot of ptrdiff_t  segments that each cut many triangles.  I ought to */
    8852             : /*  code a faster algorithm some day.                                        */
    8853             : /*                                                                           */
    8854             : /*  The `edgecount' parameter is the number of sides of the polygon,         */
    8855             : /*  including its base.  `triflaws' is a flag that determines whether the    */
    8856             : /*  new triangles should be tested for quality, and enqueued if they are     */
    8857             : /*  bad.                                                                     */
    8858             : /*                                                                           */
    8859             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8860             : 
    8861             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    8862             : void triangulatepolygon(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
    8863             :                         struct otri *firstedge, struct otri *lastedge,
    8864             :                         int edgecount, int doflip, int triflaws)
    8865             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8866           0 : void triangulatepolygon(m, b, firstedge, lastedge, edgecount, doflip, triflaws)
    8867             : struct mesh *m;
    8868             : struct behavior *b;
    8869             : struct otri *firstedge;
    8870             : struct otri *lastedge;
    8871             : int edgecount;
    8872             : int doflip;
    8873             : int triflaws;
    8874             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8875             : 
    8876             : {
    8877             :   struct otri testtri;
    8878             :   struct otri besttri;
    8879             :   struct otri tempedge;
    8880             :   vertex leftbasevertex, rightbasevertex;
    8881             :   vertex testvertex;
    8882             :   vertex bestvertex;
    8883             :   int bestnumber;
    8884             :   int i;
    8885             :   triangle ptr;   /* Temporary variable used by sym(), onext(), and oprev(). */
    8886             : 
    8887             :   /* Identify the base vertices. */
    8888           0 :   apex(*lastedge, leftbasevertex);
    8889           0 :   dest(*firstedge, rightbasevertex);
    8890           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    8891           0 :     printf("  Triangulating interior polygon at edge\n");
    8892           0 :     printf("    (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n", leftbasevertex[0],
    8893           0 :            leftbasevertex[1], rightbasevertex[0], rightbasevertex[1]);
    8894             :   }
    8895             :   /* Find the best vertex to connect the base to. */
    8896           0 :   onext(*firstedge, besttri);
    8897           0 :   dest(besttri, bestvertex);
    8898           0 :   otricopy(besttri, testtri);
    8899           0 :   bestnumber = 1;
    8900           0 :   for (i = 2; i <= edgecount - 2; i++) {
    8901           0 :     onextself(testtri);
    8902           0 :     dest(testtri, testvertex);
    8903             :     /* Is this a better vertex? */
    8904           0 :     if (incircle(m, b, leftbasevertex, rightbasevertex, bestvertex,
    8905             :                  testvertex) > 0.0) {
    8906           0 :       otricopy(testtri, besttri);
    8907           0 :       bestvertex = testvertex;
    8908           0 :       bestnumber = i;
    8909             :     }
    8910             :   }
    8911           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    8912           0 :     printf("    Connecting edge to (%.12g, %.12g)\n", bestvertex[0],
    8913           0 :            bestvertex[1]);
    8914             :   }
    8915           0 :   if (bestnumber > 1) {
    8916             :     /* Recursively triangulate the smaller polygon on the right. */
    8917           0 :     oprev(besttri, tempedge);
    8918           0 :     triangulatepolygon(m, b, firstedge, &tempedge, bestnumber + 1, 1,
    8919             :                        triflaws);
    8920             :   }
    8921           0 :   if (bestnumber < edgecount - 2) {
    8922             :     /* Recursively triangulate the smaller polygon on the left. */
    8923           0 :     sym(besttri, tempedge);
    8924           0 :     triangulatepolygon(m, b, &besttri, lastedge, edgecount - bestnumber, 1,
    8925             :                        triflaws);
    8926             :     /* Find `besttri' again; it may have been lost to edge flips. */
    8927           0 :     sym(tempedge, besttri);
    8928             :   }
    8929           0 :   if (doflip) {
    8930             :     /* Do one final edge flip. */
    8931           0 :     flip(m, b, &besttri);
    8932             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    8933           0 :     if (triflaws) {
    8934             :       /* Check the quality of the newly committed triangle. */
    8935           0 :       sym(besttri, testtri);
    8936           0 :       testtriangle(m, b, &testtri);
    8937             :     }
    8938             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    8939             :   }
    8940             :   /* Return the base triangle. */
    8941           0 :   otricopy(besttri, *lastedge);
    8942           0 : }
    8943             : 
    8944             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8945             : /*                                                                           */
    8946             : /*  deletevertex()   Delete a vertex from a Delaunay triangulation, ensuring */
    8947             : /*                   that the triangulation remains Delaunay.                */
    8948             : /*                                                                           */
    8949             : /*  The origin of `deltri' is deleted.  The union of the triangles adjacent  */
    8950             : /*  to this vertex is a polygon, for which the Delaunay triangulation is     */
    8951             : /*  found.  Two triangles are removed from the mesh.                         */
    8952             : /*                                                                           */
    8953             : /*  Only interior vertices that do not lie on segments or boundaries may be  */
    8954             : /*  deleted.                                                                 */
    8955             : /*                                                                           */
    8956             : /*****************************************************************************/
    8957             : 
    8958             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    8959             : 
    8960             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    8961             : void deletevertex(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *deltri)
    8962             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8963           0 : void deletevertex(m, b, deltri)
    8964             : struct mesh *m;
    8965             : struct behavior *b;
    8966             : struct otri *deltri;
    8967             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    8968             : 
    8969             : {
    8970             :   struct otri countingtri;
    8971             :   struct otri firstedge, lastedge;
    8972             :   struct otri deltriright;
    8973             :   struct otri lefttri, righttri;
    8974             :   struct otri leftcasing, rightcasing;
    8975             :   struct osub leftsubseg, rightsubseg;
    8976             :   vertex delvertex;
    8977             :   vertex neworg;
    8978             :   int edgecount;
    8979             :   triangle ptr;   /* Temporary variable used by sym(), onext(), and oprev(). */
    8980             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    8981             : 
    8982           0 :   org(*deltri, delvertex);
    8983           0 :   if (b->verbose > 1) {
    8984           0 :     printf("  Deleting (%.12g, %.12g).\n", delvertex[0], delvertex[1]);
    8985             :   }
    8986           0 :   vertexdealloc(m, delvertex);
    8987             : 
    8988             :   /* Count the degree of the vertex being deleted. */
    8989           0 :   onext(*deltri, countingtri);
    8990           0 :   edgecount = 1;
    8991           0 :   while (!otriequal(*deltri, countingtri)) {
    8992             : #ifdef SELF_CHECK
    8993             :     if (countingtri.tri == m->dummytri) {
    8994             :       printf("Internal error in deletevertex():\n");
    8995             :       printf("  Attempt to delete boundary vertex.\n");
    8996             :       internalerror();
    8997             :     }
    8998             : #endif /* SELF_CHECK */
    8999           0 :     edgecount++;
    9000           0 :     onextself(countingtri);
    9001             :   }
    9002             : 
    9003             : #ifdef SELF_CHECK
    9004             :   if (edgecount < 3) {
    9005             :     printf("Internal error in deletevertex():\n  Vertex has degree %d.\n",
    9006             :            edgecount);
    9007             :     internalerror();
    9008             :   }
    9009             : #endif /* SELF_CHECK */
    9010           0 :   if (edgecount > 3) {
    9011             :     /* Triangulate the polygon defined by the union of all triangles */
    9012             :     /*   adjacent to the vertex being deleted.  Check the quality of */
    9013             :     /*   the resulting triangles.                                    */
    9014           0 :     onext(*deltri, firstedge);
    9015           0 :     oprev(*deltri, lastedge);
    9016           0 :     triangulatepolygon(m, b, &firstedge, &lastedge, edgecount, 0,
    9017           0 :                        !b->nobisect);
    9018             :   }
    9019             :   /* Splice out two triangles. */
    9020           0 :   lprev(*deltri, deltriright);
    9021           0 :   dnext(*deltri, lefttri);
    9022           0 :   sym(lefttri, leftcasing);
    9023           0 :   oprev(deltriright, righttri);
    9024           0 :   sym(righttri, rightcasing);
    9025           0 :   bond(*deltri, leftcasing);
    9026           0 :   bond(deltriright, rightcasing);
    9027           0 :   tspivot(lefttri, leftsubseg);
    9028           0 :   if (leftsubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
    9029           0 :     tsbond(*deltri, leftsubseg);
    9030             :   }
    9031           0 :   tspivot(righttri, rightsubseg);
    9032           0 :   if (rightsubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
    9033           0 :     tsbond(deltriright, rightsubseg);
    9034             :   }
    9035             : 
    9036             :   /* Set the new origin of `deltri' and check its quality. */
    9037           0 :   org(lefttri, neworg);
    9038           0 :   setorg(*deltri, neworg);
    9039           0 :   if (!b->nobisect) {
    9040           0 :     testtriangle(m, b, deltri);
    9041             :   }
    9042             : 
    9043             :   /* Delete the two spliced-out triangles. */
    9044           0 :   triangledealloc(m, lefttri.tri);
    9045           0 :   triangledealloc(m, righttri.tri);
    9046           0 : }
    9047             : 
    9048             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    9049             : 
    9050             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9051             : /*                                                                           */
    9052             : /*  undovertex()   Undo the most recent vertex insertion.                    */
    9053             : /*                                                                           */
    9054             : /*  Walks through the list of transformations (flips and a vertex insertion) */
    9055             : /*  in the reverse of the order in which they were done, and undoes them.    */
    9056             : /*  The inserted vertex is removed from the triangulation and deallocated.   */
    9057             : /*  Two triangles (possibly just one) are also deallocated.                  */
    9058             : /*                                                                           */
    9059             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9060             : 
    9061             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
    9062             : 
    9063             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    9064             : void undovertex(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
    9065             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9066           0 : void undovertex(m, b)
    9067             : struct mesh *m;
    9068             : struct behavior *b;
    9069             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9070             : 
    9071             : {
    9072             :   struct otri fliptri;
    9073             :   struct otri botleft, botright, topright;
    9074             :   struct otri botlcasing, botrcasing, toprcasing;
    9075             :   struct otri gluetri;
    9076             :   struct osub botlsubseg, botrsubseg, toprsubseg;
    9077             :   vertex botvertex, rightvertex;
    9078             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    9079             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
    9080             : 
    9081             :   /* Walk through the list of transformations (flips and a vertex insertion) */
    9082             :   /*   in the reverse of the order in which they were done, and undo them.   */
    9083           0 :   while (m->lastflip != (struct flipstacker *) NULL) {
    9084             :     /* Find a triangle involved in the last unreversed transformation. */
    9085           0 :     decode(m->lastflip->flippedtri, fliptri);
    9086             : 
    9087             :     /* We are reversing one of three transformations:  a trisection of one */
    9088             :     /*   triangle into three (by inserting a vertex in the triangle), a    */
    9089             :     /*   bisection of two triangles into four (by inserting a vertex in an */
    9090             :     /*   edge), or an edge flip.                                           */
    9091           0 :     if (m->lastflip->prevflip == (struct flipstacker *) NULL) {
    9092             :       /* Restore a triangle that was split into three triangles, */
    9093             :       /*   so it is again one triangle.                          */
    9094           0 :       dprev(fliptri, botleft);
    9095           0 :       lnextself(botleft);
    9096           0 :       onext(fliptri, botright);
    9097           0 :       lprevself(botright);
    9098           0 :       sym(botleft, botlcasing);
    9099           0 :       sym(botright, botrcasing);
    9100           0 :       dest(botleft, botvertex);
    9101             : 
    9102           0 :       setapex(fliptri, botvertex);
    9103           0 :       lnextself(fliptri);
    9104           0 :       bond(fliptri, botlcasing);
    9105           0 :       tspivot(botleft, botlsubseg);
    9106           0 :       tsbond(fliptri, botlsubseg);
    9107           0 :       lnextself(fliptri);
    9108           0 :       bond(fliptri, botrcasing);
    9109           0 :       tspivot(botright, botrsubseg);
    9110           0 :       tsbond(fliptri, botrsubseg);
    9111             : 
    9112             :       /* Delete the two spliced-out triangles. */
    9113           0 :       triangledealloc(m, botleft.tri);
    9114           0 :       triangledealloc(m, botright.tri);
    9115           0 :     } else if (m->lastflip->prevflip == (struct flipstacker *) &insertvertex) {
    9116             :       /* Restore two triangles that were split into four triangles, */
    9117             :       /*   so they are again two triangles.                         */
    9118           0 :       lprev(fliptri, gluetri);
    9119           0 :       sym(gluetri, botright);
    9120           0 :       lnextself(botright);
    9121           0 :       sym(botright, botrcasing);
    9122           0 :       dest(botright, rightvertex);
    9123             : 
    9124           0 :       setorg(fliptri, rightvertex);
    9125           0 :       bond(gluetri, botrcasing);
    9126           0 :       tspivot(botright, botrsubseg);
    9127           0 :       tsbond(gluetri, botrsubseg);
    9128             : 
    9129             :       /* Delete the spliced-out triangle. */
    9130           0 :       triangledealloc(m, botright.tri);
    9131             : 
    9132           0 :       sym(fliptri, gluetri);
    9133           0 :       if (gluetri.tri != m->dummytri) {
    9134           0 :         lnextself(gluetri);
    9135           0 :         dnext(gluetri, topright);
    9136           0 :         sym(topright, toprcasing);
    9137             : 
    9138           0 :         setorg(gluetri, rightvertex);
    9139           0 :         bond(gluetri, toprcasing);
    9140           0 :         tspivot(topright, toprsubseg);
    9141           0 :         tsbond(gluetri, toprsubseg);
    9142             : 
    9143             :         /* Delete the spliced-out triangle. */
    9144           0 :         triangledealloc(m, topright.tri);
    9145             :       }
    9146             : 
    9147             :       /* This is the end of the list, sneakily encoded. */
    9148           0 :       m->lastflip->prevflip = (struct flipstacker *) NULL;
    9149             :     } else {
    9150             :       /* Undo an edge flip. */
    9151           0 :       unflip(m, b, &fliptri);
    9152             :     }
    9153             : 
    9154             :     /* Go on and process the next transformation. */
    9155           0 :     m->lastflip = m->lastflip->prevflip;
    9156             :   }
    9157           0 : }
    9158             : 
    9159             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
    9160             : 
    9161             : /**                                                                         **/
    9162             : /**                                                                         **/
    9163             : /********* Mesh transformation routines end here                     *********/
    9164             : 
    9165             : /********* Divide-and-conquer Delaunay triangulation begins here     *********/
    9166             : /**                                                                         **/
    9167             : /**                                                                         **/
    9168             : 
    9169             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9170             : /*                                                                           */
    9171             : /*  The divide-and-conquer bounding box                                      */
    9172             : /*                                                                           */
    9173             : /*  I originally implemented the divide-and-conquer and incremental Delaunay */
    9174             : /*  triangulations using the edge-based data structure presented by Guibas   */
    9175             : /*  and Stolfi.  Switching to a triangle-based data structure doubled the    */
    9176             : /*  speed.  However, I had to think of a few extra tricks to maintain the    */
    9177             : /*  elegance of the original algorithms.                                     */
    9178             : /*                                                                           */
    9179             : /*  The "bounding box" used by my variant of the divide-and-conquer          */
    9180             : /*  algorithm uses one triangle for each edge of the convex hull of the      */
    9181             : /*  triangulation.  These bounding triangles all share a common apical       */
    9182             : /*  vertex, which is represented by NULL and which represents nothing.       */
    9183             : /*  The bounding triangles are linked in a circular fan about this NULL      */
    9184             : /*  vertex, and the edges on the convex hull of the triangulation appear     */
    9185             : /*  opposite the NULL vertex.  You might find it easiest to imagine that     */
    9186             : /*  the NULL vertex is a point in 3D space behind the center of the          */
    9187             : /*  triangulation, and that the bounding triangles form a sort of cone.      */
    9188             : /*                                                                           */
    9189             : /*  This bounding box makes it easy to represent degenerate cases.  For      */
    9190             : /*  instance, the triangulation of two vertices is a single edge.  This edge */
    9191             : /*  is represented by two bounding box triangles, one on each "side" of the  */
    9192             : /*  edge.  These triangles are also linked together in a fan about the NULL  */
    9193             : /*  vertex.                                                                  */
    9194             : /*                                                                           */
    9195             : /*  The bounding box also makes it easy to traverse the convex hull, as the  */
    9196             : /*  divide-and-conquer algorithm needs to do.                                */
    9197             : /*                                                                           */
    9198             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9199             : 
    9200             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9201             : /*                                                                           */
    9202             : /*  vertexsort()   Sort an array of vertices by x-coordinate, using the      */
    9203             : /*                 y-coordinate as a secondary key.                          */
    9204             : /*                                                                           */
    9205             : /*  Uses quicksort.  Randomized O(n log n) time.  No, I did not make any of  */
    9206             : /*  the usual quicksort mistakes.                                            */
    9207             : /*                                                                           */
    9208             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9209             : 
    9210             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    9211             : void vertexsort(vertex *sortarray, int arraysize)
    9212             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9213           0 : void vertexsort(sortarray, arraysize)
    9214             : vertex *sortarray;
    9215             : int arraysize;
    9216             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9217             : 
    9218             : {
    9219             :   int left, right;
    9220             :   int pivot;
    9221             :   REAL pivotx, pivoty;
    9222             :   vertex temp;
    9223             : 
    9224           0 :   if (arraysize == 2) {
    9225             :     /* Recursive base case. */
    9226           0 :     if ((sortarray[0][0] > sortarray[1][0]) ||
    9227           0 :         ((sortarray[0][0] == sortarray[1][0]) &&
    9228           0 :          (sortarray[0][1] > sortarray[1][1]))) {
    9229           0 :       temp = sortarray[1];
    9230           0 :       sortarray[1] = sortarray[0];
    9231           0 :       sortarray[0] = temp;
    9232             :     }
    9233           0 :     return;
    9234             :   }
    9235             :   /* Choose a random pivot to split the array. */
    9236           0 :   pivot = (int) randomnation((unsigned int) arraysize);
    9237           0 :   pivotx = sortarray[pivot][0];
    9238           0 :   pivoty = sortarray[pivot][1];
    9239             :   /* Split the array. */
    9240           0 :   left = -1;
    9241           0 :   right = arraysize;
    9242           0 :   while (left < right) {
    9243             :     /* Search for a vertex whose x-coordinate is too large for the left. */
    9244             :     do {
    9245           0 :       left++;
    9246           0 :     } while ((left <= right) && ((sortarray[left][0] < pivotx) ||
    9247           0 :                                  ((sortarray[left][0] == pivotx) &&
    9248           0 :                                   (sortarray[left][1] < pivoty))));
    9249             :     /* Search for a vertex whose x-coordinate is too small for the right. */
    9250             :     do {
    9251           0 :       right--;
    9252           0 :     } while ((left <= right) && ((sortarray[right][0] > pivotx) ||
    9253           0 :                                  ((sortarray[right][0] == pivotx) &&
    9254           0 :                                   (sortarray[right][1] > pivoty))));
    9255           0 :     if (left < right) {
    9256             :       /* Swap the left and right vertices. */
    9257           0 :       temp = sortarray[left];
    9258           0 :       sortarray[left] = sortarray[right];
    9259           0 :       sortarray[right] = temp;
    9260             :     }
    9261             :   }
    9262           0 :   if (left > 1) {
    9263             :     /* Recursively sort the left subset. */
    9264           0 :     vertexsort(sortarray, left);
    9265             :   }
    9266           0 :   if (right < arraysize - 2) {
    9267             :     /* Recursively sort the right subset. */
    9268           0 :     vertexsort(&sortarray[right + 1], arraysize - right - 1);
    9269             :   }
    9270             : }
    9271             : 
    9272             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9273             : /*                                                                           */
    9274             : /*  vertexmedian()   An order statistic algorithm, almost.  Shuffles an      */
    9275             : /*                   array of vertices so that the first `median' vertices   */
    9276             : /*                   occur lexicographically before the remaining vertices.  */
    9277             : /*                                                                           */
    9278             : /*  Uses the x-coordinate as the primary key if axis == 0; the y-coordinate  */
    9279             : /*  if axis == 1.  Very similar to the vertexsort() procedure, but runs in   */
    9280             : /*  randomized linear time.                                                  */
    9281             : /*                                                                           */
    9282             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9283             : 
    9284             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    9285             : void vertexmedian(vertex *sortarray, int arraysize, int median, int axis)
    9286             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9287           0 : void vertexmedian(sortarray, arraysize, median, axis)
    9288             : vertex *sortarray;
    9289             : int arraysize;
    9290             : int median;
    9291             : int axis;
    9292             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9293             : 
    9294             : {
    9295             :   int left, right;
    9296             :   int pivot;
    9297             :   REAL pivot1, pivot2;
    9298             :   vertex temp;
    9299             : 
    9300           0 :   if (arraysize == 2) {
    9301             :     /* Recursive base case. */
    9302           0 :     if ((sortarray[0][axis] > sortarray[1][axis]) ||
    9303           0 :         ((sortarray[0][axis] == sortarray[1][axis]) &&
    9304           0 :          (sortarray[0][1 - axis] > sortarray[1][1 - axis]))) {
    9305           0 :       temp = sortarray[1];
    9306           0 :       sortarray[1] = sortarray[0];
    9307           0 :       sortarray[0] = temp;
    9308             :     }
    9309           0 :     return;
    9310             :   }
    9311             :   /* Choose a random pivot to split the array. */
    9312           0 :   pivot = (int) randomnation((unsigned int) arraysize);
    9313           0 :   pivot1 = sortarray[pivot][axis];
    9314           0 :   pivot2 = sortarray[pivot][1 - axis];
    9315             :   /* Split the array. */
    9316           0 :   left = -1;
    9317           0 :   right = arraysize;
    9318           0 :   while (left < right) {
    9319             :     /* Search for a vertex whose x-coordinate is too large for the left. */
    9320             :     do {
    9321           0 :       left++;
    9322           0 :     } while ((left <= right) && ((sortarray[left][axis] < pivot1) ||
    9323           0 :                                  ((sortarray[left][axis] == pivot1) &&
    9324           0 :                                   (sortarray[left][1 - axis] < pivot2))));
    9325             :     /* Search for a vertex whose x-coordinate is too small for the right. */
    9326             :     do {
    9327           0 :       right--;
    9328           0 :     } while ((left <= right) && ((sortarray[right][axis] > pivot1) ||
    9329           0 :                                  ((sortarray[right][axis] == pivot1) &&
    9330           0 :                                   (sortarray[right][1 - axis] > pivot2))));
    9331           0 :     if (left < right) {
    9332             :       /* Swap the left and right vertices. */
    9333           0 :       temp = sortarray[left];
    9334           0 :       sortarray[left] = sortarray[right];
    9335           0 :       sortarray[right] = temp;
    9336             :     }
    9337             :   }
    9338             :   /* Unlike in vertexsort(), at most one of the following */
    9339             :   /*   conditionals is true.                             */
    9340           0 :   if (left > median) {
    9341             :     /* Recursively shuffle the left subset. */
    9342           0 :     vertexmedian(sortarray, left, median, axis);
    9343             :   }
    9344           0 :   if (right < median - 1) {
    9345             :     /* Recursively shuffle the right subset. */
    9346           0 :     vertexmedian(&sortarray[right + 1], arraysize - right - 1,
    9347           0 :                  median - right - 1, axis);
    9348             :   }
    9349             : }
    9350             : 
    9351             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9352             : /*                                                                           */
    9353             : /*  alternateaxes()   Sorts the vertices as appropriate for the divide-and-  */
    9354             : /*                    conquer algorithm with alternating cuts.               */
    9355             : /*                                                                           */
    9356             : /*  Partitions by x-coordinate if axis == 0; by y-coordinate if axis == 1.   */
    9357             : /*  For the base case, subsets containing only two or three vertices are     */
    9358             : /*  always sorted by x-coordinate.                                           */
    9359             : /*                                                                           */
    9360             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9361             : 
    9362             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    9363             : void alternateaxes(vertex *sortarray, int arraysize, int axis)
    9364             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9365           0 : void alternateaxes(sortarray, arraysize, axis)
    9366             : vertex *sortarray;
    9367             : int arraysize;
    9368             : int axis;
    9369             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9370             : 
    9371             : {
    9372             :   int divider;
    9373             : 
    9374           0 :   divider = arraysize >> 1;
    9375           0 :   if (arraysize <= 3) {
    9376             :     /* Recursive base case:  subsets of two or three vertices will be    */
    9377             :     /*   handled specially, and should always be sorted by x-coordinate. */
    9378           0 :     axis = 0;
    9379             :   }
    9380             :   /* Partition with a horizontal or vertical cut. */
    9381           0 :   vertexmedian(sortarray, arraysize, divider, axis);
    9382             :   /* Recursively partition the subsets with a cross cut. */
    9383           0 :   if (arraysize - divider >= 2) {
    9384           0 :     if (divider >= 2) {
    9385           0 :       alternateaxes(sortarray, divider, 1 - axis);
    9386             :     }
    9387           0 :     alternateaxes(&sortarray[divider], arraysize - divider, 1 - axis);
    9388             :   }
    9389           0 : }
    9390             : 
    9391             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9392             : /*                                                                           */
    9393             : /*  mergehulls()   Merge two adjacent Delaunay triangulations into a         */
    9394             : /*                 single Delaunay triangulation.                            */
    9395             : /*                                                                           */
    9396             : /*  This is similar to the algorithm given by Guibas and Stolfi, but uses    */
    9397             : /*  a triangle-based, rather than edge-based, data structure.                */
    9398             : /*                                                                           */
    9399             : /*  The algorithm walks up the gap between the two triangulations, knitting  */
    9400             : /*  them together.  As they are merged, some of their bounding triangles     */
    9401             : /*  are converted into real triangles of the triangulation.  The procedure   */
    9402             : /*  pulls each hull's bounding triangles apart, then knits them together     */
    9403             : /*  like the teeth of two gears.  The Delaunay property determines, at each  */
    9404             : /*  step, whether the next "tooth" is a bounding triangle of the left hull   */
    9405             : /*  or the right.  When a bounding triangle becomes real, its apex is        */
    9406             : /*  changed from NULL to a real vertex.                                      */
    9407             : /*                                                                           */
    9408             : /*  Only two new triangles need to be allocated.  These become new bounding  */
    9409             : /*  triangles at the top and bottom of the seam.  They are used to connect   */
    9410             : /*  the remaining bounding triangles (those that have not been converted     */
    9411             : /*  into real triangles) into a single fan.                                  */
    9412             : /*                                                                           */
    9413             : /*  On entry, `farleft' and `innerleft' are bounding triangles of the left   */
    9414             : /*  triangulation.  The origin of `farleft' is the leftmost vertex, and      */
    9415             : /*  the destination of `innerleft' is the rightmost vertex of the            */
    9416             : /*  triangulation.  Similarly, `innerright' and `farright' are bounding      */
    9417             : /*  triangles of the right triangulation.  The origin of `innerright' and    */
    9418             : /*  destination of `farright' are the leftmost and rightmost vertices.       */
    9419             : /*                                                                           */
    9420             : /*  On completion, the origin of `farleft' is the leftmost vertex of the     */
    9421             : /*  merged triangulation, and the destination of `farright' is the rightmost */
    9422             : /*  vertex.                                                                  */
    9423             : /*                                                                           */
    9424             : /*****************************************************************************/
    9425             : 
    9426             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
    9427             : void mergehulls(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *farleft,
    9428             :                 struct otri *innerleft, struct otri *innerright,
    9429             :                 struct otri *farright, int axis)
    9430             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9431           0 : void mergehulls(m, b, farleft, innerleft, innerright, farright, axis)
    9432             : struct mesh *m;
    9433             : struct behavior *b;
    9434             : struct otri *farleft;
    9435             : struct otri *innerleft;
    9436             : struct otri *innerright;
    9437             : struct otri *farright;
    9438             : int axis;
    9439             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
    9440             : 
    9441             : {
    9442             :   struct otri leftcand, rightcand;
    9443             :   struct otri baseedge;
    9444             :   struct otri nextedge;
    9445             :   struct otri sidecasing, topcasing, outercasing;
    9446             :   struct otri checkedge;
    9447             :   vertex innerleftdest;
    9448             :   vertex innerrightorg;
    9449             :   vertex innerleftapex, innerrightapex;
    9450             :   vertex farleftpt, farrightpt;
    9451             :   vertex farleftapex, farrightapex;
    9452             :   vertex lowerleft, lowerright;
    9453             :   vertex upperleft, upperright;
    9454             :   vertex nextapex;
    9455             :   vertex checkvertex;
    9456             :   int changemade;
    9457             :   int badedge;
    9458             :   int leftfinished, rightfinished;
    9459             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
    9460             : 
    9461           0 :   dest(*innerleft, innerleftdest);
    9462           0 :   apex(*innerleft, innerleftapex);
    9463           0 :   org(*innerright, innerrightorg);
    9464           0 :   apex(*innerright, innerrightapex);
    9465             :   /* Special treatment for horizontal cuts. */
    9466           0 :   if (b->dwyer && (axis == 1)) {
    9467           0 :     org(*farleft, farleftpt);
    9468           0 :     apex(*farleft, farleftapex);
    9469           0 :     dest(*farright, farrightpt);
    9470           0 :     apex(*farright, farrightapex);
    9471             :     /* The pointers to the extremal vertices are shifted to point to the */
    9472             :     /*   topmost and bottommost vertex of each hull, rather than the     */
    9473             :     /*   leftmost and rightmost vertices.                                */
    9474           0 :     while (farleftapex[1] < farleftpt[1]) {
    9475           0 :       lnextself(*farleft);
    9476           0 :       symself(*farleft);
    9477           0 :       farleftpt = farleftapex;
    9478           0 :       apex(*farleft, farleftapex);
    9479             :     }
    9480           0 :     sym(*innerleft, checkedge);
    9481           0 :     apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9482           0 :     while (checkvertex[1] > innerleftdest[1]) {
    9483           0 :       lnext(checkedge, *innerleft);
    9484           0 :       innerleftapex = innerleftdest;
    9485           0 :       innerleftdest = checkvertex;
    9486           0 :       sym(*innerleft, checkedge);
    9487           0 :       apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9488             :     }
    9489           0 :     while (innerrightapex[1] < innerrightorg[1]) {
    9490           0 :       lnextself(*innerright);
    9491           0 :       symself(*innerright);
    9492           0 :       innerrightorg = innerrightapex;
    9493           0 :       apex(*innerright, innerrightapex);
    9494             :     }
    9495           0 :     sym(*farright, checkedge);
    9496           0 :     apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9497           0 :     while (checkvertex[1] > farrightpt[1]) {
    9498           0 :       lnext(checkedge, *farright);
    9499           0 :       farrightapex = farrightpt;
    9500           0 :       farrightpt = checkvertex;
    9501           0 :       sym(*farright, checkedge);
    9502           0 :       apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9503             :     }
    9504             :   }
    9505             :   /* Find a line tangent to and below both hulls. */
    9506             :   do {
    9507           0 :     changemade = 0;
    9508             :     /* Make innerleftdest the "bottommost" vertex of the left hull. */
    9509           0 :     if (counterclockwise(m, b, innerleftdest, innerleftapex, innerrightorg) >
    9510             :         0.0) {
    9511           0 :       lprevself(*innerleft);
    9512           0 :       symself(*innerleft);
    9513           0 :       innerleftdest = innerleftapex;
    9514           0 :       apex(*innerleft, innerleftapex);
    9515           0 :       changemade = 1;
    9516             :     }
    9517             :     /* Make innerrightorg the "bottommost" vertex of the right hull. */
    9518           0 :     if (counterclockwise(m, b, innerrightapex, innerrightorg, innerleftdest) >
    9519             :         0.0) {
    9520           0 :       lnextself(*innerright);
    9521           0 :       symself(*innerright);
    9522           0 :       innerrightorg = innerrightapex;
    9523           0 :       apex(*innerright, innerrightapex);
    9524           0 :       changemade = 1;
    9525             :     }
    9526           0 :   } while (changemade);
    9527             :   /* Find the two candidates to be the next "gear tooth." */
    9528           0 :   sym(*innerleft, leftcand);
    9529           0 :   sym(*innerright, rightcand);
    9530             :   /* Create the bottom new bounding triangle. */
    9531           0 :   maketriangle(m, b, &baseedge);
    9532             :   /* Connect it to the bounding boxes of the left and right triangulations. */
    9533           0 :   bond(baseedge, *innerleft);
    9534           0 :   lnextself(baseedge);
    9535           0 :   bond(baseedge, *innerright);
    9536           0 :   lnextself(baseedge);
    9537           0 :   setorg(baseedge, innerrightorg);
    9538           0 :   setdest(baseedge, innerleftdest);
    9539             :   /* Apex is intentionally left NULL. */
    9540           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
    9541           0 :     printf("  Creating base bounding ");
    9542           0 :     printtriangle(m, b, &baseedge);
    9543             :   }
    9544             :   /* Fix the extreme triangles if necessary. */
    9545           0 :   org(*farleft, farleftpt);
    9546           0 :   if (innerleftdest == farleftpt) {
    9547           0 :     lnext(baseedge, *farleft);
    9548             :   }
    9549           0 :   dest(*farright, farrightpt);
    9550           0 :   if (innerrightorg == farrightpt) {
    9551           0 :     lprev(baseedge, *farright);
    9552             :   }
    9553             :   /* The vertices of the current knitting edge. */
    9554           0 :   lowerleft = innerleftdest;
    9555           0 :   lowerright = innerrightorg;
    9556             :   /* The candidate vertices for knitting. */
    9557           0 :   apex(leftcand, upperleft);
    9558           0 :   apex(rightcand, upperright);
    9559             :   /* Walk up the gap between the two triangulations, knitting them together. */
    9560             :   while (1) {
    9561             :     /* Have we reached the top?  (This isn't quite the right question,       */
    9562             :     /*   because even though the left triangulation might seem finished now, */
    9563             :     /*   moving up on the right triangulation might reveal a new vertex of   */
    9564             :     /*   the left triangulation.  And vice-versa.)                           */
    9565           0 :     leftfinished = counterclockwise(m, b, upperleft, lowerleft, lowerright) <=
    9566             :                    0.0;
    9567           0 :     rightfinished = counterclockwise(m, b, upperright, lowerleft, lowerright)
    9568           0 :                  <= 0.0;
    9569           0 :     if (leftfinished && rightfinished) {
    9570             :       /* Create the top new bounding triangle. */
    9571           0 :       maketriangle(m, b, &nextedge);
    9572           0 :       setorg(nextedge, lowerleft);
    9573           0 :       setdest(nextedge, lowerright);
    9574             :       /* Apex is intentionally left NULL. */
    9575             :       /* Connect it to the bounding boxes of the two triangulations. */
    9576           0 :       bond(nextedge, baseedge);
    9577           0 :       lnextself(nextedge);
    9578           0 :       bond(nextedge, rightcand);
    9579           0 :       lnextself(nextedge);
    9580           0 :       bond(nextedge, leftcand);
    9581           0 :       if (b->verbose > 2) {
    9582           0 :         printf("  Creating top bounding ");
    9583           0 :         printtriangle(m, b, &nextedge);
    9584             :       }
    9585             :       /* Special treatment for horizontal cuts. */
    9586           0 :       if (b->dwyer && (axis == 1)) {
    9587           0 :         org(*farleft, farleftpt);
    9588           0 :         apex(*farleft, farleftapex);
    9589           0 :         dest(*farright, farrightpt);
    9590           0 :         apex(*farright, farrightapex);
    9591           0 :         sym(*farleft, checkedge);
    9592           0 :         apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9593             :         /* The pointers to the extremal vertices are restored to the  */
    9594             :         /*   leftmost and rightmost vertices (rather than topmost and */
    9595             :         /*   bottommost).                                             */
    9596           0 :         while (checkvertex[0] < farleftpt[0]) {
    9597           0 :           lprev(checkedge, *farleft);
    9598           0 :           farleftapex = farleftpt;
    9599           0 :           farleftpt = checkvertex;
    9600           0 :           sym(*farleft, checkedge);
    9601           0 :           apex(checkedge, checkvertex);
    9602             :         }
    9603           0 :         while (farrightapex[0] > farrightpt[0]) {
    9604           0 :           lprevself(*farright);
    9605           0 :           symself(*farright);
    9606           0 :           farrightpt = farrightapex;
    9607           0 :           apex(*farright, farrightapex);
    9608             :         }
    9609             :       }
    9610           0 :       return;
    9611             :     }
    9612             :     /* Consider eliminating edges from the left triangulation. */
    9613           0 :     if (!leftfinished) {
    9614             :       /* What vertex would be exposed if an edge were deleted? */
    9615           0 :       lprev(leftcand, nextedge);
    9616           0 :       symself(nextedge);
    9617           0 :       apex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9618             :       /* If nextapex is NULL, then no vertex would be exposed; the */
    9619             :       /*   triangulation would have been eaten right through.      */
    9620           0 :       if (nextapex != (vertex) NULL) {
    9621             :         /* Check whether the edge is Delaunay. */
    9622           0 :         badedge = incircle(m, b, lowerleft, lowerright, upperleft, nextapex) >
    9623             :                   0.0;
    9624           0 :         while (badedge) {
    9625             :           /* Eliminate the edge with an edge flip.  As a result, the    */
    9626             :           /*   left triangulation will have one more boundary triangle. */
    9627           0 :           lnextself(nextedge);
    9628           0 :           sym(nextedge, topcasing);
    9629           0 :           lnextself(nextedge);
    9630           0 :           sym(nextedge, sidecasing);
    9631           0 :           bond(nextedge, topcasing);
    9632           0 :           bond(leftcand, sidecasing);
    9633           0 :           lnextself(leftcand);
    9634           0 :           sym(leftcand, outercasing);
    9635           0 :           lprevself(nextedge);
    9636           0 :           bond(nextedge, outercasing);
    9637             :           /* Correct the vertices to reflect the edge flip. */
    9638           0 :           setorg(leftcand, lowerleft);
    9639           0 :           setdest(leftcand, NULL);
    9640           0 :           setapex(leftcand, nextapex);
    9641           0 :           setorg(nextedge, NULL);
    9642           0 :           setdest(nextedge, upperleft);
    9643           0 :           setapex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9644             :           /* Consider the newly exposed vertex. */
    9645           0 :           upperleft = nextapex;
    9646             :           /* What vertex would be exposed if another edge were deleted? */
    9647           0 :           otricopy(sidecasing, nextedge);
    9648           0 :           apex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9649           0 :           if (nextapex != (vertex) NULL) {
    9650             :             /* Check whether the edge is Delaunay. */
    9651           0 :             badedge = incircle(m, b, lowerleft, lowerright, upperleft,
    9652           0 :                                nextapex) > 0.0;
    9653             :           } else {
    9654             :             /* Avoid eating right through the triangulation. */
    9655           0 :             badedge = 0;
    9656             :           }
    9657             :         }
    9658             :       }
    9659             :     }
    9660             :     /* Consider eliminating edges from the right triangulation. */
    9661           0 :     if (!rightfinished) {
    9662             :       /* What vertex would be exposed if an edge were deleted? */
    9663           0 :       lnext(rightcand, nextedge);
    9664           0 :       symself(nextedge);
    9665           0 :       apex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9666             :       /* If nextapex is NULL, then no vertex would be exposed; the */
    9667             :       /*   triangulation would have been eaten right through.      */
    9668           0 :       if (nextapex != (vertex) NULL) {
    9669             :         /* Check whether the edge is Delaunay. */
    9670           0 :         badedge = incircle(m, b, lowerleft, lowerright, upperright, nextapex) >
    9671             :                   0.0;
    9672           0 :         while (badedge) {
    9673             :           /* Eliminate the edge with an edge flip.  As a result, the     */
    9674             :           /*   right triangulation will have one more boundary triangle. */
    9675           0 :           lprevself(nextedge);
    9676           0 :           sym(nextedge, topcasing);
    9677           0 :           lprevself(nextedge);
    9678           0 :           sym(nextedge, sidecasing);
    9679           0 :           bond(nextedge, topcasing);
    9680           0 :           bond(rightcand, sidecasing);
    9681           0 :           lprevself(rightcand);
    9682           0 :           sym(rightcand, outercasing);
    9683           0 :           lnextself(nextedge);
    9684           0 :           bond(nextedge, outercasing);
    9685             :           /* Correct the vertices to reflect the edge flip. */
    9686           0 :           setorg(rightcand, NULL);
    9687           0 :           setdest(rightcand, lowerright);
    9688           0 :           setapex(rightcand, nextapex);
    9689           0 :           setorg(nextedge, upperright);
    9690           0 :           setdest(nextedge, NULL);
    9691           0 :           setapex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9692             :           /* Consider the newly exposed vertex. */
    9693           0 :           upperright = nextapex;
    9694             :           /* What vertex would be exposed if another edge were deleted? */
    9695           0 :           otricopy(sidecasing, nextedge);
    9696           0 :           apex(nextedge, nextapex);
    9697           0 :           if (nextapex != (vertex) NULL) {
    9698             :             /* Check whether the edge is Delaunay. */
    9699           0 :             badedge = incircle(m, b, lowerleft, lowerright, upperright,
    9700           0 :                                nextapex) > 0.0;
    9701             :           } else {
    9702             :             /* Avoid eating right through the triangulation. */
    9703           0 :             badedge = 0;
    9704             :           }
    9705             :         }
    9706             :       }
    9707             :     }
    9708           0 :     if (leftfinished || (!rightfinished &&
    9709           0 :            (incircle(m, b, upperleft, lowerleft, lowerright, upperright) >
    9710             :             0.0))) {
    9711             :       /* Knit the triangulations, adding an edge from `lowerleft' */
    9712             :       /*   to `upperright'.                                       */

    9714           0 :       lprev(rightcand, baseedge);
    9715           0 :       setdest(baseedge, lowerleft);
    9716           0 :       lowerright = upperright;
    9717           0 :       sym(baseedge, rightcand);
    9718           0 :       apex(rightcand, upperright);
    9719             :     } else {
    9720             :       /* Knit the triangulations, adding an edge from `upperleft' */
    9721             :       /*   to `lowerright'.                                       */
