   11502             :       /* Try linking the subsegment to triangles that share these vertices. */
   11503           0 :       for (subsegloop.ssorient = 0; subsegloop.ssorient < 2;
   11504           0 :            subsegloop.ssorient++) {
   11505             :         /* Take the number for the destination of subsegloop. */
   11506           0 :         aroundvertex = end[1 - subsegloop.ssorient];
   11507             :         /* Look for triangles having this vertex. */
   11508           0 :         prevlink = &vertexarray[aroundvertex - b->firstnumber];
   11509           0 :         nexttri = vertexarray[aroundvertex - b->firstnumber];
   11510           0 :         decode(nexttri, checktri);
   11511           0 :         sorg(subsegloop, shorg);
   11512           0 :         notfound = 1;
   11513             :         /* Look for triangles having this edge.  Note that I'm only       */
   11514             :         /*   comparing each triangle's destination with the subsegment;   */
   11515             :         /*   each triangle's apex is handled through a different vertex.  */
   11516             :         /*   Because each triangle appears on three vertices' lists, each */
   11517             :         /*   occurrence of a triangle on a list can (and does) represent  */
   11518             :         /*   an edge.  In this way, most edges are represented twice, and */
   11519             :         /*   every triangle-subsegment bond is represented once.          */
   11520           0 :         while (notfound && (checktri.tri != m->dummytri)) {
   11521           0 :           dest(checktri, checkdest);
   11522           0 :           if (shorg == checkdest) {
   11523             :             /* We have a match.  Remove this triangle from the list. */
   11524           0 :             *prevlink = checktri.tri[6 + checktri.orient];
   11525             :             /* Bond the subsegment to the triangle. */
   11526           0 :             tsbond(checktri, subsegloop);
   11527             :             /* Check if this is a boundary edge. */
   11528           0 :             sym(checktri, checkneighbor);
   11529           0 :             if (checkneighbor.tri == m->dummytri) {
   11530             :               /* The next line doesn't insert a subsegment (because there's */
   11531             :               /*   already one there), but it sets the boundary markers of  */
   11532             :               /*   the existing subsegment and its vertices.                */
   11533           0 :               insertsubseg(m, b, &checktri, 1);
   11534           0 :               hullsize++;
   11535             :             }
   11536           0 :             notfound = 0;
   11537             :           }
   11538             :           /* Find the next triangle in the stack. */
   11539           0 :           prevlink = &checktri.tri[6 + checktri.orient];
   11540           0 :           nexttri = checktri.tri[6 + checktri.orient];
   11541           0 :           decode(nexttri, checktri);
   11542             :         }
   11543             :       }
   11544           0 :       subsegloop.ss = subsegtraverse(m);
   11545           0 :       segmentnumber++;
   11546             :     }
   11547             :   }
   11548             : 
   11549             :   /* Mark the remaining edges as not being attached to any subsegment. */
   11550             :   /* Also, count the (yet uncounted) boundary edges.                   */
   11551           0 :   for (i = 0; i < m->vertices.items; i++) {
   11552             :     /* Search the stack of triangles adjacent to a vertex. */
   11553           0 :     nexttri = vertexarray[i];
   11554           0 :     decode(nexttri, checktri);
   11555           0 :     while (checktri.tri != m->dummytri) {
   11556             :       /* Find the next triangle in the stack before this */
   11557             :       /*   information gets overwritten.                 */
   11558           0 :       nexttri = checktri.tri[6 + checktri.orient];
   11559             :       /* No adjacent subsegment.  (This overwrites the stack info.) */
   11560           0 :       tsdissolve(checktri);
   11561           0 :       sym(checktri, checkneighbor);
   11562           0 :       if (checkneighbor.tri == m->dummytri) {
   11563           0 :         insertsubseg(m, b, &checktri, 1);
   11564           0 :         hullsize++;
   11565             :       }
   11566           0 :       decode(nexttri, checktri);
   11567             :     }
   11568             :   }
   11569             : 
   11570           0 :   trifree((VOID *) vertexarray);
   11571           0 :   return hullsize;
   11572             : }
   11573             : 
   11574             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   11575             : 
   11576             : /**                                                                         **/
   11577             : /**                                                                         **/
   11578             : /********* General mesh construction routines end here               *********/
   11579             : 
   11580             : /********* Segment insertion begins here                             *********/
   11581             : /**                                                                         **/
   11582             : /**                                                                         **/
   11583             : 
   11584             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11585             : /*                                                                           */
   11586             : /*  finddirection()   Find the first triangle on the path from one point     */
   11587             : /*                    to another.                                            */
   11588             : /*                                                                           */
   11589             : /*  Finds the triangle that intersects a line segment drawn from the         */
   11590             : /*  origin of `searchtri' to the point `searchpoint', and returns the result */
   11591             : /*  in `searchtri'.  The origin of `searchtri' does not change, even though  */
   11592             : /*  the triangle returned may differ from the one passed in.  This routine   */
   11593             : /*  is used to find the direction to move in to get from one point to        */
   11594             : /*  another.                                                                 */
   11595             : /*                                                                           */
   11596             : /*  The return value notes whether the destination or apex of the found      */
   11597             : /*  triangle is collinear with the two points in question.                   */
   11598             : /*                                                                           */
   11599             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11600             : 
   11601             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   11602             : enum finddirectionresult finddirection(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   11603             :                                        struct otri *searchtri,
   11604             :                                        vertex searchpoint)
   11605             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11606           0 : enum finddirectionresult finddirection(m, b, searchtri, searchpoint)
   11607             : struct mesh *m;
   11608             : struct behavior *b;
   11609             : struct otri *searchtri;
   11610             : vertex searchpoint;
   11611             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11612             : 
   11613             : {
   11614             :   struct otri checktri;
   11615             :   vertex startvertex;
   11616             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex;
   11617             :   REAL leftccw, rightccw;
   11618             :   int leftflag, rightflag;
   11619             :   triangle ptr;           /* Temporary variable used by onext() and oprev(). */
   11620             : 
   11621           0 :   org(*searchtri, startvertex);
   11622           0 :   dest(*searchtri, rightvertex);
   11623           0 :   apex(*searchtri, leftvertex);
   11624             :   /* Is `searchpoint' to the left? */
   11625           0 :   leftccw = counterclockwise(m, b, searchpoint, startvertex, leftvertex);
   11626           0 :   leftflag = leftccw > 0.0;
   11627             :   /* Is `searchpoint' to the right? */
   11628           0 :   rightccw = counterclockwise(m, b, startvertex, searchpoint, rightvertex);
   11629           0 :   rightflag = rightccw > 0.0;
   11630           0 :   if (leftflag && rightflag) {
   11631             :     /* `searchtri' faces directly away from `searchpoint'.  We could go left */
   11632             :     /*   or right.  Ask whether it's a triangle or a boundary on the left.   */
   11633           0 :     onext(*searchtri, checktri);
   11634           0 :     if (checktri.tri == m->dummytri) {
   11635           0 :       leftflag = 0;
   11636             :     } else {
   11637           0 :       rightflag = 0;
   11638             :     }
   11639             :   }
   11640           0 :   while (leftflag) {
   11641             :     /* Turn left until satisfied. */
   11642           0 :     onextself(*searchtri);
   11643           0 :     if (searchtri->tri == m->dummytri) {
   11644           0 :       printf("Internal error in finddirection():  Unable to find a\n");
   11645           0 :       printf("  triangle leading from (%.12g, %.12g) to", startvertex[0],
   11646           0 :              startvertex[1]);
   11647           0 :       printf("  (%.12g, %.12g).\n", searchpoint[0], searchpoint[1]);
   11648           0 :       internalerror();
   11649             :     }
   11650           0 :     apex(*searchtri, leftvertex);
   11651           0 :     rightccw = leftccw;
   11652           0 :     leftccw = counterclockwise(m, b, searchpoint, startvertex, leftvertex);
   11653           0 :     leftflag = leftccw > 0.0;
   11654             :   }
   11655           0 :   while (rightflag) {
   11656             :     /* Turn right until satisfied. */
   11657           0 :     oprevself(*searchtri);
   11658           0 :     if (searchtri->tri == m->dummytri) {
   11659           0 :       printf("Internal error in finddirection():  Unable to find a\n");
   11660           0 :       printf("  triangle leading from (%.12g, %.12g) to", startvertex[0],
   11661           0 :              startvertex[1]);
   11662           0 :       printf("  (%.12g, %.12g).\n", searchpoint[0], searchpoint[1]);
   11663           0 :       internalerror();
   11664             :     }
   11665           0 :     dest(*searchtri, rightvertex);
   11666           0 :     leftccw = rightccw;
   11667           0 :     rightccw = counterclockwise(m, b, startvertex, searchpoint, rightvertex);
   11668           0 :     rightflag = rightccw > 0.0;
   11669             :   }
   11670           0 :   if (leftccw == 0.0) {
   11671           0 :     return LEFTCOLLINEAR;
   11672           0 :   } else if (rightccw == 0.0) {
   11673           0 :     return RIGHTCOLLINEAR;
   11674             :   } else {
   11675           0 :     return WITHIN;
   11676             :   }
   11677             : }
   11678             : 
   11679             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11680             : /*                                                                           */
   11681             : /*  segmentintersection()   Find the intersection of an existing segment     */
   11682             : /*                          and a segment that is being inserted.  Insert    */
   11683             : /*                          a vertex at the intersection, splitting an       */
   11684             : /*                          existing subsegment.                             */
   11685             : /*                                                                           */
   11686             : /*  The segment being inserted connects the apex of splittri to endpoint2.   */
   11687             : /*  splitsubseg is the subsegment being split, and MUST adjoin splittri.     */
   11688             : /*  Hence, endpoints of the subsegment being split are the origin and        */
   11689             : /*  destination of splittri.                                                 */
   11690             : /*                                                                           */
   11691             : /*  On completion, splittri is a handle having the newly inserted            */
   11692             : /*  intersection point as its origin, and endpoint1 as its destination.      */
   11693             : /*                                                                           */
   11694             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11695             : 
   11696             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   11697             : void segmentintersection(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   11698             :                          struct otri *splittri, struct osub *splitsubseg,
   11699             :                          vertex endpoint2)
   11700             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11701           0 : void segmentintersection(m, b, splittri, splitsubseg, endpoint2)
   11702             : struct mesh *m;
   11703             : struct behavior *b;
   11704             : struct otri *splittri;
   11705             : struct osub *splitsubseg;
   11706             : vertex endpoint2;
   11707             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11708             : 
   11709             : {
   11710             :   struct osub opposubseg;
   11711             :   vertex endpoint1;
   11712             :   vertex torg, tdest;
   11713             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex;
   11714             :   vertex newvertex;
   11715             :   enum insertvertexresult success;
   11716             :   enum finddirectionresult collinear;
   11717             :   REAL ex, ey;
   11718             :   REAL tx, ty;
   11719             :   REAL etx, ety;
   11720             :   REAL split, denom;
   11721             :   int i;
   11722             :   triangle ptr;                       /* Temporary variable used by onext(). */
   11723             :   subseg sptr;                        /* Temporary variable used by snext(). */
   11724             : 
   11725             :   /* Find the other three segment endpoints. */
   11726           0 :   apex(*splittri, endpoint1);
   11727           0 :   org(*splittri, torg);
   11728           0 :   dest(*splittri, tdest);
   11729             :   /* Segment intersection formulae; see the Antonio reference. */
   11730           0 :   tx = tdest[0] - torg[0];
   11731           0 :   ty = tdest[1] - torg[1];
   11732           0 :   ex = endpoint2[0] - endpoint1[0];
   11733           0 :   ey = endpoint2[1] - endpoint1[1];
   11734           0 :   etx = torg[0] - endpoint2[0];
   11735           0 :   ety = torg[1] - endpoint2[1];
   11736           0 :   denom = ty * ex - tx * ey;
   11737           0 :   if (denom == 0.0) {
   11738           0 :     printf("Internal error in segmentintersection():");
   11739           0 :     printf("  Attempt to find intersection of parallel segments.\n");
   11740           0 :     internalerror();
   11741             :   }
   11742           0 :   split = (ey * etx - ex * ety) / denom;
   11743             :   /* Create the new vertex. */
   11744           0 :   newvertex = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   11745             :   /* Interpolate its coordinate and attributes. */
   11746           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   11747           0 :     newvertex[i] = torg[i] + split * (tdest[i] - torg[i]);
   11748             :   }
   11749           0 :   setvertexmark(newvertex, mark(*splitsubseg));
   11750           0 :   setvertextype(newvertex, INPUTVERTEX);
   11751           0 :   if (b->verbose > 1) {
   11752           0 :     printf(
   11753             :   "  Splitting subsegment (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) at (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   11754           0 :            torg[0], torg[1], tdest[0], tdest[1], newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   11755             :   }
   11756             :   /* Insert the intersection vertex.  This should always succeed. */
   11757           0 :   success = insertvertex(m, b, newvertex, splittri, splitsubseg, 0, 0);
   11758           0 :   if (success != SUCCESSFULVERTEX) {
   11759           0 :     printf("Internal error in segmentintersection():\n");
   11760           0 :     printf("  Failure to split a segment.\n");
   11761           0 :     internalerror();
   11762             :   }
   11763             :   /* Record a triangle whose origin is the new vertex. */
   11764           0 :   setvertex2tri(newvertex, encode(*splittri));
   11765           0 :   if (m->steinerleft > 0) {
   11766           0 :     m->steinerleft--;
   11767             :   }
   11768             : 
   11769             :   /* Divide the segment into two, and correct the segment endpoints. */
   11770           0 :   ssymself(*splitsubseg);
   11771           0 :   spivot(*splitsubseg, opposubseg);
   11772           0 :   sdissolve(*splitsubseg);
   11773           0 :   sdissolve(opposubseg);
   11774             :   do {
   11775           0 :     setsegorg(*splitsubseg, newvertex);
   11776           0 :     snextself(*splitsubseg);
   11777           0 :   } while (splitsubseg->ss != m->dummysub);
   11778             :   do {
   11779           0 :     setsegorg(opposubseg, newvertex);
   11780           0 :     snextself(opposubseg);
   11781           0 :   } while (opposubseg.ss != m->dummysub);
   11782             : 
   11783             :   /* Inserting the vertex may have caused edge flips.  We wish to rediscover */
   11784             :   /*   the edge connecting endpoint1 to the new intersection vertex.         */
   11785           0 :   collinear = finddirection(m, b, splittri, endpoint1);
   11786           0 :   dest(*splittri, rightvertex);
   11787           0 :   apex(*splittri, leftvertex);
   11788           0 :   if ((leftvertex[0] == endpoint1[0]) && (leftvertex[1] == endpoint1[1])) {
   11789           0 :     onextself(*splittri);
   11790           0 :   } else if ((rightvertex[0] != endpoint1[0]) ||
   11791           0 :              (rightvertex[1] != endpoint1[1])) {
   11792           0 :     printf("Internal error in segmentintersection():\n");
   11793           0 :     printf("  Topological inconsistency after splitting a segment.\n");
   11794           0 :     internalerror();
   11795             :   }
   11796             :   /* `splittri' should have destination endpoint1. */
   11797           0 : }
   11798             : 
   11799             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11800             : /*                                                                           */
   11801             : /*  scoutsegment()   Scout the first triangle on the path from one endpoint  */
   11802             : /*                   to another, and check for completion (reaching the      */
   11803             : /*                   second endpoint), a collinear vertex, or the            */
   11804             : /*                   intersection of two segments.                           */
   11805             : /*                                                                           */
   11806             : /*  Returns one if the entire segment is successfully inserted, and zero if  */
   11807             : /*  the job must be finished by conformingedge() or constrainededge().       */
   11808             : /*                                                                           */
   11809             : /*  If the first triangle on the path has the second endpoint as its         */
   11810             : /*  destination or apex, a subsegment is inserted and the job is done.       */
   11811             : /*                                                                           */
   11812             : /*  If the first triangle on the path has a destination or apex that lies on */
   11813             : /*  the segment, a subsegment is inserted connecting the first endpoint to   */
   11814             : /*  the collinear vertex, and the search is continued from the collinear     */
   11815             : /*  vertex.                                                                  */
   11816             : /*                                                                           */
   11817             : /*  If the first triangle on the path has a subsegment opposite its origin,  */
   11818             : /*  then there is a segment that intersects the segment being inserted.      */
   11819             : /*  Their intersection vertex is inserted, splitting the subsegment.         */
   11820             : /*                                                                           */
   11821             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11822             : 
   11823             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   11824             : int scoutsegment(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, struct otri *searchtri,
   11825             :                  vertex endpoint2, int newmark)
   11826             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11827           0 : int scoutsegment(m, b, searchtri, endpoint2, newmark)
   11828             : struct mesh *m;
   11829             : struct behavior *b;
   11830             : struct otri *searchtri;
   11831             : vertex endpoint2;
   11832             : int newmark;
   11833             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11834             : 
   11835             : {
   11836             :   struct otri crosstri;
   11837             :   struct osub crosssubseg;
   11838             :   vertex leftvertex, rightvertex;
   11839             :   enum finddirectionresult collinear;
   11840             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   11841             : 
   11842           0 :   collinear = finddirection(m, b, searchtri, endpoint2);
   11843           0 :   dest(*searchtri, rightvertex);
   11844           0 :   apex(*searchtri, leftvertex);
   11845           0 :   if (((leftvertex[0] == endpoint2[0]) && (leftvertex[1] == endpoint2[1])) ||
   11846           0 :       ((rightvertex[0] == endpoint2[0]) && (rightvertex[1] == endpoint2[1]))) {
   11847             :     /* The segment is already an edge in the mesh. */
   11848           0 :     if ((leftvertex[0] == endpoint2[0]) && (leftvertex[1] == endpoint2[1])) {
   11849           0 :       lprevself(*searchtri);
   11850             :     }
   11851             :     /* Insert a subsegment, if there isn't already one there. */
   11852           0 :     insertsubseg(m, b, searchtri, newmark);
   11853           0 :     return 1;
   11854           0 :   } else if (collinear == LEFTCOLLINEAR) {
   11855             :     /* We've collided with a vertex between the segment's endpoints. */
   11856             :     /* Make the collinear vertex be the triangle's origin. */
   11857           0 :     lprevself(*searchtri);
   11858           0 :     insertsubseg(m, b, searchtri, newmark);
   11859             :     /* Insert the remainder of the segment. */
   11860           0 :     return scoutsegment(m, b, searchtri, endpoint2, newmark);
   11861           0 :   } else if (collinear == RIGHTCOLLINEAR) {
   11862             :     /* We've collided with a vertex between the segment's endpoints. */
   11863           0 :     insertsubseg(m, b, searchtri, newmark);
   11864             :     /* Make the collinear vertex be the triangle's origin. */
   11865           0 :     lnextself(*searchtri);
   11866             :     /* Insert the remainder of the segment. */
   11867           0 :     return scoutsegment(m, b, searchtri, endpoint2, newmark);
   11868             :   } else {
   11869           0 :     lnext(*searchtri, crosstri);
   11870           0 :     tspivot(crosstri, crosssubseg);
   11871             :     /* Check for a crossing segment. */
   11872           0 :     if (crosssubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
   11873           0 :       return 0;
   11874             :     } else {
   11875             :       /* Insert a vertex at the intersection. */
   11876           0 :       segmentintersection(m, b, &crosstri, &crosssubseg, endpoint2);
   11877           0 :       otricopy(crosstri, *searchtri);
   11878           0 :       insertsubseg(m, b, searchtri, newmark);
   11879             :       /* Insert the remainder of the segment. */
   11880           0 :       return scoutsegment(m, b, searchtri, endpoint2, newmark);
   11881             :     }
   11882             :   }
   11883             : }
   11884             : 
   11885             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11886             : /*                                                                           */
   11887             : /*  conformingedge()   Force a segment into a conforming Delaunay            */
   11888             : /*                     triangulation by inserting a vertex at its midpoint,  */
   11889             : /*                     and recursively forcing in the two half-segments if   */
   11890             : /*                     necessary.                                            */
   11891             : /*                                                                           */
   11892             : /*  Generates a sequence of subsegments connecting `endpoint1' to            */
   11893             : /*  `endpoint2'.  `newmark' is the boundary marker of the segment, assigned  */
   11894             : /*  to each new splitting vertex and subsegment.                             */
   11895             : /*                                                                           */
   11896             : /*  Note that conformingedge() does not always maintain the conforming       */
   11897             : /*  Delaunay property.  Once inserted, segments are locked into place;       */
   11898             : /*  vertices inserted later (to force other segments in) may render these    */
   11899             : /*  fixed segments non-Delaunay.  The conforming Delaunay property will be   */
   11900             : /*  restored by enforcequality() by splitting encroached subsegments.        */
   11901             : /*                                                                           */
   11902             : /*****************************************************************************/
   11903             : 
   11904             : #ifndef REDUCED
   11905             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   11906             : 
   11907             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   11908             : void conformingedge(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   11909             :                     vertex endpoint1, vertex endpoint2, int newmark)
   11910             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11911           0 : void conformingedge(m, b, endpoint1, endpoint2, newmark)
   11912             : struct mesh *m;
   11913             : struct behavior *b;
   11914             : vertex endpoint1;
   11915             : vertex endpoint2;
   11916             : int newmark;
   11917             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   11918             : 
   11919             : {
   11920             :   struct otri searchtri1, searchtri2;
   11921             :   struct osub brokensubseg;
   11922             :   vertex newvertex;
   11923             :   vertex midvertex1, midvertex2;
   11924             :   enum insertvertexresult success;
   11925             :   int i;
   11926             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   11927             : 
   11928           0 :   if (b->verbose > 2) {
   11929           0 :     printf("Forcing segment into triangulation by recursive splitting:\n");
   11930           0 :     printf("  (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n", endpoint1[0], endpoint1[1],
   11931           0 :            endpoint2[0], endpoint2[1]);
   11932             :   }
   11933             :   /* Create a new vertex to insert in the middle of the segment. */
   11934           0 :   newvertex = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   11935             :   /* Interpolate coordinates and attributes. */
   11936           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   11937           0 :     newvertex[i] = 0.5 * (endpoint1[i] + endpoint2[i]);
   11938             :   }
   11939           0 :   setvertexmark(newvertex, newmark);
   11940           0 :   setvertextype(newvertex, SEGMENTVERTEX);
   11941             :   /* No known triangle to search from. */
   11942           0 :   searchtri1.tri = m->dummytri;
   11943             :   /* Attempt to insert the new vertex. */
   11944           0 :   success = insertvertex(m, b, newvertex, &searchtri1, (struct osub *) NULL,
   11945             :                          0, 0);
   11946           0 :   if (success == DUPLICATEVERTEX) {
   11947           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
   11948           0 :       printf("  Segment intersects existing vertex (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   11949           0 :              newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   11950             :     }
   11951             :     /* Use the vertex that's already there. */
   11952           0 :     vertexdealloc(m, newvertex);
   11953           0 :     org(searchtri1, newvertex);
   11954             :   } else {
   11955           0 :     if (success == VIOLATINGVERTEX) {
   11956           0 :       if (b->verbose > 2) {
   11957           0 :         printf("  Two segments intersect at (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   11958           0 :                newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   11959             :       }
   11960             :       /* By fluke, we've landed right on another segment.  Split it. */
   11961           0 :       tspivot(searchtri1, brokensubseg);
   11962           0 :       success = insertvertex(m, b, newvertex, &searchtri1, &brokensubseg,
   11963             :                              0, 0);
   11964           0 :       if (success != SUCCESSFULVERTEX) {
   11965           0 :         printf("Internal error in conformingedge():\n");
   11966           0 :         printf("  Failure to split a segment.\n");
   11967           0 :         internalerror();
   11968             :       }
   11969             :     }
   11970             :     /* The vertex has been inserted successfully. */
   11971           0 :     if (m->steinerleft > 0) {
   11972           0 :       m->steinerleft--;
   11973             :     }
   11974             :   }
   11975           0 :   otricopy(searchtri1, searchtri2);
   11976             :   /* `searchtri1' and `searchtri2' are fastened at their origins to         */
   11977             :   /*   `newvertex', and will be directed toward `endpoint1' and `endpoint2' */
   11978             :   /*   respectively.  First, we must get `searchtri2' out of the way so it  */
   11979             :   /*   won't be invalidated during the insertion of the first half of the   */
   11980             :   /*   segment.                                                             */
   11981           0 :   finddirection(m, b, &searchtri2, endpoint2);
   11982           0 :   if (!scoutsegment(m, b, &searchtri1, endpoint1, newmark)) {
   11983             :     /* The origin of searchtri1 may have changed if a collision with an */
   11984             :     /*   intervening vertex on the segment occurred.                    */
   11985           0 :     org(searchtri1, midvertex1);
   11986           0 :     conformingedge(m, b, midvertex1, endpoint1, newmark);
   11987             :   }
   11988           0 :   if (!scoutsegment(m, b, &searchtri2, endpoint2, newmark)) {
   11989             :     /* The origin of searchtri2 may have changed if a collision with an */
   11990             :     /*   intervening vertex on the segment occurred.                    */
   11991           0 :     org(searchtri2, midvertex2);
   11992           0 :     conformingedge(m, b, midvertex2, endpoint2, newmark);
   11993             :   }
   11994           0 : }
   11995             : 
   11996             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   11997             : #endif /* not REDUCED */
   11998             : 
   11999             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12000             : /*                                                                           */
   12001             : /*  delaunayfixup()   Enforce the Delaunay condition at an edge, fanning out */
   12002             : /*                    recursively from an existing vertex.  Pay special      */
   12003             : /*                    attention to stacking inverted triangles.              */
   12004             : /*                                                                           */
   12005             : /*  This is a support routine for inserting segments into a constrained      */
   12006             : /*  Delaunay triangulation.                                                  */
   12007             : /*                                                                           */
   12008             : /*  The origin of fixuptri is treated as if it has just been inserted, and   */
   12009             : /*  the local Delaunay condition needs to be enforced.  It is only enforced  */
   12010             : /*  in one sector, however, that being the angular range defined by          */
   12011             : /*  fixuptri.                                                                */
   12012             : /*                                                                           */
   12013             : /*  This routine also needs to make decisions regarding the "stacking" of    */
   12014             : /*  triangles.  (Read the description of constrainededge() below before      */
   12015             : /*  reading on here, so you understand the algorithm.)  If the position of   */
   12016             : /*  the new vertex (the origin of fixuptri) indicates that the vertex before */
   12017             : /*  it on the polygon is a reflex vertex, then "stack" the triangle by       */
   12018             : /*  doing nothing.  (fixuptri is an inverted triangle, which is how stacked  */
   12019             : /*  triangles are identified.)                                               */
   12020             : /*                                                                           */
   12021             : /*  Otherwise, check whether the vertex before that was a reflex vertex.     */
   12022             : /*  If so, perform an edge flip, thereby eliminating an inverted triangle    */
   12023             : /*  (popping it off the stack).  The edge flip may result in the creation    */
   12024             : /*  of a new inverted triangle, depending on whether or not the new vertex   */
   12025             : /*  is visible to the vertex three edges behind on the polygon.              */
   12026             : /*                                                                           */
   12027             : /*  If neither of the two vertices behind the new vertex are reflex          */
   12028             : /*  vertices, fixuptri and fartri, the triangle opposite it, are not         */
   12029             : /*  inverted; hence, ensure that the edge between them is locally Delaunay.  */
   12030             : /*                                                                           */
   12031             : /*  `leftside' indicates whether or not fixuptri is to the left of the       */
   12032             : /*  segment being inserted.  (Imagine that the segment is pointing up from   */
   12033             : /*  endpoint1 to endpoint2.)                                                 */
   12034             : /*                                                                           */
   12035             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12036             : 
   12037             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12038             : void delaunayfixup(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   12039             :                    struct otri *fixuptri, int leftside)
   12040             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12041           0 : void delaunayfixup(m, b, fixuptri, leftside)
   12042             : struct mesh *m;
   12043             : struct behavior *b;
   12044             : struct otri *fixuptri;
   12045             : int leftside;
   12046             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12047             : 
   12048             : {
   12049             :   struct otri neartri;
   12050             :   struct otri fartri;
   12051             :   struct osub faredge;
   12052             :   vertex nearvertex, leftvertex, rightvertex, farvertex;
   12053             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
   12054             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   12055             : 
   12056           0 :   lnext(*fixuptri, neartri);
   12057           0 :   sym(neartri, fartri);
   12058             :   /* Check if the edge opposite the origin of fixuptri can be flipped. */
   12059           0 :   if (fartri.tri == m->dummytri) {
   12060           0 :     return;
   12061             :   }
   12062           0 :   tspivot(neartri, faredge);
   12063           0 :   if (faredge.ss != m->dummysub) {
   12064           0 :     return;
   12065             :   }
   12066             :   /* Find all the relevant vertices. */
   12067           0 :   apex(neartri, nearvertex);
   12068           0 :   org(neartri, leftvertex);
   12069           0 :   dest(neartri, rightvertex);
   12070           0 :   apex(fartri, farvertex);
   12071             :   /* Check whether the previous polygon vertex is a reflex vertex. */
   12072           0 :   if (leftside) {
   12073           0 :     if (counterclockwise(m, b, nearvertex, leftvertex, farvertex) <= 0.0) {
   12074             :       /* leftvertex is a reflex vertex too.  Nothing can */
   12075             :       /*   be done until a convex section is found.      */
   12076           0 :       return;
   12077             :     }
   12078             :   } else {
   12079           0 :     if (counterclockwise(m, b, farvertex, rightvertex, nearvertex) <= 0.0) {
   12080             :       /* rightvertex is a reflex vertex too.  Nothing can */
   12081             :       /*   be done until a convex section is found.       */
   12082           0 :       return;
   12083             :     }
   12084             :   }
   12085           0 :   if (counterclockwise(m, b, rightvertex, leftvertex, farvertex) > 0.0) {
   12086             :     /* fartri is not an inverted triangle, and farvertex is not a reflex */
   12087             :     /*   vertex.  As there are no reflex vertices, fixuptri isn't an     */
   12088             :     /*   inverted triangle, either.  Hence, test the edge between the    */
   12089             :     /*   triangles to ensure it is locally Delaunay.                     */
   12090           0 :     if (incircle(m, b, leftvertex, farvertex, rightvertex, nearvertex) <=
   12091             :         0.0) {
   12092           0 :       return;
   12093             :     }
   12094             :     /* Not locally Delaunay; go on to an edge flip. */
   12095             :   }        /* else fartri is inverted; remove it from the stack by flipping. */
   12096           0 :   flip(m, b, &neartri);
   12097           0 :   lprevself(*fixuptri);    /* Restore the origin of fixuptri after the flip. */
   12098             :   /* Recursively process the two triangles that result from the flip. */
   12099           0 :   delaunayfixup(m, b, fixuptri, leftside);
   12100           0 :   delaunayfixup(m, b, &fartri, leftside);
   12101             : }
   12102             : 
   12103             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12104             : /*                                                                           */
   12105             : /*  constrainededge()   Force a segment into a constrained Delaunay          */
   12106             : /*                      triangulation by deleting the triangles it           */
   12107             : /*                      intersects, and triangulating the polygons that      */
   12108             : /*                      form on each side of it.                             */
   12109             : /*                                                                           */
   12110             : /*  Generates a single subsegment connecting `endpoint1' to `endpoint2'.     */
   12111             : /*  The triangle `starttri' has `endpoint1' as its origin.  `newmark' is the */
   12112             : /*  boundary marker of the segment.                                          */
   12113             : /*                                                                           */
   12114             : /*  To insert a segment, every triangle whose interior intersects the        */
   12115             : /*  segment is deleted.  The union of these deleted triangles is a polygon   */
   12116             : /*  (which is not necessarily monotone, but is close enough), which is       */
   12117             : /*  divided into two polygons by the new segment.  This routine's task is    */
   12118             : /*  to generate the Delaunay triangulation of these two polygons.            */
   12119             : /*                                                                           */
   12120             : /*  You might think of this routine's behavior as a two-step process.  The   */
   12121             : /*  first step is to walk from endpoint1 to endpoint2, flipping each edge    */
   12122             : /*  encountered.  This step creates a fan of edges connected to endpoint1,   */
   12123             : /*  including the desired edge to endpoint2.  The second step enforces the   */
   12124             : /*  Delaunay condition on each side of the segment in an incremental manner: */
   12125             : /*  proceeding along the polygon from endpoint1 to endpoint2 (this is done   */
   12126             : /*  independently on each side of the segment), each vertex is "enforced"    */
   12127             : /*  as if it had just been inserted, but affecting only the previous         */
   12128             : /*  vertices.  The result is the same as if the vertices had been inserted   */
   12129             : /*  in the order they appear on the polygon, so the result is Delaunay.      */
   12130             : /*                                                                           */
   12131             : /*  In truth, constrainededge() interleaves these two steps.  The procedure  */
   12132             : /*  walks from endpoint1 to endpoint2, and each time an edge is encountered  */
   12133             : /*  and flipped, the newly exposed vertex (at the far end of the flipped     */
   12134             : /*  edge) is "enforced" upon the previously flipped edges, usually affecting */
   12135             : /*  only one side of the polygon (depending upon which side of the segment   */
   12136             : /*  the vertex falls on).                                                    */
   12137             : /*                                                                           */
   12138             : /*  The algorithm is complicated by the need to handle polygons that are not */
   12139             : /*  convex.  Although the polygon is not necessarily monotone, it can be     */
   12140             : /*  triangulated in a manner similar to the stack-based algorithms for       */
   12141             : /*  monotone polygons.  For each reflex vertex (local concavity) of the      */
   12142             : /*  polygon, there will be an inverted triangle formed by one of the edge    */
   12143             : /*  flips.  (An inverted triangle is one with negative area - that is, its   */
   12144             : /*  vertices are arranged in clockwise order - and is best thought of as a   */
   12145             : /*  wrinkle in the fabric of the mesh.)  Each inverted triangle can be       */
   12146             : /*  thought of as a reflex vertex pushed on the stack, waiting to be fixed   */
   12147             : /*  later.                                                                   */
   12148             : /*                                                                           */
   12149             : /*  A reflex vertex is popped from the stack when a vertex is inserted that  */
   12150             : /*  is visible to the reflex vertex.  (However, if the vertex behind the     */
   12151             : /*  reflex vertex is not visible to the reflex vertex, a new inverted        */
   12152             : /*  triangle will take its place on the stack.)  These details are handled   */
   12153             : /*  by the delaunayfixup() routine above.                                    */
   12154             : /*                                                                           */
   12155             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12156             : 
   12157             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12158             : void constrainededge(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   12159             :                      struct otri *starttri, vertex endpoint2, int newmark)
   12160             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12161           0 : void constrainededge(m, b, starttri, endpoint2, newmark)
   12162             : struct mesh *m;
   12163             : struct behavior *b;
   12164             : struct otri *starttri;
   12165             : vertex endpoint2;
   12166             : int newmark;
   12167             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12168             : 
   12169             : {
   12170             :   struct otri fixuptri, fixuptri2;
   12171             :   struct osub crosssubseg;
   12172             :   vertex endpoint1;
   12173             :   vertex farvertex;
   12174             :   REAL area;
   12175             :   int collision;
   12176             :   int done;
   12177             :   triangle ptr;             /* Temporary variable used by sym() and oprev(). */
   12178             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   12179             : 
   12180           0 :   org(*starttri, endpoint1);
   12181           0 :   lnext(*starttri, fixuptri);
   12182           0 :   flip(m, b, &fixuptri);
   12183             :   /* `collision' indicates whether we have found a vertex directly */
   12184             :   /*   between endpoint1 and endpoint2.                            */
   12185           0 :   collision = 0;
   12186           0 :   done = 0;
   12187             :   do {
   12188           0 :     org(fixuptri, farvertex);
   12189             :     /* `farvertex' is the extreme point of the polygon we are "digging" */
   12190             :     /*   to get from endpoint1 to endpoint2.                           */
   12191           0 :     if ((farvertex[0] == endpoint2[0]) && (farvertex[1] == endpoint2[1])) {
   12192           0 :       oprev(fixuptri, fixuptri2);
   12193             :       /* Enforce the Delaunay condition around endpoint2. */
   12194           0 :       delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri, 0);
   12195           0 :       delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri2, 1);
   12196           0 :       done = 1;
   12197             :     } else {
   12198             :       /* Check whether farvertex is to the left or right of the segment */
   12199             :       /*   being inserted, to decide which edge of fixuptri to dig      */
   12200             :       /*   through next.                                                */
   12201           0 :       area = counterclockwise(m, b, endpoint1, endpoint2, farvertex);
   12202           0 :       if (area == 0.0) {
   12203             :         /* We've collided with a vertex between endpoint1 and endpoint2. */
   12204           0 :         collision = 1;
   12205           0 :         oprev(fixuptri, fixuptri2);
   12206             :         /* Enforce the Delaunay condition around farvertex. */
   12207           0 :         delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri, 0);
   12208           0 :         delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri2, 1);
   12209           0 :         done = 1;
   12210             :       } else {
   12211           0 :         if (area > 0.0) {        /* farvertex is to the left of the segment. */
   12212           0 :           oprev(fixuptri, fixuptri2);
   12213             :           /* Enforce the Delaunay condition around farvertex, on the */
   12214             :           /*   left side of the segment only.                        */
   12215           0 :           delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri2, 1);
   12216             :           /* Flip the edge that crosses the segment.  After the edge is */
   12217             :           /*   flipped, one of its endpoints is the fan vertex, and the */
   12218             :           /*   destination of fixuptri is the fan vertex.               */
   12219           0 :           lprevself(fixuptri);
   12220             :         } else {                /* farvertex is to the right of the segment. */
   12221           0 :           delaunayfixup(m, b, &fixuptri, 0);
   12222             :           /* Flip the edge that crosses the segment.  After the edge is */
   12223             :           /*   flipped, one of its endpoints is the fan vertex, and the */
   12224             :           /*   destination of fixuptri is the fan vertex.               */
   12225           0 :           oprevself(fixuptri);
   12226             :         }
   12227             :         /* Check for two intersecting segments. */
   12228           0 :         tspivot(fixuptri, crosssubseg);
   12229           0 :         if (crosssubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
   12230           0 :           flip(m, b, &fixuptri);    /* May create inverted triangle at left. */
   12231             :         } else {
   12232             :           /* We've collided with a segment between endpoint1 and endpoint2. */
   12233           0 :           collision = 1;
   12234             :           /* Insert a vertex at the intersection. */
   12235           0 :           segmentintersection(m, b, &fixuptri, &crosssubseg, endpoint2);
   12236           0 :           done = 1;
   12237             :         }
   12238             :       }
   12239             :     }
   12240           0 :   } while (!done);
   12241             :   /* Insert a subsegment to make the segment permanent. */
   12242           0 :   insertsubseg(m, b, &fixuptri, newmark);
   12243             :   /* If there was a collision with an interceding vertex, install another */
   12244             :   /*   segment connecting that vertex with endpoint2.                     */
   12245           0 :   if (collision) {
   12246             :     /* Insert the remainder of the segment. */
   12247           0 :     if (!scoutsegment(m, b, &fixuptri, endpoint2, newmark)) {
   12248           0 :       constrainededge(m, b, &fixuptri, endpoint2, newmark);
   12249             :     }
   12250             :   }
   12251           0 : }
   12252             : 
   12253             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12254             : /*                                                                           */
   12255             : /*  insertsegment()   Insert a PSLG segment into a triangulation.            */
   12256             : /*                                                                           */
   12257             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12258             : 
   12259             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12260             : void insertsegment(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   12261             :                    vertex endpoint1, vertex endpoint2, int newmark)
   12262             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12263           0 : void insertsegment(m, b, endpoint1, endpoint2, newmark)
   12264             : struct mesh *m;
   12265             : struct behavior *b;
   12266             : vertex endpoint1;
   12267             : vertex endpoint2;
   12268             : int newmark;
   12269             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12270             : 
   12271             : {
   12272             :   struct otri searchtri1, searchtri2;
   12273             :   triangle encodedtri;
   12274             :   vertex checkvertex;
   12275             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
   12276             : 
   12277           0 :   if (b->verbose > 1) {
   12278           0 :     printf("  Connecting (%.12g, %.12g) to (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   12279           0 :            endpoint1[0], endpoint1[1], endpoint2[0], endpoint2[1]);
   12280             :   }
   12281             : 
   12282             :   /* Find a triangle whose origin is the segment's first endpoint. */
   12283           0 :   checkvertex = (vertex) NULL;
   12284           0 :   encodedtri = vertex2tri(endpoint1);
   12285           0 :   if (encodedtri != (triangle) NULL) {
   12286           0 :     decode(encodedtri, searchtri1);
   12287           0 :     org(searchtri1, checkvertex);
   12288             :   }
   12289           0 :   if (checkvertex != endpoint1) {
   12290             :     /* Find a boundary triangle to search from. */
   12291           0 :     searchtri1.tri = m->dummytri;
   12292           0 :     searchtri1.orient = 0;
   12293           0 :     symself(searchtri1);
   12294             :     /* Search for the segment's first endpoint by point location. */
   12295           0 :     if (locate(m, b, endpoint1, &searchtri1) != ONVERTEX) {
   12296           0 :       printf(
   12297             :         "Internal error in insertsegment():  Unable to locate PSLG vertex\n");
   12298           0 :       printf("  (%.12g, %.12g) in triangulation.\n",
   12299           0 :              endpoint1[0], endpoint1[1]);
   12300           0 :       internalerror();
   12301             :     }
   12302             :   }
   12303             :   /* Remember this triangle to improve subsequent point location. */
   12304           0 :   otricopy(searchtri1, m->recenttri);
   12305             :   /* Scout the beginnings of a path from the first endpoint */
   12306             :   /*   toward the second.                                   */
   12307           0 :   if (scoutsegment(m, b, &searchtri1, endpoint2, newmark)) {
   12308             :     /* The segment was easily inserted. */
   12309           0 :     return;
   12310             :   }
   12311             :   /* The first endpoint may have changed if a collision with an intervening */
   12312             :   /*   vertex on the segment occurred.                                      */
   12313           0 :   org(searchtri1, endpoint1);
   12314             : 
   12315             :   /* Find a triangle whose origin is the segment's second endpoint. */
   12316           0 :   checkvertex = (vertex) NULL;
   12317           0 :   encodedtri = vertex2tri(endpoint2);
   12318           0 :   if (encodedtri != (triangle) NULL) {
   12319           0 :     decode(encodedtri, searchtri2);
   12320           0 :     org(searchtri2, checkvertex);
   12321             :   }
   12322           0 :   if (checkvertex != endpoint2) {
   12323             :     /* Find a boundary triangle to search from. */
   12324           0 :     searchtri2.tri = m->dummytri;
   12325           0 :     searchtri2.orient = 0;
   12326           0 :     symself(searchtri2);
   12327             :     /* Search for the segment's second endpoint by point location. */
   12328           0 :     if (locate(m, b, endpoint2, &searchtri2) != ONVERTEX) {
   12329           0 :       printf(
   12330             :         "Internal error in insertsegment():  Unable to locate PSLG vertex\n");
   12331           0 :       printf("  (%.12g, %.12g) in triangulation.\n",
   12332           0 :              endpoint2[0], endpoint2[1]);
   12333           0 :       internalerror();
   12334             :     }
   12335             :   }
   12336             :   /* Remember this triangle to improve subsequent point location. */
   12337           0 :   otricopy(searchtri2, m->recenttri);
   12338             :   /* Scout the beginnings of a path from the second endpoint */
   12339             :   /*   toward the first.                                     */
   12340           0 :   if (scoutsegment(m, b, &searchtri2, endpoint1, newmark)) {
   12341             :     /* The segment was easily inserted. */
   12342           0 :     return;
   12343             :   }
   12344             :   /* The second endpoint may have changed if a collision with an intervening */
   12345             :   /*   vertex on the segment occurred.                                       */
   12346           0 :   org(searchtri2, endpoint2);
   12347             : 
   12348             : #ifndef REDUCED
   12349             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   12350           0 :   if (b->splitseg) {
   12351             :     /* Insert vertices to force the segment into the triangulation. */
   12352           0 :     conformingedge(m, b, endpoint1, endpoint2, newmark);
   12353             :   } else {
   12354             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   12355             : #endif /* not REDUCED */
   12356             :     /* Insert the segment directly into the triangulation. */
   12357           0 :     constrainededge(m, b, &searchtri1, endpoint2, newmark);
   12358             : #ifndef REDUCED
   12359             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   12360             :   }
   12361             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   12362             : #endif /* not REDUCED */
   12363             : }
   12364             : 
   12365             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12366             : /*                                                                           */
   12367             : /*  markhull()   Cover the convex hull of a triangulation with subsegments.  */
   12368             : /*                                                                           */
   12369             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12370             : 
   12371             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12372             : void markhull(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   12373             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12374           0 : void markhull(m, b)
   12375             : struct mesh *m;
   12376             : struct behavior *b;
   12377             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12378             : 
   12379             : {
   12380             :   struct otri hulltri;
   12381             :   struct otri nexttri;
   12382             :   struct otri starttri;
   12383             :   triangle ptr;             /* Temporary variable used by sym() and oprev(). */
   12384             : 
   12385             :   /* Find a triangle handle on the hull. */
   12386           0 :   hulltri.tri = m->dummytri;
   12387           0 :   hulltri.orient = 0;
   12388           0 :   symself(hulltri);
   12389             :   /* Remember where we started so we know when to stop. */
   12390           0 :   otricopy(hulltri, starttri);
   12391             :   /* Go once counterclockwise around the convex hull. */
   12392             :   do {
   12393             :     /* Create a subsegment if there isn't already one here. */
   12394           0 :     insertsubseg(m, b, &hulltri, 1);
   12395             :     /* To find the next hull edge, go clockwise around the next vertex. */
   12396           0 :     lnextself(hulltri);
   12397           0 :     oprev(hulltri, nexttri);
   12398           0 :     while (nexttri.tri != m->dummytri) {
   12399           0 :       otricopy(nexttri, hulltri);
   12400           0 :       oprev(hulltri, nexttri);
   12401             :     }
   12402           0 :   } while (!otriequal(hulltri, starttri));
   12403           0 : }
   12404             : 
   12405             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12406             : /*                                                                           */
   12407             : /*  formskeleton()   Create the segments of a triangulation, including PSLG  */
   12408             : /*                   segments and edges on the convex hull.                  */
   12409             : /*                                                                           */
   12410             : /*  The PSLG segments are read from a .poly file.  The return value is the   */
   12411             : /*  number of segments in the file.                                          */
   12412             : /*                                                                           */
   12413             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12414             : 
   12415             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   12416             : 
   12417             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12418             : void formskeleton(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, int *segmentlist,
   12419             :                   int *segmentmarkerlist, int numberofsegments)
   12420             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12421           0 : void formskeleton(m, b, segmentlist, segmentmarkerlist, numberofsegments)
   12422             : struct mesh *m;
   12423             : struct behavior *b;
   12424             : int *segmentlist;
   12425             : int *segmentmarkerlist;
   12426             : int numberofsegments;
   12427             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12428             : 
   12429             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   12430             : 
   12431             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12432             : void formskeleton(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   12433             :                   FILE *polyfile, char *polyfilename)
   12434             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12435             : void formskeleton(m, b, polyfile, polyfilename)
   12436             : struct mesh *m;
   12437             : struct behavior *b;
   12438             : FILE *polyfile;
   12439             : char *polyfilename;
   12440             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12441             : 
   12442             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   12443             : 
   12444             : {
   12445             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   12446             :   char polyfilename[6];
   12447             :   int index;
   12448             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   12449             :   char inputline[INPUTLINESIZE];

   12451             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */

   12453             :   int segmentmarkers;
   12454             :   int end1, end2;
   12455             :   int boundmarker;

   12457             : 
   12458           0 :   if (b->poly) {
   12459           0 :     if (!b->quiet) {
   12460           0 :       printf("Recovering segments in Delaunay triangulation.\n");
   12461             :     }
   12462             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   12463           0 :     strcpy(polyfilename, "input");

   12465           0 :     segmentmarkers = segmentmarkerlist != (int *) NULL;
   12466           0 :     index = 0;

   12469             :     /* Read number of segments and number of boundary markers. */

   12477             :     }
   12478             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   12479             :     /* If the input vertices are collinear, there is no triangulation, */
   12480             :     /*   so don't try to insert segments.                              */
   12481           0 :     if (m->triangles.items == 0) {
   12482           0 :       return;
   12483             :     }
   12484             : 
   12485             :     /* If segments are to be inserted, compute a mapping */
   12486             :     /*   from vertices to triangles.                     */

   12488           0 :       makevertexmap(m, b);
   12489           0 :       if (b->verbose) {
   12490           0 :         printf("  Recovering PSLG segments.\n");
   12491             :       }
   12492             :     }
   12493             : 
   12494           0 :     boundmarker = 0;

   12509             :         triexit(1);
   12510             :       } else {
   12511             :         end1 = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   12512             :       }
   12513             :       stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   12514             :       if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   12515             :         printf("Error:  Segment %d is missing its second endpoint in %s.\n",
   12516             :                b->firstnumber + i, polyfilename);
   12517             :         triexit(1);
   12518             :       } else {
   12519             :         end2 = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   12520             :       }
   12521             :       if (segmentmarkers) {
   12522             :         stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   12523             :         if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   12524             :           boundmarker = 0;
   12525             :         } else {
   12526             :           boundmarker = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   12527             :         }
   12528             :       }
   12529             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   12530           0 :       if ((end1 < b->firstnumber) ||
   12531           0 :           (end1 >= b->firstnumber + m->invertices)) {
   12532           0 :         if (!b->quiet) {
   12533           0 :           printf("Warning:  Invalid first endpoint of segment %d in %s.\n",
   12534           0 :                  b->firstnumber + i, polyfilename);
   12535             :         }
   12536           0 :       } else if ((end2 < b->firstnumber) ||
   12537           0 :                  (end2 >= b->firstnumber + m->invertices)) {
   12538           0 :         if (!b->quiet) {
   12539           0 :           printf("Warning:  Invalid second endpoint of segment %d in %s.\n",

   12541             :         }
   12542             :       } else {
   12543             :         /* Find the vertices numbered `end1' and `end2'. */
   12544           0 :         endpoint1 = getvertex(m, b, end1);
   12545           0 :         endpoint2 = getvertex(m, b, end2);

   12548           0 :             printf("Warning:  Endpoints of segment %d are coincident in %s.\n",
   12549           0 :                    b->firstnumber + i, polyfilename);
   12550             :           }
   12551             :         } else {
   12552           0 :           insertsegment(m, b, endpoint1, endpoint2, boundmarker);
   12553             :         }
   12554             :       }
   12555             :     }
   12556             :   } else {
   12557           0 :     m->insegments = 0;
   12558             :   }
   12559           0 :   if (b->convex || !b->poly) {
   12560             :     /* Enclose the convex hull with subsegments. */
   12561           0 :     if (b->verbose) {
   12562           0 :       printf("  Enclosing convex hull with segments.\n");
   12563             :     }
   12564           0 :     markhull(m, b);
   12565             :   }
   12566             : }
   12567             : 
   12568             : /**                                                                         **/
   12569             : /**                                                                         **/
   12570             : /********* Segment insertion ends here                               *********/
   12571             : 
   12572             : /********* Carving out holes and concavities begins here             *********/
   12573             : /**                                                                         **/
   12574             : /**                                                                         **/
   12575             : 
   12576             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12577             : /*                                                                           */
   12578             : /*  infecthull()   Virally infect all of the triangles of the convex hull    */
   12579             : /*                 that are not protected by subsegments.  Where there are   */
   12580             : /*                 subsegments, set boundary markers as appropriate.         */
   12581             : /*                                                                           */
   12582             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12583             : 
   12584             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12585             : void infecthull(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   12586             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12587           0 : void infecthull(m, b)
   12588             : struct mesh *m;
   12589             : struct behavior *b;
   12590             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12591             : 
   12592             : {
   12593             :   struct otri hulltri;
   12594             :   struct otri nexttri;
   12595             :   struct otri starttri;
   12596             :   struct osub hullsubseg;
   12597             :   triangle **deadtriangle;
   12598             :   vertex horg, hdest;
   12599             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
   12600             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   12601             : 
   12602           0 :   if (b->verbose) {
   12603           0 :     printf("  Marking concavities (external triangles) for elimination.\n");
   12604             :   }
   12605             :   /* Find a triangle handle on the hull. */
   12606           0 :   hulltri.tri = m->dummytri;
   12607           0 :   hulltri.orient = 0;
   12608           0 :   symself(hulltri);
   12609             :   /* Remember where we started so we know when to stop. */
   12610           0 :   otricopy(hulltri, starttri);
   12611             :   /* Go once counterclockwise around the convex hull. */
   12612             :   do {
   12613             :     /* Ignore triangles that are already infected. */
   12614           0 :     if (!infected(hulltri)) {
   12615             :       /* Is the triangle protected by a subsegment? */
   12616           0 :       tspivot(hulltri, hullsubseg);

   12618             :         /* The triangle is not protected; infect it. */

   12620           0 :           infect(hulltri);
   12621           0 :           deadtriangle = (triangle **) poolalloc(&m->viri);
   12622           0 :           *deadtriangle = hulltri.tri;
   12623             :         }

   12625             :         /* The triangle is protected; set boundary markers if appropriate. */
   12626           0 :         if (mark(hullsubseg) == 0) {
   12627           0 :           setmark(hullsubseg, 1);
   12628           0 :           org(hulltri, horg);

   12631           0 :             setvertexmark(horg, 1);
   12632             :           }
