   12634           0 :             setvertexmark(hdest, 1);
   12635             :           }
   12636             :         }
   12637             :       }
   12638             :     }
   12639             :     /* To find the next hull edge, go clockwise around the next vertex. */
   12640           0 :     lnextself(hulltri);
   12641           0 :     oprev(hulltri, nexttri);
   12642           0 :     while (nexttri.tri != m->dummytri) {
   12643           0 :       otricopy(nexttri, hulltri);
   12644           0 :       oprev(hulltri, nexttri);
   12645             :     }
   12646           0 :   } while (!otriequal(hulltri, starttri));
   12647           0 : }
   12648             : 
   12649             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12650             : /*                                                                           */
   12651             : /*  plague()   Spread the virus from all infected triangles to any neighbors */
   12652             : /*             not protected by subsegments.  Delete all infected triangles. */
   12653             : /*                                                                           */
   12654             : /*  This is the procedure that actually creates holes and concavities.       */
   12655             : /*                                                                           */
   12656             : /*  This procedure operates in two phases.  The first phase identifies all   */
   12657             : /*  the triangles that will die, and marks them as infected.  They are       */
   12658             : /*  marked to ensure that each triangle is added to the virus pool only      */
   12659             : /*  once, so the procedure will terminate.                                   */
   12660             : /*                                                                           */
   12661             : /*  The second phase actually eliminates the infected triangles.  It also    */
   12662             : /*  eliminates orphaned vertices.                                            */
   12663             : /*                                                                           */
   12664             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12665             : 
   12666             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12667             : void plague(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   12668             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12669           0 : void plague(m, b)
   12670             : struct mesh *m;
   12671             : struct behavior *b;
   12672             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12673             : 
   12674             : {
   12675             :   struct otri testtri;
   12676             :   struct otri neighbor;
   12677             :   triangle **virusloop;
   12678             :   triangle **deadtriangle;
   12679             :   struct osub neighborsubseg;
   12680             :   vertex testvertex;
   12681             :   vertex norg, ndest;
   12682             :   vertex deadorg, deaddest, deadapex;
   12683             :   int killorg;
   12684             :   triangle ptr;             /* Temporary variable used by sym() and onext(). */
   12685             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   12686             : 
   12687           0 :   if (b->verbose) {
   12688           0 :     printf("  Marking neighbors of marked triangles.\n");
   12689             :   }
   12690             :   /* Loop through all the infected triangles, spreading the virus to */
   12691             :   /*   their neighbors, then to their neighbors' neighbors.          */
   12692           0 :   traversalinit(&m->viri);
   12693           0 :   virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12694           0 :   while (virusloop != (triangle **) NULL) {
   12695           0 :     testtri.tri = *virusloop;
   12696             :     /* A triangle is marked as infected by messing with one of its pointers */
   12697             :     /*   to subsegments, setting it to an illegal value.  Hence, we have to */
   12698             :     /*   temporarily uninfect this triangle so that we can examine its      */
   12699             :     /*   adjacent subsegments.                                              */
   12700           0 :     uninfect(testtri);
   12701           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
   12702             :       /* Assign the triangle an orientation for convenience in */
   12703             :       /*   checking its vertices.                              */
   12704           0 :       testtri.orient = 0;
   12705           0 :       org(testtri, deadorg);
   12706           0 :       dest(testtri, deaddest);
   12707           0 :       apex(testtri, deadapex);
   12708           0 :       printf("    Checking (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
   12709           0 :              deadorg[0], deadorg[1], deaddest[0], deaddest[1],
   12710           0 :              deadapex[0], deadapex[1]);
   12711             :     }
   12712             :     /* Check each of the triangle's three neighbors. */
   12713           0 :     for (testtri.orient = 0; testtri.orient < 3; testtri.orient++) {
   12714             :       /* Find the neighbor. */
   12715           0 :       sym(testtri, neighbor);
   12716             :       /* Check for a subsegment between the triangle and its neighbor. */
   12717           0 :       tspivot(testtri, neighborsubseg);
   12718             :       /* Check if the neighbor is nonexistent or already infected. */
   12719           0 :       if ((neighbor.tri == m->dummytri) || infected(neighbor)) {
   12720           0 :         if (neighborsubseg.ss != m->dummysub) {
   12721             :           /* There is a subsegment separating the triangle from its      */
   12722             :           /*   neighbor, but both triangles are dying, so the subsegment */
   12723             :           /*   dies too.                                                 */
   12724           0 :           subsegdealloc(m, neighborsubseg.ss);
   12725           0 :           if (neighbor.tri != m->dummytri) {
   12726             :             /* Make sure the subsegment doesn't get deallocated again */
   12727             :             /*   later when the infected neighbor is visited.         */
   12728           0 :             uninfect(neighbor);
   12729           0 :             tsdissolve(neighbor);
   12730           0 :             infect(neighbor);
   12731             :           }
   12732             :         }
   12733             :       } else {                   /* The neighbor exists and is not infected. */
   12734           0 :         if (neighborsubseg.ss == m->dummysub) {
   12735             :           /* There is no subsegment protecting the neighbor, so */
   12736             :           /*   the neighbor becomes infected.                   */
   12737           0 :           if (b->verbose > 2) {
   12738           0 :             org(neighbor, deadorg);
   12739           0 :             dest(neighbor, deaddest);
   12740           0 :             apex(neighbor, deadapex);
   12741           0 :             printf(
   12742             :               "    Marking (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
   12743           0 :                    deadorg[0], deadorg[1], deaddest[0], deaddest[1],
   12744           0 :                    deadapex[0], deadapex[1]);
   12745             :           }
   12746           0 :           infect(neighbor);
   12747             :           /* Ensure that the neighbor's neighbors will be infected. */
   12748           0 :           deadtriangle = (triangle **) poolalloc(&m->viri);
   12749           0 :           *deadtriangle = neighbor.tri;
   12750             :         } else {               /* The neighbor is protected by a subsegment. */
   12751             :           /* Remove this triangle from the subsegment. */
   12752           0 :           stdissolve(neighborsubseg);
   12753             :           /* The subsegment becomes a boundary.  Set markers accordingly. */
   12754           0 :           if (mark(neighborsubseg) == 0) {
   12755           0 :             setmark(neighborsubseg, 1);
   12756             :           }
   12757           0 :           org(neighbor, norg);
   12758           0 :           dest(neighbor, ndest);
   12759           0 :           if (vertexmark(norg) == 0) {
   12760           0 :             setvertexmark(norg, 1);
   12761             :           }
   12762           0 :           if (vertexmark(ndest) == 0) {
   12763           0 :             setvertexmark(ndest, 1);
   12764             :           }
   12765             :         }
   12766             :       }
   12767             :     }
   12768             :     /* Remark the triangle as infected, so it doesn't get added to the */
   12769             :     /*   virus pool again.                                             */
   12770           0 :     infect(testtri);
   12771           0 :     virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12772             :   }
   12773             : 
   12774           0 :   if (b->verbose) {
   12775           0 :     printf("  Deleting marked triangles.\n");
   12776             :   }
   12777             : 
   12778           0 :   traversalinit(&m->viri);
   12779           0 :   virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12780           0 :   while (virusloop != (triangle **) NULL) {
   12781           0 :     testtri.tri = *virusloop;
   12782             : 
   12783             :     /* Check each of the three corners of the triangle for elimination. */
   12784             :     /*   This is done by walking around each vertex, checking if it is  */
   12785             :     /*   still connected to at least one live triangle.                 */
   12786           0 :     for (testtri.orient = 0; testtri.orient < 3; testtri.orient++) {
   12787           0 :       org(testtri, testvertex);
   12788             :       /* Check if the vertex has already been tested. */
   12789           0 :       if (testvertex != (vertex) NULL) {
   12790           0 :         killorg = 1;
   12791             :         /* Mark the corner of the triangle as having been tested. */
   12792           0 :         setorg(testtri, NULL);
   12793             :         /* Walk counterclockwise about the vertex. */
   12794           0 :         onext(testtri, neighbor);
   12795             :         /* Stop upon reaching a boundary or the starting triangle. */
   12796           0 :         while ((neighbor.tri != m->dummytri) &&
   12797           0 :                (!otriequal(neighbor, testtri))) {
   12798           0 :           if (infected(neighbor)) {
   12799             :             /* Mark the corner of this triangle as having been tested. */
   12800           0 :             setorg(neighbor, NULL);
   12801             :           } else {
   12802             :             /* A live triangle.  The vertex survives. */
   12803           0 :             killorg = 0;
   12804             :           }
   12805             :           /* Walk counterclockwise about the vertex. */
   12806           0 :           onextself(neighbor);
   12807             :         }
   12808             :         /* If we reached a boundary, we must walk clockwise as well. */
   12809           0 :         if (neighbor.tri == m->dummytri) {
   12810             :           /* Walk clockwise about the vertex. */
   12811           0 :           oprev(testtri, neighbor);
   12812             :           /* Stop upon reaching a boundary. */
   12813           0 :           while (neighbor.tri != m->dummytri) {
   12814           0 :             if (infected(neighbor)) {
   12815             :             /* Mark the corner of this triangle as having been tested. */
   12816           0 :               setorg(neighbor, NULL);
   12817             :             } else {
   12818             :               /* A live triangle.  The vertex survives. */
   12819           0 :               killorg = 0;
   12820             :             }
   12821             :             /* Walk clockwise about the vertex. */
   12822           0 :             oprevself(neighbor);
   12823             :           }
   12824             :         }
   12825           0 :         if (killorg) {
   12826           0 :           if (b->verbose > 1) {
   12827           0 :             printf("    Deleting vertex (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
   12828           0 :                    testvertex[0], testvertex[1]);
   12829             :           }
   12830           0 :           setvertextype(testvertex, UNDEADVERTEX);
   12831           0 :           m->undeads++;
   12832             :         }
   12833             :       }
   12834             :     }
   12835             : 
   12836             :     /* Record changes in the number of boundary edges, and disconnect */
   12837             :     /*   dead triangles from their neighbors.                         */
   12838           0 :     for (testtri.orient = 0; testtri.orient < 3; testtri.orient++) {
   12839           0 :       sym(testtri, neighbor);
   12840           0 :       if (neighbor.tri == m->dummytri) {
   12841             :         /* There is no neighboring triangle on this edge, so this edge    */
   12842             :         /*   is a boundary edge.  This triangle is being deleted, so this */
   12843             :         /*   boundary edge is deleted.                                    */
   12844           0 :         m->hullsize--;
   12845             :       } else {
   12846             :         /* Disconnect the triangle from its neighbor. */
   12847           0 :         dissolve(neighbor);
   12848             :         /* There is a neighboring triangle on this edge, so this edge */
   12849             :         /*   becomes a boundary edge when this triangle is deleted.   */
   12850           0 :         m->hullsize++;
   12851             :       }
   12852             :     }
   12853             :     /* Return the dead triangle to the pool of triangles. */
   12854           0 :     triangledealloc(m, testtri.tri);
   12855           0 :     virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12856             :   }
   12857             :   /* Empty the virus pool. */
   12858           0 :   poolrestart(&m->viri);
   12859           0 : }
   12860             : 
   12861             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12862             : /*                                                                           */
   12863             : /*  regionplague()   Spread regional attributes and/or area constraints      */
   12864             : /*                   (from a .poly file) throughout the mesh.                */
   12865             : /*                                                                           */
   12866             : /*  This procedure operates in two phases.  The first phase spreads an       */
   12867             : /*  attribute and/or an area constraint through a (segment-bounded) region.  */
   12868             : /*  The triangles are marked to ensure that each triangle is added to the    */
   12869             : /*  virus pool only once, so the procedure will terminate.                   */
   12870             : /*                                                                           */
   12871             : /*  The second phase uninfects all infected triangles, returning them to     */
   12872             : /*  normal.                                                                  */
   12873             : /*                                                                           */
   12874             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12875             : 
   12876             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12877             : void regionplague(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   12878             :                   REAL attribute, REAL area)
   12879             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12880           0 : void regionplague(m, b, attribute, area)
   12881             : struct mesh *m;
   12882             : struct behavior *b;
   12883             : REAL attribute;
   12884             : REAL area;
   12885             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   12886             : 
   12887             : {
   12888             :   struct otri testtri;
   12889             :   struct otri neighbor;
   12890             :   triangle **virusloop;
   12891             :   triangle **regiontri;
   12892             :   struct osub neighborsubseg;
   12893             :   vertex regionorg, regiondest, regionapex;
   12894             :   triangle ptr;             /* Temporary variable used by sym() and onext(). */
   12895             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   12896             : 
   12897           0 :   if (b->verbose > 1) {
   12898           0 :     printf("  Marking neighbors of marked triangles.\n");
   12899             :   }
   12900             :   /* Loop through all the infected triangles, spreading the attribute      */
   12901             :   /*   and/or area constraint to their neighbors, then to their neighbors' */
   12902             :   /*   neighbors.                                                          */
   12903           0 :   traversalinit(&m->viri);
   12904           0 :   virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12905           0 :   while (virusloop != (triangle **) NULL) {
   12906           0 :     testtri.tri = *virusloop;
   12907             :     /* A triangle is marked as infected by messing with one of its pointers */
   12908             :     /*   to subsegments, setting it to an illegal value.  Hence, we have to */
   12909             :     /*   temporarily uninfect this triangle so that we can examine its      */
   12910             :     /*   adjacent subsegments.                                              */
   12911           0 :     uninfect(testtri);
   12912           0 :     if (b->regionattrib) {
   12913             :       /* Set an attribute. */
   12914           0 :       setelemattribute(testtri, m->eextras, attribute);
   12915             :     }
   12916           0 :     if (b->vararea) {
   12917             :       /* Set an area constraint. */
   12918           0 :       setareabound(testtri, area);
   12919             :     }
   12920           0 :     if (b->verbose > 2) {
   12921             :       /* Assign the triangle an orientation for convenience in */
   12922             :       /*   checking its vertices.                              */
   12923           0 :       testtri.orient = 0;
   12924           0 :       org(testtri, regionorg);
   12925           0 :       dest(testtri, regiondest);
   12926           0 :       apex(testtri, regionapex);
   12927           0 :       printf("    Checking (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g)\n",
   12928           0 :              regionorg[0], regionorg[1], regiondest[0], regiondest[1],
   12929           0 :              regionapex[0], regionapex[1]);
   12930             :     }
   12931             :     /* Check each of the triangle's three neighbors. */
   12932           0 :     for (testtri.orient = 0; testtri.orient < 3; testtri.orient++) {
   12933             :       /* Find the neighbor. */
   12934           0 :       sym(testtri, neighbor);
   12935             :       /* Check for a subsegment between the triangle and its neighbor. */
   12936           0 :       tspivot(testtri, neighborsubseg);

   12938             :       /*   isn't protected by a subsegment.                          */

   12944           0 :           apex(neighbor, regionapex);

   12947           0 :                  regionapex[0], regionapex[1]);
   12948             :         }

   12950           0 :         infect(neighbor);
   12951             :         /* Ensure that the neighbor's neighbors will be infected. */
   12952           0 :         regiontri = (triangle **) poolalloc(&m->viri);
   12953           0 :         *regiontri = neighbor.tri;
   12954             :       }
   12955             :     }
   12956             :     /* Remark the triangle as infected, so it doesn't get added to the */
   12957             :     /*   virus pool again.                                             */

   12960             :   }
   12961             :

   12964           0 :     printf("  Unmarking marked triangles.\n");

   12970           0 :     uninfect(testtri);
   12971           0 :     virusloop = (triangle **) traverse(&m->viri);
   12972             :   }
   12973             :   /* Empty the virus pool. */
   12974           0 :   poolrestart(&m->viri);
   12975           0 : }
   12976             : 
   12977             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12978             : /*                                                                           */
   12979             : /*  carveholes()   Find the holes and infect them.  Find the area            */
   12980             : /*                 constraints and infect them.  Infect the convex hull.     */
   12981             : /*                 Spread the infection and kill triangles.  Spread the      */
   12982             : /*                 area constraints.                                         */
   12983             : /*                                                                           */
   12984             : /*  This routine mainly calls other routines to carry out all these          */
   12985             : /*  functions.                                                               */
   12986             : /*                                                                           */
   12987             : /*****************************************************************************/
   12988             : 
   12989             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   12990             : void carveholes(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, REAL *holelist, int holes,

   12992             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */

   13002             : {

   13012             :

   13015           0 :     if (b->verbose && (holes > 0)) {

   13046             :         /* Start searching from some triangle on the outer boundary. */

   13051             :         /*   otherwise, locate() will falsely report that the hole    */

   13070             : 
   13071             :   /* Now, we have to find all the regions BEFORE we carve the holes, because */
   13072             :   /*   locate() won't work when the triangulation is no longer convex.       */

   13074             :   /*   constraints can't be used when refining a preexisting mesh, which     */
   13075             :   /*   might not be convex; they can only be used with a freshly             */

   13107             : 
   13108           0 :   if (m->viri.items > 0) {
   13109             :     /* Carve the holes and concavities. */
   13110           0 :     plague(m, b);
   13111             :   }
   13112             :   /* The virus pool should be empty now. */
   13113             : 
   13114           0 :   if (regions > 0) {
   13115           0 :     if (!b->quiet) {
   13116           0 :       if (b->regionattrib) {

   13127             :       /* Assign every triangle a regional attribute of zero. */

   13134             :       }

   13137           0 :       if (regiontris[i].tri != m->dummytri) {
   13138             :         /* Make sure the triangle under consideration still exists. */
   13139             :         /*   It may have been eaten by the virus.                   */
   13140           0 :         if (!deadtri(regiontris[i].tri)) {
   13141             :           /* Put one triangle in the virus pool. */
   13142           0 :           infect(regiontris[i]);

   13145             :           /* Apply one region's attribute and/or area constraint. */

   13149             :       }
   13150             :     }
   13151           0 :     if (b->regionattrib && !b->refine) {
   13152             :       /* Note the fact that each triangle has an additional attribute. */
   13153           0 :       m->eextras++;

   13155             :   }
   13156             : 
   13157             :   /* Free up memory. */

   13159           0 :     pooldeinit(&m->viri);
   13160             :   }

   13162           0 :     trifree((VOID *) regiontris);

   13165             : 
   13166             : /**                                                                         **/
   13167             : /**                                                                         **/
   13168             : /********* Carving out holes and concavities ends here               *********/
   13169             : 
   13170             : /********* Mesh quality maintenance begins here                      *********/
   13171             : /**                                                                         **/
   13172             : /**                                                                         **/
   13173             : 
   13174             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13175             : /*                                                                           */
   13176             : /*  tallyencs()   Traverse the entire list of subsegments, and check each    */
   13177             : /*                to see if it is encroached.  If so, add it to the list.    */
   13178             : /*                                                                           */
   13179             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13180             : 
   13181             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   13182             : 
   13183             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS

   13207             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13208             : /*                                                                           */
   13209             : /*  precisionerror()  Print an error message for precision problems.         */
   13210             : /*                                                                           */
   13211             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13212             : 
   13213             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   13214             : 
   13215           0 : void precisionerror()
   13216             : {
   13217           0 :   printf("Try increasing the area criterion and/or reducing the minimum\n");
   13218           0 :   printf("  allowable angle so that tiny triangles are not created.\n");
   13219             : #ifdef SINGLE
   13220             :   printf("Alternatively, try recompiling me with double precision\n");
   13221             :   printf("  arithmetic (by removing \"#define SINGLE\" from the\n");
   13222             :   printf("  source file or \"-DSINGLE\" from the makefile).\n");
   13223             : #endif /* SINGLE */
   13224           0 : }
   13225             : 
   13226             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   13227             : 
   13228             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13229             : /*                                                                           */
   13230             : /*  splitencsegs()   Split all the encroached subsegments.                   */
   13231             : /*                                                                           */
   13232             : /*  Each encroached subsegment is repaired by splitting it - inserting a     */
   13233             : /*  vertex at or near its midpoint.  Newly inserted vertices may encroach    */
   13234             : /*  upon other subsegments; these are also repaired.                         */
   13235             : /*                                                                           */
   13236             : /*  `triflaws' is a flag that specifies whether one should take note of new  */
   13237             : /*  bad triangles that result from inserting vertices to repair encroached   */
   13238             : /*  subsegments.                                                             */
   13239             : /*                                                                           */
   13240             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13241             : 
   13242             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   13243             : 
   13244             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   13245             : void splitencsegs(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, int triflaws)
   13246             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13247           0 : void splitencsegs(m, b, triflaws)
   13248             : struct mesh *m;
   13249             : struct behavior *b;
   13250             : int triflaws;
   13251             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13252             : 
   13253             : {
   13254             :   struct otri enctri;
   13255             :   struct otri testtri;
   13256             :   struct osub testsh;
   13257             :   struct osub currentenc;
   13258             :   struct badsubseg *encloop;
   13259             :   vertex eorg, edest, eapex;
   13260             :   vertex newvertex;
   13261             :   enum insertvertexresult success;
   13262             :   REAL segmentlength, nearestpoweroftwo;
   13263             :   REAL split;
   13264             :   REAL multiplier, divisor;
   13265             :   int acuteorg, acuteorg2, acutedest, acutedest2;
   13266             :   int dummy;
   13267             :   int i;
   13268             :   triangle ptr;                     /* Temporary variable used by stpivot(). */
   13269             :   subseg sptr;                        /* Temporary variable used by snext(). */
   13270             : 
   13271             :   /* Note that steinerleft == -1 if an unlimited number */
   13272             :   /*   of Steiner points is allowed.                    */
   13273           0 :   while ((m->badsubsegs.items > 0) && (m->steinerleft != 0)) {
   13274           0 :     traversalinit(&m->badsubsegs);
   13275           0 :     encloop = badsubsegtraverse(m);
   13276           0 :     while ((encloop != (struct badsubseg *) NULL) && (m->steinerleft != 0)) {
   13277           0 :       sdecode(encloop->encsubseg, currentenc);
   13278           0 :       sorg(currentenc, eorg);
   13279           0 :       sdest(currentenc, edest);
   13280             :       /* Make sure that this segment is still the same segment it was   */
   13281             :       /*   when it was determined to be encroached.  If the segment was */
   13282             :       /*   enqueued multiple times (because several newly inserted      */
   13283             :       /*   vertices encroached it), it may have already been split.     */
   13284           0 :       if (!deadsubseg(currentenc.ss) &&
   13285           0 :           (eorg == encloop->subsegorg) && (edest == encloop->subsegdest)) {
   13286             :         /* To decide where to split a segment, we need to know if the   */
   13287             :         /*   segment shares an endpoint with an adjacent segment.       */
   13288             :         /*   The concern is that, if we simply split every encroached   */
   13289             :         /*   segment in its center, two adjacent segments with a small  */
   13290             :         /*   angle between them might lead to an infinite loop; each    */
   13291             :         /*   vertex added to split one segment will encroach upon the   */
   13292             :         /*   other segment, which must then be split with a vertex that */
   13293             :         /*   will encroach upon the first segment, and so on forever.   */
   13294             :         /* To avoid this, imagine a set of concentric circles, whose    */
   13295             :         /*   radii are powers of two, about each segment endpoint.      */
   13296             :         /*   These concentric circles determine where the segment is    */
   13297             :         /*   split.  (If both endpoints are shared with adjacent        */
   13298             :         /*   segments, split the segment in the middle, and apply the   */
   13299             :         /*   concentric circles for later splittings.)                  */
   13300             : 
   13301             :         /* Is the origin shared with another segment? */
   13302           0 :         stpivot(currentenc, enctri);
   13303           0 :         lnext(enctri, testtri);
   13304           0 :         tspivot(testtri, testsh);
   13305           0 :         acuteorg = testsh.ss != m->dummysub;
   13306             :         /* Is the destination shared with another segment? */
   13307           0 :         lnextself(testtri);
   13308           0 :         tspivot(testtri, testsh);
   13309           0 :         acutedest = testsh.ss != m->dummysub;
   13310             : 
   13311             :         /* If we're using Chew's algorithm (rather than Ruppert's) */
   13312             :         /*   to define encroachment, delete free vertices from the */
   13313             :         /*   subsegment's diametral circle.                        */
   13314           0 :         if (!b->conformdel && !acuteorg && !acutedest) {
   13315           0 :           apex(enctri, eapex);
   13316           0 :           while ((vertextype(eapex) == FREEVERTEX) &&
   13317           0 :                  ((eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
   13318           0 :                   (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1]) < 0.0)) {
   13319           0 :             deletevertex(m, b, &testtri);
   13320           0 :             stpivot(currentenc, enctri);
   13321           0 :             apex(enctri, eapex);
   13322           0 :             lprev(enctri, testtri);
   13323             :           }
   13324             :         }
   13325             : 
   13326             :         /* Now, check the other side of the segment, if there's a triangle */
   13327             :         /*   there.                                                        */
   13328           0 :         sym(enctri, testtri);
   13329           0 :         if (testtri.tri != m->dummytri) {
   13330             :           /* Is the destination shared with another segment? */
   13331           0 :           lnextself(testtri);
   13332           0 :           tspivot(testtri, testsh);
   13333           0 :           acutedest2 = testsh.ss != m->dummysub;
   13334           0 :           acutedest = acutedest || acutedest2;
   13335             :           /* Is the origin shared with another segment? */
   13336           0 :           lnextself(testtri);
   13337           0 :           tspivot(testtri, testsh);
   13338           0 :           acuteorg2 = testsh.ss != m->dummysub;
   13339           0 :           acuteorg = acuteorg || acuteorg2;
   13340             : 
   13341             :           /* Delete free vertices from the subsegment's diametral circle. */
   13342           0 :           if (!b->conformdel && !acuteorg2 && !acutedest2) {
   13343           0 :             org(testtri, eapex);
   13344           0 :             while ((vertextype(eapex) == FREEVERTEX) &&
   13345           0 :                    ((eorg[0] - eapex[0]) * (edest[0] - eapex[0]) +
   13346           0 :                     (eorg[1] - eapex[1]) * (edest[1] - eapex[1]) < 0.0)) {
   13347           0 :               deletevertex(m, b, &testtri);
   13348           0 :               sym(enctri, testtri);
   13349           0 :               apex(testtri, eapex);
   13350           0 :               lprevself(testtri);
   13351             :             }
   13352             :           }
   13353             :         }
   13354             : 
   13355             :         /* Use the concentric circles if exactly one endpoint is shared */
   13356             :         /*   with another adjacent segment.                             */
   13357           0 :         if (acuteorg || acutedest) {
   13358           0 :           segmentlength = sqrt((edest[0] - eorg[0]) * (edest[0] - eorg[0]) +
   13359           0 :                                (edest[1] - eorg[1]) * (edest[1] - eorg[1]));
   13360             :           /* Find the power of two that most evenly splits the segment.  */
   13361             :           /*   The worst case is a 2:1 ratio between subsegment lengths. */
   13362           0 :           nearestpoweroftwo = 1.0;
   13363           0 :           while (segmentlength > 3.0 * nearestpoweroftwo) {
   13364           0 :             nearestpoweroftwo *= 2.0;
   13365             :           }
   13366           0 :           while (segmentlength < 1.5 * nearestpoweroftwo) {
   13367           0 :             nearestpoweroftwo *= 0.5;
   13368             :           }
   13369             :           /* Where do we split the segment? */
   13370           0 :           split = nearestpoweroftwo / segmentlength;
   13371           0 :           if (acutedest) {
   13372           0 :             split = 1.0 - split;
   13373             :           }
   13374             :         } else {
   13375             :           /* If we're not worried about adjacent segments, split */
   13376             :           /*   this segment in the middle.                       */
   13377           0 :           split = 0.5;
   13378             :         }
   13379             : 
   13380             :         /* Create the new vertex. */
   13381           0 :         newvertex = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   13382             :         /* Interpolate its coordinate and attributes. */
   13383           0 :         for (i = 0; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   13384           0 :           newvertex[i] = eorg[i] + split * (edest[i] - eorg[i]);
   13385             :         }
   13386             : 
   13387           0 :         if (!b->noexact) {
   13388             :           /* Roundoff in the above calculation may yield a `newvertex'   */
   13389             :           /*   that is not precisely collinear with `eorg' and `edest'.  */
   13390             :           /*   Improve collinearity by one step of iterative refinement. */
   13391           0 :           multiplier = counterclockwise(m, b, eorg, edest, newvertex);
   13392           0 :           divisor = ((eorg[0] - edest[0]) * (eorg[0] - edest[0]) +
   13393           0 :                      (eorg[1] - edest[1]) * (eorg[1] - edest[1]));
   13394           0 :           if ((multiplier != 0.0) && (divisor != 0.0)) {
   13395           0 :             multiplier = multiplier / divisor;
   13396             :             /* Watch out for NANs. */
   13397           0 :             if (multiplier == multiplier) {
   13398           0 :               newvertex[0] += multiplier * (edest[1] - eorg[1]);
   13399           0 :               newvertex[1] += multiplier * (eorg[0] - edest[0]);
   13400             :             }
   13401             :           }
   13402             :         }
   13403             : 
   13404           0 :         setvertexmark(newvertex, mark(currentenc));
   13405           0 :         setvertextype(newvertex, SEGMENTVERTEX);
   13406           0 :         if (b->verbose > 1) {
   13407           0 :           printf(
   13408             :   "  Splitting subsegment (%.12g, %.12g) (%.12g, %.12g) at (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   13409           0 :                  eorg[0], eorg[1], edest[0], edest[1],
   13410           0 :                  newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   13411             :         }
   13412             :         /* Check whether the new vertex lies on an endpoint. */
   13413           0 :         if (((newvertex[0] == eorg[0]) && (newvertex[1] == eorg[1])) ||
   13414           0 :             ((newvertex[0] == edest[0]) && (newvertex[1] == edest[1]))) {
   13415           0 :           printf("Error:  Ran out of precision at (%.12g, %.12g).\n",
   13416           0 :                  newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   13417           0 :           printf("I attempted to split a segment to a smaller size than\n");
   13418           0 :           printf("  can be accommodated by the finite precision of\n");
   13419           0 :           printf("  floating point arithmetic.\n");
   13420           0 :           precisionerror();
   13421           0 :           triexit(1);
   13422             :         }
   13423             :         /* Insert the splitting vertex.  This should always succeed. */
   13424           0 :         success = insertvertex(m, b, newvertex, &enctri, &currentenc,
   13425             :                                1, triflaws);
   13426           0 :         if ((success != SUCCESSFULVERTEX) && (success != ENCROACHINGVERTEX)) {
   13427           0 :           printf("Internal error in splitencsegs():\n");
   13428           0 :           printf("  Failure to split a segment.\n");
   13429           0 :           internalerror();
   13430             :         }
   13431           0 :         if (m->steinerleft > 0) {
   13432           0 :           m->steinerleft--;
   13433             :         }
   13434             :         /* Check the two new subsegments to see if they're encroached. */
   13435           0 :         dummy = checkseg4encroach(m, b, &currentenc);
   13436           0 :         snextself(currentenc);
   13437           0 :         dummy = checkseg4encroach(m, b, &currentenc);
   13438             :       }
   13439             : 
   13440           0 :       badsubsegdealloc(m, encloop);
   13441           0 :       encloop = badsubsegtraverse(m);
   13442             :     }
   13443             :   }
   13444           0 : }

   13446             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */

   13449             : /*                                                                           */
   13450             : /*  tallyfaces()   Test every triangle in the mesh for quality measures.     */

   13483             : /*                                                                           */
   13484             : /*  splittriangle()   Inserts a vertex at the circumcenter of a triangle.    */
   13485             : /*                    Deletes the newly inserted vertex if it encroaches     */
   13486             : /*                    upon a segment.                                        */
   13487             : /*                                                                           */
   13488             : /*****************************************************************************/

   13490             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY

   13546           0 :                               + eta * (bapex[i] - borg[i]);
   13547             :       }
   13548             :       /* The new vertex must be in the interior, and therefore is a */
   13549             :       /*   free vertex with a marker of zero.                       */

   13551           0 :       setvertextype(newvertex, FREEVERTEX);
   13552             : 
   13553             :       /* Ensure that the handle `badotri' does not represent the longest  */
   13554             :       /*   edge of the triangle.  This ensures that the circumcenter must */
   13555             :       /*   fall to the left of this edge, so point location will work.    */
   13556             :       /*   (If the angle org-apex-dest exceeds 90 degrees, then the       */
   13557             :       /*   circumcenter lies outside the org-dest edge, and eta is        */

   13559             :       /*   negative when it should be, so I test eta against xi.)         */

   13613             : /*                                                                           */

   13710             : /**                                                                         **/
   13711             : /**                                                                         **/

   13714             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13715             : /*                                                                           */
   13716             : /*  highorder()   Create extra nodes for quadratic subparametric elements.   */
   13717             : /*                                                                           */
   13718             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13719             : 
   13720             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   13721             : void highorder(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   13722             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13723           0 : void highorder(m, b)
   13724             : struct mesh *m;
   13725             : struct behavior *b;
   13726             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13727             : 
   13728             : {
   13729             :   struct otri triangleloop, trisym;
   13730             :   struct osub checkmark;
   13731             :   vertex newvertex;
   13732             :   vertex torg, tdest;
   13733             :   int i;
   13734             :   triangle ptr;                         /* Temporary variable used by sym(). */
   13735             :   subseg sptr;                      /* Temporary variable used by tspivot(). */
   13736             : 
   13737           0 :   if (!b->quiet) {
   13738           0 :     printf("Adding vertices for second-order triangles.\n");
   13739             :   }
   13740             :   /* The following line ensures that dead items in the pool of nodes    */
   13741             :   /*   cannot be allocated for the extra nodes associated with high     */
   13742             :   /*   order elements.  This ensures that the primary nodes (at the     */
   13743             :   /*   corners of elements) will occur earlier in the output files, and */
   13744             :   /*   have lower indices, than the extra nodes.                        */
   13745           0 :   m->vertices.deaditemstack = (VOID *) NULL;
   13746             : 
   13747           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   13748           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   13749             :   /* To loop over the set of edges, loop over all triangles, and look at   */
   13750             :   /*   the three edges of each triangle.  If there isn't another triangle  */
   13751             :   /*   adjacent to the edge, operate on the edge.  If there is another     */
   13752             :   /*   adjacent triangle, operate on the edge only if the current triangle */
   13753             :   /*   has a smaller pointer than its neighbor.  This way, each edge is    */
   13754             :   /*   considered only once.                                               */
   13755           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   13756           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
   13757           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
   13758           0 :       sym(triangleloop, trisym);
   13759           0 :       if ((triangleloop.tri < trisym.tri) || (trisym.tri == m->dummytri)) {
   13760           0 :         org(triangleloop, torg);
   13761           0 :         dest(triangleloop, tdest);
   13762             :         /* Create a new node in the middle of the edge.  Interpolate */
   13763             :         /*   its attributes.                                         */
   13764           0 :         newvertex = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   13765           0 :         for (i = 0; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   13766           0 :           newvertex[i] = 0.5 * (torg[i] + tdest[i]);
   13767             :         }
   13768             :         /* Set the new node's marker to zero or one, depending on */
   13769             :         /*   whether it lies on a boundary.                       */
   13770           0 :         setvertexmark(newvertex, trisym.tri == m->dummytri);
   13771           0 :         setvertextype(newvertex,
   13772             :                       trisym.tri == m->dummytri ? FREEVERTEX : SEGMENTVERTEX);

   13774           0 :           tspivot(triangleloop, checkmark);
   13775             :           /* If this edge is a segment, transfer the marker to the new node. */
   13776           0 :           if (checkmark.ss != m->dummysub) {
   13777           0 :             setvertexmark(newvertex, mark(checkmark));
   13778           0 :             setvertextype(newvertex, SEGMENTVERTEX);
   13779             :           }
   13780             :         }

   13782           0 :           printf("  Creating (%.12g, %.12g).\n", newvertex[0], newvertex[1]);
   13783             :         }
   13784             :         /* Record the new node in the (one or two) adjacent elements. */
   13785           0 :         triangleloop.tri[m->highorderindex + triangleloop.orient] =
