   13796             : /********* File I/O routines begin here                              *********/
   13797             : /**                                                                         **/
   13798             : /**                                                                         **/
   13799             : 
   13800             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13801             : /*                                                                           */
   13802             : /*  readline()   Read a nonempty line from a file.                           */
   13803             : /*                                                                           */
   13804             : /*  A line is considered "nonempty" if it contains something that looks like */
   13805             : /*  a number.  Comments (prefaced by `#') are ignored.                       */
   13806             : /*                                                                           */
   13807             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13808             : 
   13809             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   13810             : 
   13811             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   13812             : char *readline(char *string, FILE *infile, char *infilename)
   13813             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13814             : char *readline(string, infile, infilename)
   13815             : char *string;
   13816             : FILE *infile;
   13817             : char *infilename;
   13818             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13819             : 
   13820             : {
   13821             :   char *result;
   13822             : 
   13823             :   /* Search for something that looks like a number. */
   13824             :   do {
   13825             :     result = fgets(string, INPUTLINESIZE, infile);
   13826             :     if (result == (char *) NULL) {
   13827             :       printf("  Error:  Unexpected end of file in %s.\n", infilename);
   13828             :       triexit(1);
   13829             :     }
   13830             :     /* Skip anything that doesn't look like a number, a comment, */
   13831             :     /*   or the end of a line.                                   */
   13832             :     while ((*result != '\0') && (*result != '#')
   13833             :            && (*result != '.') && (*result != '+') && (*result != '-')
   13834             :            && ((*result < '0') || (*result > '9'))) {
   13835             :       result++;
   13836             :     }
   13837             :   /* If it's a comment or end of line, read another line and try again. */
   13838             :   } while ((*result == '#') || (*result == '\0'));
   13839             :   return result;
   13840             : }
   13841             : 
   13842             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   13843             : 
   13844             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13845             : /*                                                                           */
   13846             : /*  findfield()   Find the next field of a string.                           */
   13847             : /*                                                                           */
   13848             : /*  Jumps past the current field by searching for whitespace, then jumps     */
   13849             : /*  past the whitespace to find the next field.                              */
   13850             : /*                                                                           */
   13851             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13852             : 
   13853             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   13854             : 
   13855             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   13856             : char *findfield(char *string)
   13857             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13858             : char *findfield(string)
   13859             : char *string;
   13860             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13861             : 
   13862             : {
   13863             :   char *result;
   13864             : 
   13865             :   result = string;
   13866             :   /* Skip the current field.  Stop upon reaching whitespace. */
   13867             :   while ((*result != '\0') && (*result != '#')
   13868             :          && (*result != ' ') && (*result != '\t')) {
   13869             :     result++;
   13870             :   }
   13871             :   /* Now skip the whitespace and anything else that doesn't look like a */
   13872             :   /*   number, a comment, or the end of a line.                         */
   13873             :   while ((*result != '\0') && (*result != '#')
   13874             :          && (*result != '.') && (*result != '+') && (*result != '-')
   13875             :          && ((*result < '0') || (*result > '9'))) {
   13876             :     result++;
   13877             :   }
   13878             :   /* Check for a comment (prefixed with `#'). */
   13879             :   if (*result == '#') {
   13880             :     *result = '\0';
   13881             :   }
   13882             :   return result;
   13883             : }
   13884             : 
   13885             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   13886             : 
   13887             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13888             : /*                                                                           */
   13889             : /*  readnodes()   Read the vertices from a file, which may be a .node or     */
   13890             : /*                .poly file.                                                */
   13891             : /*                                                                           */
   13892             : /*****************************************************************************/
   13893             : 
   13894             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   13895             : 
   13896             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   13897             : void readnodes(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, char *nodefilename,
   13898             :                char *polyfilename, FILE **polyfile)
   13899             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13900             : void readnodes(m, b, nodefilename, polyfilename, polyfile)
   13901             : struct mesh *m;
   13902             : struct behavior *b;
   13903             : char *nodefilename;
   13904             : char *polyfilename;
   13905             : FILE **polyfile;
   13906             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   13907             : 
   13908             : {
   13909             :   FILE *infile;
   13910             :   vertex vertexloop;
   13911             :   char inputline[INPUTLINESIZE];
   13912             :   char *stringptr;
   13913             :   char *infilename;
   13914             :   REAL x, y;
   13915             :   int firstnode;
   13916             :   int nodemarkers;
   13917             :   int currentmarker;
   13918             :   int i, j;
   13919             : 
   13920             :   if (b->poly) {
   13921             :     /* Read the vertices from a .poly file. */
   13922             :     if (!b->quiet) {
   13923             :       printf("Opening %s.\n", polyfilename);
   13924             :     }
   13925             :     *polyfile = fopen(polyfilename, "r");
   13926             :     if (*polyfile == (FILE *) NULL) {
   13927             :       printf("  Error:  Cannot access file %s.\n", polyfilename);
   13928             :       triexit(1);
   13929             :     }
   13930             :     /* Read number of vertices, number of dimensions, number of vertex */
   13931             :     /*   attributes, and number of boundary markers.                   */
   13932             :     stringptr = readline(inputline, *polyfile, polyfilename);
   13933             :     m->invertices = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13934             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13935             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13936             :       m->mesh_dim = 2;
   13937             :     } else {
   13938             :       m->mesh_dim = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13939             :     }
   13940             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13941             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13942             :       m->nextras = 0;
   13943             :     } else {
   13944             :       m->nextras = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13945             :     }
   13946             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13947             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13948             :       nodemarkers = 0;
   13949             :     } else {
   13950             :       nodemarkers = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13951             :     }
   13952             :     if (m->invertices > 0) {
   13953             :       infile = *polyfile;
   13954             :       infilename = polyfilename;
   13955             :       m->readnodefile = 0;
   13956             :     } else {
   13957             :       /* If the .poly file claims there are zero vertices, that means that */
   13958             :       /*   the vertices should be read from a separate .node file.         */
   13959             :       m->readnodefile = 1;
   13960             :       infilename = nodefilename;
   13961             :     }
   13962             :   } else {
   13963             :     m->readnodefile = 1;
   13964             :     infilename = nodefilename;
   13965             :     *polyfile = (FILE *) NULL;
   13966             :   }
   13967             : 
   13968             :   if (m->readnodefile) {
   13969             :     /* Read the vertices from a .node file. */
   13970             :     if (!b->quiet) {
   13971             :       printf("Opening %s.\n", nodefilename);
   13972             :     }
   13973             :     infile = fopen(nodefilename, "r");
   13974             :     if (infile == (FILE *) NULL) {
   13975             :       printf("  Error:  Cannot access file %s.\n", nodefilename);
   13976             :       triexit(1);
   13977             :     }
   13978             :     /* Read number of vertices, number of dimensions, number of vertex */
   13979             :     /*   attributes, and number of boundary markers.                   */
   13980             :     stringptr = readline(inputline, infile, nodefilename);
   13981             :     m->invertices = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13982             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13983             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13984             :       m->mesh_dim = 2;
   13985             :     } else {
   13986             :       m->mesh_dim = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13987             :     }
   13988             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13989             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13990             :       m->nextras = 0;
   13991             :     } else {
   13992             :       m->nextras = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13993             :     }
   13994             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   13995             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   13996             :       nodemarkers = 0;
   13997             :     } else {
   13998             :       nodemarkers = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   13999             :     }
   14000             :   }
   14001             : 
   14002             :   if (m->invertices < 3) {
   14003             :     printf("Error:  Input must have at least three input vertices.\n");
   14004             :     triexit(1);
   14005             :   }
   14006             :   if (m->mesh_dim != 2) {
   14007             :     printf("Error:  Triangle only works with two-dimensional meshes.\n");
   14008             :     triexit(1);
   14009             :   }
   14010             :   if (m->nextras == 0) {
   14011             :     b->weighted = 0;
   14012             :   }
   14013             : 
   14014             :   initializevertexpool(m, b);
   14015             : 
   14016             :   /* Read the vertices. */
   14017             :   for (i = 0; i < m->invertices; i++) {
   14018             :     vertexloop = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   14019             :     stringptr = readline(inputline, infile, infilename);
   14020             :     if (i == 0) {
   14021             :       firstnode = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   14022             :       if ((firstnode == 0) || (firstnode == 1)) {
   14023             :         b->firstnumber = firstnode;
   14024             :       }
   14025             :     }
   14026             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14027             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14028             :       printf("Error:  Vertex %d has no x coordinate.\n", b->firstnumber + i);
   14029             :       triexit(1);
   14030             :     }
   14031             :     x = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14032             :     stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14033             :     if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14034             :       printf("Error:  Vertex %d has no y coordinate.\n", b->firstnumber + i);
   14035             :       triexit(1);
   14036             :     }
   14037             :     y = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14038             :     vertexloop[0] = x;
   14039             :     vertexloop[1] = y;
   14040             :     /* Read the vertex attributes. */
   14041             :     for (j = 2; j < 2 + m->nextras; j++) {
   14042             :       stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14043             :       if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14044             :         vertexloop[j] = 0.0;
   14045             :       } else {
   14046             :         vertexloop[j] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14047             :       }
   14048             :     }
   14049             :     if (nodemarkers) {
   14050             :       /* Read a vertex marker. */
   14051             :       stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14052             :       if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14053             :         setvertexmark(vertexloop, 0);
   14054             :       } else {
   14055             :         currentmarker = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   14056             :         setvertexmark(vertexloop, currentmarker);
   14057             :       }
   14058             :     } else {
   14059             :       /* If no markers are specified in the file, they default to zero. */
   14060             :       setvertexmark(vertexloop, 0);
   14061             :     }
   14062             :     setvertextype(vertexloop, INPUTVERTEX);
   14063             :     /* Determine the smallest and largest x and y coordinates. */
   14064             :     if (i == 0) {
   14065             :       m->xmin = m->xmax = x;
   14066             :       m->ymin = m->ymax = y;
   14067             :     } else {
   14068             :       m->xmin = (x < m->xmin) ? x : m->xmin;
   14069             :       m->xmax = (x > m->xmax) ? x : m->xmax;
   14070             :       m->ymin = (y < m->ymin) ? y : m->ymin;
   14071             :       m->ymax = (y > m->ymax) ? y : m->ymax;
   14072             :     }
   14073             :   }
   14074             :   if (m->readnodefile) {
   14075             :     fclose(infile);
   14076             :   }
   14077             : 
   14078             :   /* Nonexistent x value used as a flag to mark circle events in sweepline */
   14079             :   /*   Delaunay algorithm.                                                 */
   14080             :   m->xminextreme = 10 * m->xmin - 9 * m->xmax;
   14081             : }
   14082             : 
   14083             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14084             : 
   14085             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14086             : /*                                                                           */
   14087             : /*  transfernodes()   Read the vertices from memory.                         */
   14088             : /*                                                                           */
   14089             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14090             : 
   14091             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14092             : 
   14093             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14094             : void transfernodes(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, REAL *pointlist,
   14095             :                    REAL *pointattriblist, int *pointmarkerlist,
   14096             :                    int numberofpoints, int numberofpointattribs)
   14097             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14098           0 : void transfernodes(m, b, pointlist, pointattriblist, pointmarkerlist,
   14099             :                    numberofpoints, numberofpointattribs)
   14100             : struct mesh *m;
   14101             : struct behavior *b;
   14102             : REAL *pointlist;
   14103             : REAL *pointattriblist;
   14104             : int *pointmarkerlist;
   14105             : int numberofpoints;
   14106             : int numberofpointattribs;
   14107             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14108             : 
   14109             : {
   14110             :   vertex vertexloop;
   14111             :   REAL x, y;
   14112             :   int i, j;
   14113             :   int coordindex;
   14114             :   int attribindex;
   14115             : 
   14116           0 :   m->invertices = numberofpoints;
   14117           0 :   m->mesh_dim = 2;
   14118           0 :   m->nextras = numberofpointattribs;
   14119           0 :   m->readnodefile = 0;
   14120           0 :   if (m->invertices < 3) {
   14121           0 :     printf("Error:  Input must have at least three input vertices.\n");
   14122           0 :     triexit(1);
   14123             :   }
   14124           0 :   if (m->nextras == 0) {
   14125           0 :     b->weighted = 0;
   14126             :   }
   14127             : 
   14128           0 :   initializevertexpool(m, b);
   14129             : 
   14130             :   /* Read the vertices. */
   14131           0 :   coordindex = 0;
   14132           0 :   attribindex = 0;
   14133           0 :   for (i = 0; i < m->invertices; i++) {
   14134           0 :     vertexloop = (vertex) poolalloc(&m->vertices);
   14135             :     /* Read the vertex coordinates. */
   14136           0 :     x = vertexloop[0] = pointlist[coordindex++];
   14137           0 :     y = vertexloop[1] = pointlist[coordindex++];
   14138             :     /* Read the vertex attributes. */
   14139           0 :     for (j = 0; j < numberofpointattribs; j++) {
   14140           0 :       vertexloop[2 + j] = pointattriblist[attribindex++];
   14141             :     }
   14142           0 :     if (pointmarkerlist != (int *) NULL) {
   14143             :       /* Read a vertex marker. */
   14144           0 :       setvertexmark(vertexloop, pointmarkerlist[i]);
   14145             :     } else {
   14146             :       /* If no markers are specified, they default to zero. */
   14147           0 :       setvertexmark(vertexloop, 0);
   14148             :     }
   14149           0 :     setvertextype(vertexloop, INPUTVERTEX);
   14150             :     /* Determine the smallest and largest x and y coordinates. */
   14151           0 :     if (i == 0) {
   14152           0 :       m->xmin = m->xmax = x;
   14153           0 :       m->ymin = m->ymax = y;
   14154             :     } else {
   14155           0 :       m->xmin = (x < m->xmin) ? x : m->xmin;
   14156           0 :       m->xmax = (x > m->xmax) ? x : m->xmax;
   14157           0 :       m->ymin = (y < m->ymin) ? y : m->ymin;
   14158           0 :       m->ymax = (y > m->ymax) ? y : m->ymax;
   14159             :     }
   14160             :   }
   14161             : 
   14162             :   /* Nonexistent x value used as a flag to mark circle events in sweepline */
   14163             :   /*   Delaunay algorithm.                                                 */
   14164           0 :   m->xminextreme = 10 * m->xmin - 9 * m->xmax;
   14165           0 : }
   14166             : 
   14167             : #endif /* TRILIBRARY */
   14168             : 
   14169             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14170             : /*                                                                           */
   14171             : /*  readholes()   Read the holes, and possibly regional attributes and area  */
   14172             : /*                constraints, from a .poly file.                            */
   14173             : /*                                                                           */
   14174             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14175             : 
   14176             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   14177             : 
   14178             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14179             : void readholes(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b,
   14180             :                FILE *polyfile, char *polyfilename, REAL **hlist, int *holes,
   14181             :                REAL **rlist, int *regions)
   14182             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14183             : void readholes(m, b, polyfile, polyfilename, hlist, holes, rlist, regions)
   14184             : struct mesh *m;
   14185             : struct behavior *b;
   14186             : FILE *polyfile;
   14187             : char *polyfilename;
   14188             : REAL **hlist;
   14189             : int *holes;
   14190             : REAL **rlist;
   14191             : int *regions;
   14192             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14193             : 
   14194             : {
   14195             :   REAL *holelist;
   14196             :   REAL *regionlist;
   14197             :   char inputline[INPUTLINESIZE];
   14198             :   char *stringptr;
   14199             :   int index;
   14200             :   int i;
   14201             : 
   14202             :   /* Read the holes. */
   14203             :   stringptr = readline(inputline, polyfile, polyfilename);
   14204             :   *holes = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   14205             :   if (*holes > 0) {
   14206             :     holelist = (REAL *) trimalloc(2 * *holes * (int) sizeof(REAL));
   14207             :     *hlist = holelist;
   14208             :     for (i = 0; i < 2 * *holes; i += 2) {
   14209             :       stringptr = readline(inputline, polyfile, polyfilename);
   14210             :       stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14211             :       if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14212             :         printf("Error:  Hole %d has no x coordinate.\n",
   14213             :                b->firstnumber + (i >> 1));
   14214             :         triexit(1);
   14215             :       } else {
   14216             :         holelist[i] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14217             :       }
   14218             :       stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14219             :       if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14220             :         printf("Error:  Hole %d has no y coordinate.\n",
   14221             :                b->firstnumber + (i >> 1));
   14222             :         triexit(1);
   14223             :       } else {
   14224             :         holelist[i + 1] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14225             :       }
   14226             :     }
   14227             :   } else {
   14228             :     *hlist = (REAL *) NULL;
   14229             :   }
   14230             : 
   14231             : #ifndef CDT_ONLY
   14232             :   if ((b->regionattrib || b->vararea) && !b->refine) {
   14233             :     /* Read the area constraints. */
   14234             :     stringptr = readline(inputline, polyfile, polyfilename);
   14235             :     *regions = (int) strtol(stringptr, &stringptr, 0);
   14236             :     if (*regions > 0) {
   14237             :       regionlist = (REAL *) trimalloc(4 * *regions * (int) sizeof(REAL));
   14238             :       *rlist = regionlist;
   14239             :       index = 0;
   14240             :       for (i = 0; i < *regions; i++) {
   14241             :         stringptr = readline(inputline, polyfile, polyfilename);
   14242             :         stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14243             :         if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14244             :           printf("Error:  Region %d has no x coordinate.\n",
   14245             :                  b->firstnumber + i);
   14246             :           triexit(1);
   14247             :         } else {
   14248             :           regionlist[index++] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14249             :         }
   14250             :         stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14251             :         if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14252             :           printf("Error:  Region %d has no y coordinate.\n",
   14253             :                  b->firstnumber + i);
   14254             :           triexit(1);
   14255             :         } else {
   14256             :           regionlist[index++] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14257             :         }
   14258             :         stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14259             :         if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14260             :           printf(
   14261             :             "Error:  Region %d has no region attribute or area constraint.\n",
   14262             :                  b->firstnumber + i);
   14263             :           triexit(1);
   14264             :         } else {
   14265             :           regionlist[index++] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14266             :         }
   14267             :         stringptr = findfield(stringptr);
   14268             :         if (*stringptr == '\0') {
   14269             :           regionlist[index] = regionlist[index - 1];
   14270             :         } else {
   14271             :           regionlist[index] = (REAL) strtod(stringptr, &stringptr);
   14272             :         }
   14273             :         index++;
   14274             :       }
   14275             :     }
   14276             :   } else {
   14277             :     /* Set `*regions' to zero to avoid an accidental free() later. */
   14278             :     *regions = 0;
   14279             :     *rlist = (REAL *) NULL;
   14280             :   }
   14281             : #endif /* not CDT_ONLY */
   14282             : 
   14283             :   fclose(polyfile);
   14284             : }
   14285             : 
   14286             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14287             : 
   14288             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14289             : /*                                                                           */
   14290             : /*  finishfile()   Write the command line to the output file so the user     */
   14291             : /*                 can remember how the file was generated.  Close the file. */
   14292             : /*                                                                           */
   14293             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14294             : 
   14295             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   14296             : 
   14297             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14298             : void finishfile(FILE *outfile, int argc, char **argv)
   14299             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14300             : void finishfile(outfile, argc, argv)
   14301             : FILE *outfile;
   14302             : int argc;
   14303             : char **argv;
   14304             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14305             : 
   14306             : {
   14307             :   int i;
   14308             : 
   14309             :   fprintf(outfile, "# Generated by");
   14310             :   for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
   14311             :     fprintf(outfile, " ");
   14312             :     fputs(argv[i], outfile);
   14313             :   }
   14314             :   fprintf(outfile, "\n");
   14315             :   fclose(outfile);
   14316             : }
   14317             : 
   14318             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14319             : 
   14320             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14321             : /*                                                                           */
   14322             : /*  writenodes()   Number the vertices and write them to a .node file.       */
   14323             : /*                                                                           */
   14324             : /*  To save memory, the vertex numbers are written over the boundary markers */
   14325             : /*  after the vertices are written to a file.                                */
   14326             : /*                                                                           */
   14327             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14328             : 
   14329             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14330             : 
   14331             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14332             : void writenodes(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, REAL **pointlist,
   14333             :                 REAL **pointattriblist, int **pointmarkerlist)
   14334             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14335           0 : void writenodes(m, b, pointlist, pointattriblist, pointmarkerlist)
   14336             : struct mesh *m;
   14337             : struct behavior *b;
   14338             : REAL **pointlist;
   14339             : REAL **pointattriblist;
   14340             : int **pointmarkerlist;

   14835             :   }
   14836             :   /* Allocate memory for edges if necessary. */
   14837           0 :   if (*edgelist == (int *) NULL) {
   14838           0 :     *edgelist = (int *) trimalloc((int) (m->edges * 2 * sizeof(int)));
   14839             :   }
   14840             :   /* Allocate memory for edge markers if necessary. */
   14841           0 :   if (!b->nobound && (*edgemarkerlist == (int *) NULL)) {
   14842           0 :     *edgemarkerlist = (int *) trimalloc((int) (m->edges * sizeof(int)));
   14843             :   }
   14844           0 :   elist = *edgelist;
   14845           0 :   emlist = *edgemarkerlist;
   14846           0 :   index = 0;
   14847             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14848             :   if (!b->quiet) {
   14849             :     printf("Writing %s.\n", edgefilename);
   14850             :   }
   14851             :   outfile = fopen(edgefilename, "w");
   14852             :   if (outfile == (FILE *) NULL) {
   14853             :     printf("  Error:  Cannot create file %s.\n", edgefilename);
   14854             :     triexit(1);
   14855             :   }
   14856             :   /* Number of edges, number of boundary markers (zero or one). */
   14857             :   fprintf(outfile, "%ld  %d\n", m->edges, 1 - b->nobound);
   14858             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14859             : 
   14860           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   14861           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   14862           0 :   edgenumber = b->firstnumber;
   14863             :   /* To loop over the set of edges, loop over all triangles, and look at   */
   14864             :   /*   the three edges of each triangle.  If there isn't another triangle  */
   14865             :   /*   adjacent to the edge, operate on the edge.  If there is another     */
   14866             :   /*   adjacent triangle, operate on the edge only if the current triangle */
   14867             :   /*   has a smaller pointer than its neighbor.  This way, each edge is    */
   14868             :   /*   considered only once.                                               */
   14869           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   14870           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
   14871           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
   14872           0 :       sym(triangleloop, trisym);
   14873           0 :       if ((triangleloop.tri < trisym.tri) || (trisym.tri == m->dummytri)) {
   14874           0 :         org(triangleloop, p1);
   14875           0 :         dest(triangleloop, p2);
   14876             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14877           0 :         elist[index++] = vertexmark(p1);
   14878           0 :         elist[index++] = vertexmark(p2);
   14879             : #endif /* TRILIBRARY */
   14880           0 :         if (b->nobound) {
   14881             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   14882             :           /* Edge number, indices of two endpoints. */
   14883             :           fprintf(outfile, "%4ld   %d  %d\n", edgenumber,
   14884             :                   vertexmark(p1), vertexmark(p2));
   14885             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14886             :         } else {
   14887             :           /* Edge number, indices of two endpoints, and a boundary marker. */
   14888             :           /*   If there's no subsegment, the boundary marker is zero.      */
   14889           0 :           if (b->usesegments) {
   14890           0 :             tspivot(triangleloop, checkmark);
   14891           0 :             if (checkmark.ss == m->dummysub) {
   14892             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14893           0 :               emlist[edgenumber - b->firstnumber] = 0;
   14894             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14895             :               fprintf(outfile, "%4ld   %d  %d  %d\n", edgenumber,
   14896             :                       vertexmark(p1), vertexmark(p2), 0);
   14897             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14898             :             } else {
   14899             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14900           0 :               emlist[edgenumber - b->firstnumber] = mark(checkmark);
   14901             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14902             :               fprintf(outfile, "%4ld   %d  %d  %d\n", edgenumber,
   14903             :                       vertexmark(p1), vertexmark(p2), mark(checkmark));
   14904             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14905             :             }
   14906             :           } else {
   14907             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14908           0 :             emlist[edgenumber - b->firstnumber] = trisym.tri == m->dummytri;
   14909             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14910             :             fprintf(outfile, "%4ld   %d  %d  %d\n", edgenumber,
   14911             :                     vertexmark(p1), vertexmark(p2), trisym.tri == m->dummytri);
   14912             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14913             :           }
   14914             :         }
   14915           0 :         edgenumber++;
   14916             :       }
   14917             :     }
   14918           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   14919             :   }
   14920             : 
   14921             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   14922             :   finishfile(outfile, argc, argv);
   14923             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14924           0 : }
   14925             : 
   14926             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14927             : /*                                                                           */
   14928             : /*  writevoronoi()   Write the Voronoi diagram to a .v.node and .v.edge      */
   14929             : /*                   file.                                                   */
   14930             : /*                                                                           */
   14931             : /*  The Voronoi diagram is the geometric dual of the Delaunay triangulation. */
   14932             : /*  Hence, the Voronoi vertices are listed by traversing the Delaunay        */
   14933             : /*  triangles, and the Voronoi edges are listed by traversing the Delaunay   */
   14934             : /*  edges.                                                                   */
   14935             : /*                                                                           */
   14936             : /*  WARNING:  In order to assign numbers to the Voronoi vertices, this       */
   14937             : /*  procedure messes up the subsegments or the extra nodes of every          */
   14938             : /*  element.  Hence, you should call this procedure last.                    */
   14939             : /*                                                                           */
   14940             : /*****************************************************************************/
   14941             : 
   14942             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14943             : 
   14944             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14945             : void writevoronoi(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, REAL **vpointlist,
   14946             :                   REAL **vpointattriblist, int **vpointmarkerlist,
   14947             :                   int **vedgelist, int **vedgemarkerlist, REAL **vnormlist)
   14948             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14949           0 : void writevoronoi(m, b, vpointlist, vpointattriblist, vpointmarkerlist,
   14950             :                   vedgelist, vedgemarkerlist, vnormlist)
   14951             : struct mesh *m;
   14952             : struct behavior *b;
   14953             : REAL **vpointlist;
   14954             : REAL **vpointattriblist;
   14955             : int **vpointmarkerlist;
   14956             : int **vedgelist;
   14957             : int **vedgemarkerlist;
   14958             : REAL **vnormlist;
   14959             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14960             : 
   14961             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   14962             : 
   14963             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   14964             : void writevoronoi(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, char *vnodefilename,
   14965             :                   char *vedgefilename, int argc, char **argv)
   14966             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   14967             : void writevoronoi(m, b, vnodefilename, vedgefilename, argc, argv)
   14968             : struct mesh *m;
   14969             : struct behavior *b;

   14974             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */

   14979             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   14980             :   REAL *plist;

   14990             :   vertex torg, tdest, tapex;
   14991             :   REAL circumcenter[2];

   14999           0 :   if (!b->quiet) {
   15000           0 :     printf("Writing Voronoi vertices.\n");
   15001             :   }

   15003           0 :   if (*vpointlist == (REAL *) NULL) {

   15005             :                                             sizeof(REAL)));
   15006             :   }

   15008           0 :   if (*vpointattriblist == (REAL *) NULL) {
   15009           0 :     *vpointattriblist = (REAL *) trimalloc((int) (m->triangles.items *
   15010           0 :                                                   m->nextras * sizeof(REAL)));
   15011             :   }
   15012           0 :   *vpointmarkerlist = (int *) NULL;
   15013           0 :   plist = *vpointlist;
   15014           0 :   palist = *vpointattriblist;
   15015           0 :   coordindex = 0;
   15016           0 :   attribindex = 0;
   15017             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15018             :   if (!b->quiet) {
   15019             :     printf("Writing %s.\n", vnodefilename);
   15020             :   }
   15021             :   outfile = fopen(vnodefilename, "w");
   15022             :   if (outfile == (FILE *) NULL) {
   15023             :     printf("  Error:  Cannot create file %s.\n", vnodefilename);
   15024             :     triexit(1);
   15025             :   }
   15026             :   /* Number of triangles, two dimensions, number of vertex attributes, */
   15027             :   /*   no markers.                                                     */
   15028             :   fprintf(outfile, "%ld  %d  %d  %d\n", m->triangles.items, 2, m->nextras, 0);
   15029             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15030             : 
   15031           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   15032           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15033           0 :   triangleloop.orient = 0;
   15034           0 :   vnodenumber = b->firstnumber;
   15035           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   15036           0 :     org(triangleloop, torg);
   15037           0 :     dest(triangleloop, tdest);
   15038           0 :     apex(triangleloop, tapex);
   15039           0 :     findcircumcenter(m, b, torg, tdest, tapex, circumcenter, &xi, &eta, 0);
   15040             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15041             :     /* X and y coordinates. */
   15042           0 :     plist[coordindex++] = circumcenter[0];
   15043           0 :     plist[coordindex++] = circumcenter[1];
   15044           0 :     for (i = 2; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   15045             :       /* Interpolate the vertex attributes at the circumcenter. */
   15046           0 :       palist[attribindex++] = torg[i] + xi * (tdest[i] - torg[i])
   15047           0 :                                      + eta * (tapex[i] - torg[i]);
   15048             :     }
   15049             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15050             :     /* Voronoi vertex number, x and y coordinates. */
   15051             :     fprintf(outfile, "%4ld    %.17g  %.17g", vnodenumber, circumcenter[0],
   15052             :             circumcenter[1]);
   15053             :     for (i = 2; i < 2 + m->nextras; i++) {
   15054             :       /* Interpolate the vertex attributes at the circumcenter. */
   15055             :       fprintf(outfile, "  %.17g", torg[i] + xi * (tdest[i] - torg[i])
   15056             :                                          + eta * (tapex[i] - torg[i]));
   15057             :     }
   15058             :     fprintf(outfile, "\n");
   15059             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */

   15094             :   }
   15095             :   /* Number of edges, zero boundary markers. */
   15096             :   fprintf(outfile, "%ld  %d\n", m->edges, 0);
   15097             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15098             : 
   15099           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   15100           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15101           0 :   vedgenumber = b->firstnumber;
   15102             :   /* To loop over the set of edges, loop over all triangles, and look at   */
   15103             :   /*   the three edges of each triangle.  If there isn't another triangle  */
   15104             :   /*   adjacent to the edge, operate on the edge.  If there is another     */
   15105             :   /*   adjacent triangle, operate on the edge only if the current triangle */
   15106             :   /*   has a smaller pointer than its neighbor.  This way, each edge is    */
   15107             :   /*   considered only once.                                               */
   15108           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   15109           0 :     for (triangleloop.orient = 0; triangleloop.orient < 3;
   15110           0 :          triangleloop.orient++) {
   15111           0 :       sym(triangleloop, trisym);
   15112           0 :       if ((triangleloop.tri < trisym.tri) || (trisym.tri == m->dummytri)) {
   15113             :         /* Find the number of this triangle (and Voronoi vertex). */
   15114           0 :         p1 = * (int *) (triangleloop.tri + 6);
   15115           0 :         if (trisym.tri == m->dummytri) {
   15116           0 :           org(triangleloop, torg);

   15119             :           /* Copy an infinite ray.  Index of one endpoint, and -1. */
   15120           0 :           elist[coordindex] = p1;
   15121           0 :           normlist[coordindex++] = tdest[1] - torg[1];
   15122           0 :           elist[coordindex] = -1;
   15123           0 :           normlist[coordindex++] = torg[0] - tdest[0];

   15125             :           /* Write an infinite ray.  Edge number, index of one endpoint, -1, */
   15126             :           /*   and x and y coordinates of a vector representing the          */
   15127             :           /*   direction of the ray.                                         */
   15128             :           fprintf(outfile, "%4ld   %d  %d   %.17g  %.17g\n", vedgenumber,
   15129             :                   p1, -1, tdest[1] - torg[1], torg[0] - tdest[0]);
   15130             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15131             :         } else {
   15132             :           /* Find the number of the adjacent triangle (and Voronoi vertex). */
   15133           0 :           p2 = * (int *) (trisym.tri + 6);
   15134             :           /* Finite edge.  Write indices of two endpoints. */
   15135             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15136           0 :           elist[coordindex] = p1;
   15137           0 :           normlist[coordindex++] = 0.0;
   15138           0 :           elist[coordindex] = p2;
   15139           0 :           normlist[coordindex++] = 0.0;
   15140             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */

   15142             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15143             :         }
   15144           0 :         vedgenumber++;
   15145             :       }
   15146             :     }
   15147           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15148             :   }
   15149             : 
   15150             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   15151             :   finishfile(outfile, argc, argv);
   15152             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15153           0 : }
   15154             :

   15159             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */

   15161             : struct mesh *m;

   15164             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15165             : 
   15166             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15167             :

   15169             : void writeneighbors(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, char *neighborfilename,
   15170             :                     int argc, char **argv)
   15171             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */

   15173             : struct mesh *m;
   15174             : struct behavior *b;

   15260             : 
   15261             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15262             : /*                                                                           */
   15263             : /*  writeoff()   Write the triangulation to an .off file.                    */
   15264             : /*                                                                           */
   15265             : /*  OFF stands for the Object File Format, a format used by the Geometry     */
   15266             : /*  Center's Geomview package.                                               */
   15267             : /*                                                                           */
   15268             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15269             : 
   15270             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   15271             : 
   15272             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   15273             : void writeoff(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b, char *offfilename,
   15274             :               int argc, char **argv)
   15275             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15276             : void writeoff(m, b, offfilename, argc, argv)
   15277             : struct mesh *m;
   15278             : struct behavior *b;
   15279             : char *offfilename;
   15280             : int argc;
   15281             : char **argv;
   15282             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15283             : 
   15284             : {
   15285             :   FILE *outfile;
   15286             :   struct otri triangleloop;
   15287             :   vertex vertexloop;
   15288             :   vertex p1, p2, p3;
   15289             :   ptrdiff_t  outvertices;
   15290             : 
   15291             :   if (!b->quiet) {
   15292             :     printf("Writing %s.\n", offfilename);
   15293             :   }
   15294             : 
   15295             :   if (b->jettison) {
   15296             :     outvertices = m->vertices.items - m->undeads;
   15297             :   } else {
   15298             :     outvertices = m->vertices.items;
   15299             :   }
   15300             : 
   15301             :   outfile = fopen(offfilename, "w");
   15302             :   if (outfile == (FILE *) NULL) {
   15303             :     printf("  Error:  Cannot create file %s.\n", offfilename);
   15304             :     triexit(1);
   15305             :   }
   15306             :   /* Number of vertices, triangles, and edges. */
   15307             :   fprintf(outfile, "OFF\n%ld  %ld  %ld\n", outvertices, m->triangles.items,
   15308             :           m->edges);
   15309             : 
   15310             :   /* Write the vertices. */
   15311             :   traversalinit(&m->vertices);
   15312             :   vertexloop = vertextraverse(m);
   15313             :   while (vertexloop != (vertex) NULL) {
   15314             :     if (!b->jettison || (vertextype(vertexloop) != UNDEADVERTEX)) {
   15315             :       /* The "0.0" is here because the OFF format uses 3D coordinates. */
   15316             :       fprintf(outfile, " %.17g  %.17g  %.17g\n", vertexloop[0], vertexloop[1],
   15317             :               0.0);
   15318             :     }
   15319             :     vertexloop = vertextraverse(m);
   15320             :   }
   15321             : 
   15322             :   /* Write the triangles. */
   15323             :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   15324             :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15325             :   triangleloop.orient = 0;
   15326             :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   15327             :     org(triangleloop, p1);
   15328             :     dest(triangleloop, p2);
   15329             :     apex(triangleloop, p3);
   15330             :     /* The "3" means a three-vertex polygon. */
   15331             :     fprintf(outfile, " 3   %4d  %4d  %4d\n", vertexmark(p1) - b->firstnumber,
   15332             :             vertexmark(p2) - b->firstnumber, vertexmark(p3) - b->firstnumber);
   15333             :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15334             :   }
   15335             :   finishfile(outfile, argc, argv);
   15336             : }
   15337             : 
   15338             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15339             : 
   15340             : /**                                                                         **/
   15341             : /**                                                                         **/
   15342             : /********* File I/O routines end here                                *********/
   15343             : 
   15344             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15345             : /*                                                                           */
   15346             : /*  quality_statistics()   Print statistics about the quality of the mesh.   */
   15347             : /*                                                                           */
   15348             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15349             : 
   15350             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   15351             : void quality_statistics(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   15352             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15353           0 : void quality_statistics(m, b)
   15354             : struct mesh *m;
   15355             : struct behavior *b;
   15356             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15357             : 
   15358             : {
   15359             :   struct otri triangleloop;
   15360             :   vertex p[3];
   15361             :   REAL cossquaretable[8];
   15362             :   REAL ratiotable[16];
   15363             :   REAL dx[3], dy[3];
   15364             :   REAL edgelength[3];
   15365             :   REAL dotproduct;
   15366             :   REAL cossquare;
   15367             :   REAL triarea;
   15368             :   REAL shortest, longest;
   15369             :   REAL trilongest2;
   15370             :   REAL smallestarea, biggestarea;
   15371             :   REAL triminaltitude2;
   15372             :   REAL minaltitude;
   15373             :   REAL triaspect2;
   15374             :   REAL worstaspect;
   15375             :   REAL smallestangle, biggestangle;
   15376             :   REAL radconst, degconst;
   15377             :   int angletable[18];
   15378             :   int aspecttable[16];
   15379             :   int aspectindex;
   15380             :   int tendegree;
   15381             :   int acutebiggest;
   15382             :   int i, ii, j, k;
   15383             : 
   15384           0 :   printf("Mesh quality statistics:\n\n");
   15385           0 :   radconst = PI / 18.0;
   15386           0 :   degconst = 180.0 / PI;
   15387           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
   15388           0 :     cossquaretable[i] = cos(radconst * (REAL) (i + 1));
   15389           0 :     cossquaretable[i] = cossquaretable[i] * cossquaretable[i];
   15390             :   }
   15391           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 18; i++) {
   15392           0 :     angletable[i] = 0;
   15393             :   }
   15394             : 
   15395           0 :   ratiotable[0]  =      1.5;      ratiotable[1]  =     2.0;
   15396           0 :   ratiotable[2]  =      2.5;      ratiotable[3]  =     3.0;
   15397           0 :   ratiotable[4]  =      4.0;      ratiotable[5]  =     6.0;
   15398           0 :   ratiotable[6]  =     10.0;      ratiotable[7]  =    15.0;
   15399           0 :   ratiotable[8]  =     25.0;      ratiotable[9]  =    50.0;
   15400           0 :   ratiotable[10] =    100.0;      ratiotable[11] =   300.0;
   15401           0 :   ratiotable[12] =   1000.0;      ratiotable[13] = 10000.0;
   15402           0 :   ratiotable[14] = 100000.0;      ratiotable[15] =     0.0;
   15403           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
   15404           0 :     aspecttable[i] = 0;
   15405             :   }
   15406             : 
   15407           0 :   worstaspect = 0.0;
   15408           0 :   minaltitude = m->xmax - m->xmin + m->ymax - m->ymin;
   15409           0 :   minaltitude = minaltitude * minaltitude;
   15410           0 :   shortest = minaltitude;
   15411           0 :   longest = 0.0;
   15412           0 :   smallestarea = minaltitude;
   15413           0 :   biggestarea = 0.0;
   15414           0 :   worstaspect = 0.0;
   15415           0 :   smallestangle = 0.0;
   15416           0 :   biggestangle = 2.0;
   15417           0 :   acutebiggest = 1;
   15418             : 
   15419           0 :   traversalinit(&m->triangles);
   15420           0 :   triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15421           0 :   triangleloop.orient = 0;
   15422           0 :   while (triangleloop.tri != (triangle *) NULL) {
   15423           0 :     org(triangleloop, p[0]);
   15424           0 :     dest(triangleloop, p[1]);
   15425           0 :     apex(triangleloop, p[2]);
   15426           0 :     trilongest2 = 0.0;
   15427             : 
   15428           0 :     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
   15429           0 :       j = plus1mod3[i];
   15430           0 :       k = minus1mod3[i];
   15431           0 :       dx[i] = p[j][0] - p[k][0];
   15432           0 :       dy[i] = p[j][1] - p[k][1];
   15433           0 :       edgelength[i] = dx[i] * dx[i] + dy[i] * dy[i];
   15434           0 :       if (edgelength[i] > trilongest2) {
   15435           0 :         trilongest2 = edgelength[i];
   15436             :       }
   15437           0 :       if (edgelength[i] > longest) {
   15438           0 :         longest = edgelength[i];
   15439             :       }
   15440           0 :       if (edgelength[i] < shortest) {
   15441           0 :         shortest = edgelength[i];
   15442             :       }
   15443             :     }
   15444             : 
   15445           0 :     triarea = counterclockwise(m, b, p[0], p[1], p[2]);
   15446           0 :     if (triarea < smallestarea) {
   15447           0 :       smallestarea = triarea;
   15448             :     }
   15449           0 :     if (triarea > biggestarea) {
   15450           0 :       biggestarea = triarea;
   15451             :     }
   15452           0 :     triminaltitude2 = triarea * triarea / trilongest2;
   15453           0 :     if (triminaltitude2 < minaltitude) {
   15454           0 :       minaltitude = triminaltitude2;
   15455             :     }
   15456           0 :     triaspect2 = trilongest2 / triminaltitude2;
   15457           0 :     if (triaspect2 > worstaspect) {
   15458           0 :       worstaspect = triaspect2;
   15459             :     }
   15460           0 :     aspectindex = 0;
   15461           0 :     while ((triaspect2 > ratiotable[aspectindex] * ratiotable[aspectindex])
   15462           0 :            && (aspectindex < 15)) {
   15463           0 :       aspectindex++;
   15464             :     }
   15465           0 :     aspecttable[aspectindex]++;
   15466             : 
   15467           0 :     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
   15468           0 :       j = plus1mod3[i];
   15469           0 :       k = minus1mod3[i];
   15470           0 :       dotproduct = dx[j] * dx[k] + dy[j] * dy[k];
   15471           0 :       cossquare = dotproduct * dotproduct / (edgelength[j] * edgelength[k]);
   15472           0 :       tendegree = 8;
   15473           0 :       for (ii = 7; ii >= 0; ii--) {
   15474           0 :         if (cossquare > cossquaretable[ii]) {
   15475           0 :           tendegree = ii;
   15476             :         }
   15477             :       }
   15478           0 :       if (dotproduct <= 0.0) {
   15479           0 :         angletable[tendegree]++;
   15480           0 :         if (cossquare > smallestangle) {
   15481           0 :           smallestangle = cossquare;
   15482             :         }
   15483           0 :         if (acutebiggest && (cossquare < biggestangle)) {
   15484           0 :           biggestangle = cossquare;
   15485             :         }
   15486             :       } else {
   15487           0 :         angletable[17 - tendegree]++;
   15488           0 :         if (acutebiggest || (cossquare > biggestangle)) {
   15489           0 :           biggestangle = cossquare;
   15490           0 :           acutebiggest = 0;
   15491             :         }
   15492             :       }
   15493             :     }
   15494           0 :     triangleloop.tri = triangletraverse(m);
   15495             :   }
   15496             : 
   15497           0 :   shortest = sqrt(shortest);
   15498           0 :   longest = sqrt(longest);
   15499           0 :   minaltitude = sqrt(minaltitude);
   15500           0 :   worstaspect = sqrt(worstaspect);
   15501           0 :   smallestarea *= 0.5;
   15502           0 :   biggestarea *= 0.5;
   15503           0 :   if (smallestangle >= 1.0) {
   15504           0 :     smallestangle = 0.0;
   15505             :   } else {
   15506           0 :     smallestangle = degconst * acos(sqrt(smallestangle));
   15507             :   }
   15508           0 :   if (biggestangle >= 1.0) {
   15509           0 :     biggestangle = 180.0;
   15510             :   } else {
   15511           0 :     if (acutebiggest) {
   15512           0 :       biggestangle = degconst * acos(sqrt(biggestangle));
   15513             :     } else {
   15514           0 :       biggestangle = 180.0 - degconst * acos(sqrt(biggestangle));
   15515             :     }
   15516             :   }
   15517             : 
   15518           0 :   printf("  Smallest area: %16.5g   |  Largest area: %16.5g\n",
   15519             :          smallestarea, biggestarea);
   15520           0 :   printf("  Shortest edge: %16.5g   |  Longest edge: %16.5g\n",
   15521             :          shortest, longest);
   15522           0 :   printf("  Shortest altitude: %12.5g   |  Largest aspect ratio: %8.5g\n\n",
   15523             :          minaltitude, worstaspect);
   15524             : 
   15525           0 :   printf("  Triangle aspect ratio histogram:\n");
   15526           0 :   printf("  1.1547 - %-6.6g    :  %8d    | %6.6g - %-6.6g     :  %8d\n",
   15527             :          ratiotable[0], aspecttable[0], ratiotable[7], ratiotable[8],
   15528             :          aspecttable[8]);
   15529           0 :   for (i = 1; i < 7; i++) {
   15530           0 :     printf("  %6.6g - %-6.6g    :  %8d    | %6.6g - %-6.6g     :  %8d\n",

   15532           0 :            ratiotable[i + 7], ratiotable[i + 8], aspecttable[i + 8]);

   15535             :          ratiotable[6], ratiotable[7], aspecttable[7], ratiotable[14],
   15536             :          aspecttable[15]);
   15537           0 :   printf("  (Aspect ratio is longest edge divided by shortest altitude)\n\n");
   15538             : 
   15539           0 :   printf("  Smallest angle: %15.5g   |  Largest angle: %15.5g\n\n",
   15540             :          smallestangle, biggestangle);
   15541             : 
   15542           0 :   printf("  Angle histogram:\n");
   15543           0 :   for (i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
   15544           0 :     printf("    %3d - %3d degrees:  %8d    |    %3d - %3d degrees:  %8d\n",
   15545           0 :            i * 10, i * 10 + 10, angletable[i],
   15546           0 :            i * 10 + 90, i * 10 + 100, angletable[i + 9]);
   15547             :   }
   15548           0 :   printf("\n");
   15549           0 : }
   15550             : 
   15551             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15552             : /*                                                                           */
   15553             : /*  statistics()   Print all sorts of cool facts.                            */
   15554             : /*                                                                           */
   15555             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15556             : 
   15557             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   15558             : void statistics(struct mesh *m, struct behavior *b)
   15559             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15560           0 : void statistics(m, b)
   15561             : struct mesh *m;
   15562             : struct behavior *b;
   15563             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15564             : 
   15565             : {
   15566           0 :   printf("\nStatistics:\n\n");
   15567           0 :   printf("  Input vertices: %d\n", m->invertices);
   15568           0 :   if (b->refine) {
   15569           0 :     printf("  Input triangles: %d\n", m->inelements);
   15570             :   }
   15571           0 :   if (b->poly) {
   15572           0 :     printf("  Input segments: %d\n", m->insegments);
   15573           0 :     if (!b->refine) {
   15574           0 :       printf("  Input holes: %d\n", m->holes);
   15575             :     }
   15576             :   }
   15577             : 
   15578           0 :   printf("\n  Mesh vertices: %ld\n", m->vertices.items - m->undeads);
   15579           0 :   printf("  Mesh triangles: %ld\n", m->triangles.items);
   15580           0 :   printf("  Mesh edges: %ld\n", m->edges);
   15581           0 :   printf("  Mesh exterior boundary edges: %ld\n", m->hullsize);
   15582           0 :   if (b->poly || b->refine) {
   15583           0 :     printf("  Mesh interior boundary edges: %ld\n",
   15584           0 :            m->subsegs.items - m->hullsize);
   15585           0 :     printf("  Mesh subsegments (constrained edges): %ld\n",
   15586             :            m->subsegs.items);
   15587             :   }
   15588           0 :   printf("\n");
   15589             : 
   15590           0 :   if (b->verbose) {
   15591           0 :     quality_statistics(m, b);
   15592           0 :     printf("Memory allocation statistics:\n\n");
   15593           0 :     printf("  Maximum number of vertices: %ld\n", m->vertices.maxitems);
   15594           0 :     printf("  Maximum number of triangles: %ld\n", m->triangles.maxitems);
   15595           0 :     if (m->subsegs.maxitems > 0) {
   15596           0 :       printf("  Maximum number of subsegments: %ld\n", m->subsegs.maxitems);
   15597             :     }
   15598           0 :     if (m->viri.maxitems > 0) {
   15599           0 :       printf("  Maximum number of viri: %ld\n", m->viri.maxitems);
   15600             :     }
   15601           0 :     if (m->badsubsegs.maxitems > 0) {
   15602           0 :       printf("  Maximum number of encroached subsegments: %ld\n",
   15603             :              m->badsubsegs.maxitems);
   15604             :     }
   15605           0 :     if (m->badtriangles.maxitems > 0) {
   15606           0 :       printf("  Maximum number of bad triangles: %ld\n",
   15607             :              m->badtriangles.maxitems);
   15608             :     }
   15609           0 :     if (m->flipstackers.maxitems > 0) {

   15636             :              m->hyperbolacount);

   15639           0 :       printf("  Number of circle top computations: %ld\n",
   15640             :              m->circletopcount);
   15641             :     }

   15643           0 :       printf("  Number of triangle circumcenter computations: %ld\n",
   15644             :              m->circumcentercount);
   15645             :     }
   15646           0 :     printf("\n");
   15647             :   }
   15648           0 : }
   15649             : 
   15650             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15651             : /*                                                                           */
   15652             : /*  main() or triangulate()   Gosh, do everything.                           */
   15653             : /*                                                                           */
   15654             : /*  The sequence is roughly as follows.  Many of these steps can be skipped, */
   15655             : /*  depending on the command line switches.                                  */
   15656             : /*                                                                           */
   15657             : /*  - Initialize constants and parse the command line.                       */
   15658             : /*  - Read the vertices from a file and either                               */
   15659             : /*    - triangulate them (no -r), or                                         */
   15660             : /*    - read an old mesh from files and reconstruct it (-r).                 */
   15661             : /*  - Insert the PSLG segments (-p), and possibly segments on the convex     */
   15662             : /*      hull (-c).                                                           */
   15663             : /*  - Read the holes (-p), regional attributes (-pA), and regional area      */
   15664             : /*      constraints (-pa).  Carve the holes and concavities, and spread the  */
   15665             : /*      regional attributes and area constraints.                            */
   15666             : /*  - Enforce the constraints on minimum angle (-q) and maximum area (-a).   */
   15667             : /*      Also enforce the conforming Delaunay property (-q and -a).           */
   15668             : /*  - Compute the number of edges in the resulting mesh.                     */
   15669             : /*  - Promote the mesh's linear triangles to higher order elements (-o).     */
   15670             : /*  - Write the output files and print the statistics.                       */
   15671             : /*  - Check the consistency and Delaunay property of the mesh (-C).          */
   15672             : /*                                                                           */
   15673             : /*****************************************************************************/
   15674             : 
   15675             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15676             : 
   15677             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   15678             : void triangulate(char *triswitches, struct triangulateio *in,
   15679             :                  struct triangulateio *out, struct triangulateio *vorout)
   15680             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15681           0 : void triangulate(triswitches, in, out, vorout)
   15682             : char *triswitches;
   15683             : struct triangulateio *in;
   15684             : struct triangulateio *out;
   15685             : struct triangulateio *vorout;
   15686             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15687             : 
   15688             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15689             : 
   15690             : #ifdef ANSI_DECLARATORS
   15691             : int main(int argc, char **argv)
   15692             : #else /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15693             : int main(argc, argv)
   15694             : int argc;
   15695             : char **argv;
   15696             : #endif /* not ANSI_DECLARATORS */
   15697             : 
   15698             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15699             : 
   15700             : {
   15701             :   struct mesh m;
   15702             :   struct behavior b;
   15703             :   REAL *holearray;                                        /* Array of holes. */
   15704             :   REAL *regionarray;   /* Array of regional attributes and area constraints. */
   15705             : #ifndef TRILIBRARY
   15706             :   FILE *polyfile;
   15707             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15708             : #ifndef NO_TIMER
   15709             :   /* Variables for timing the performance of Triangle.  The types are */
   15710             :   /*   defined in sys/time.h.                                         */
   15711             :   struct timeval tv0, tv1, tv2, tv3, tv4, tv5, tv6;
   15712             :   struct timezone tz;
   15713             : #endif /* not NO_TIMER */
   15714             : 
   15715             : #ifndef NO_TIMER
   15716           0 :   gettimeofday(&tv0, &tz);
   15717             : #endif /* not NO_TIMER */
   15718             : 
   15719           0 :   triangleinit(&m);
   15720             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15721           0 :   parsecommandline(1, &triswitches, &b);
   15722             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15723             :   parsecommandline(argc, argv, &b);
   15724             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15725           0 :   m.steinerleft = b.steiner;
   15726             : 
   15727             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15728           0 :   transfernodes(&m, &b, in->pointlist, in->pointattributelist,
   15729             :                 in->pointmarkerlist, in->numberofpoints,
   15730             :                 in->numberofpointattributes);
   15731             : #else /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15732             :   readnodes(&m, &b, b.innodefilename, b.inpolyfilename, &polyfile);
   15733             : #endif /* not TRILIBRARY */
   15734             : 
   15735             : #ifndef NO_TIMER
   15736           0 :   if (!b.quiet) {
   15737           0 :     gettimeofday(&tv1, &tz);
   15738             :   }
   15739             : #endif /* not NO_TIMER */
   15740             : 
   15741             : #ifdef CDT_ONLY
   15742             :   m.hullsize = delaunay(&m, &b);                /* Triangulate the vertices. */
   15743             : #else /* not CDT_ONLY */
   15744           0 :   if (b.refine) {
   15745             :     /* Read and reconstruct a mesh. */
   15746             : #ifdef TRILIBRARY
   15747           0 :     m.hullsize = reconstruct(&m, &b, in->trianglelist,
   15748             :                              in->triangleattributelist, in->trianglearealist,
   15749             :                              in->numberoftriangles, in->numberofcorners,
   15750             :                              in->numberoftriangleattributes,
